Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles downloading and processing images with size limitations and compression capabilities.

Class Description: The Picture class is designed to download images from given URLs while enforcing size limits and compression thresholds. It uses cURL for HTTP requests and provides mechanisms to control download size and handle response data efficiently.

Attributes:
- compressLimit: [int] - The maximum size (in bytes) for downloaded content before compression is considered
- sizeLimit: [int] - The maximum dimension (in pixels) for the image width/height

Methods:
- downloadImage: [downloadImage]($url: string) -> string - Downloads an image from the specified URL while respecting size limits. Returns the image body content.
  - $url: The URL of the image to download
  - Returns: The binary content of the downloaded image
right_result:
<?php
class Picture {
    private $compressLimit;
    private $sizeLimit;

    public function __construct($compressLimit = 1048576, $sizeLimit = 2000) {
        $this->compressLimit = $compressLimit;
        $this->sizeLimit = $sizeLimit;
    }

    public function downloadImage($url) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 5);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_BUFFERSIZE, 128);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_NOPROGRESS, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROGRESSFUNCTION, function($resource, $downloadSize, $downloaded, $uploadSize, $uploaded) {
            return ($downloadSize > $this->compressLimit) ? 1 : 0;
        });

        $imageData = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($httpCode !== 200 || empty($imageData)) {
            throw new Exception("Failed to download image from URL: $url");
        }

        if (strlen($imageData) > $this->compressLimit) {
            $imageData = $this->compressImage($imageData);
        }

        return $imageData;
    }

    private function compressImage($imageData) {
        $image = imagecreatefromstring($imageData);
        if ($image === false) {
            throw new Exception("Invalid image data");
        }

        $originalWidth = imagesx($image);
        $originalHeight = imagesy($image);

        if ($originalWidth > $this->sizeLimit || $originalHeight > $this->sizeLimit) {
            $ratio = $originalWidth / $originalHeight;
            if ($ratio > 1) {
                $newWidth = $this->sizeLimit;
                $newHeight = $this->sizeLimit / $ratio;
            } else {
                $newHeight = $this->sizeLimit;
                $newWidth = $this->sizeLimit * $ratio;
            }

            $resizedImage = imagecreatetruecolor($newWidth, $newHeight);
            imagecopyresampled($resizedImage, $image, 0, 0, 0, 0, $newWidth, $newHeight, $originalWidth, $originalHeight);
            imagedestroy($image);
            $image = $resizedImage;
        }

        ob_start();
        imagejpeg($image, null, 85);
        $compressedData = ob_get_clean();
        imagedestroy($image);

        return $compressedData;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified HTTP URL using fsockopen for low-level HTTP communication, with support for proxies and basic authentication.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy), sends an HTTP GET request, reads the response, and returns the response body. It handles URL parsing, proxy configuration, timeout settings, and basic authentication. The function can either return the content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string, required) The HTTP URL to fetch
  - 'assign': (string, optional) Template variable name to assign content to
  - 'proxy_host': (string, optional) Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (int, optional) Proxy server port
  - 'timeout': (int, optional) Connection timeout in seconds (default: 30)
- $template: (object) The template object for assigning content (when 'assign' parameter is used)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if 'assign' parameter is not provided
- Assigns content to the specified template variable and returns nothing if 'assign' parameter is provided
- Returns nothing and triggers notice on error conditions (invalid URL, connection failure)
right_result:
<?php
function smarty_fetch_http($params, &$template) {
    if (!isset($params['file'])) {
        trigger_error("fetch: missing 'file' parameter", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $url = parse_url($params['file']);
    if (!isset($url['host'])) {
        trigger_error("fetch: invalid URL '" . $params['file'] . "'", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $host = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['proxy_host'] : $url['host'];
    $port = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : (isset($url['port']) ? $url['port'] : 80);
    $timeout = isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 30;
    $path = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['file'] : (isset($url['path']) ? $url['path'] : '/') . (isset($url['query']) ? '?' . $url['query'] : '');

    $auth = '';
    if (isset($url['user']) && isset($url['pass'])) {
        $auth = 'Authorization: Basic ' . base64_encode($url['user'] . ':' . $url['pass']) . "\r\n";
    }

    $fp = @fsockopen($host, $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    if (!$fp) {
        trigger_error("fetch: unable to connect to $host:$port ($errstr)", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $request = "GET $path HTTP/1.0\r\nHost: " . $url['host'] . "\r\n$auth" . "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 4096);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    $header_end = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    if ($header_end === false) {
        trigger_error("fetch: malformed response from $host:$port", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $content = substr($response, $header_end + 4);

    if (isset($params['assign'])) {
        $template->assign($params['assign'], $content);
        return;
    }

    return $content;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified URL or file path, with support for HTTP requests using fsockopen, including handling of proxy servers, authentication, and security checks.

Function Description: The function retrieves content from either a local file or a remote HTTP resource. For HTTP requests, it establishes a socket connection, sends a GET request with appropriate headers (including authentication if provided), reads the response, and extracts the content body. It includes security checks for trusted URIs and resource directories when operating within a Smarty template context.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string) Required. The URL or file path to fetch
  - 'assign': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign the content to
  - 'assign_headers': (string) Optional. Template variable name to assign headers to
  - 'user': (string) Optional. Username for HTTP authentication
  - 'pass': (string) Optional. Password for HTTP authentication
  - 'proxy_host': (string) Optional. Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (integer) Optional. Proxy server port
- $template: The Smarty template object (used for security checks and variable assignment)

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if no 'assign' parameter is provided
- Assigns the content to the specified template variable if 'assign' parameter is present
- Returns nothing if security checks fail or if there are errors in fetching the content
right_result:
<?php
function smarty_function_fetch($params, $template) {
    if (!isset($params['file'])) {
        trigger_error("fetch: missing 'file' parameter", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $file = $params['file'];
    $is_http = preg_match('!^(http|https)://!i', $file);

    if ($is_http) {
        $parts = parse_url($file);
        $host = $parts['host'];
        $port = isset($parts['port']) ? $parts['port'] : ($parts['scheme'] == 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $path = isset($parts['path']) ? $parts['path'] : '/';
        $path .= isset($parts['query']) ? '?' . $parts['query'] : '';

        $proxy_host = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['proxy_host'] : null;
        $proxy_port = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : null;

        $target_host = $proxy_host ? $proxy_host : $host;
        $target_port = $proxy_host ? $proxy_port : $port;

        $fp = @fsockopen($target_host, $target_port, $errno, $errstr, 30);
        if (!$fp) {
            trigger_error("fetch: unable to open socket to $target_host:$target_port - $errstr ($errno)", E_USER_NOTICE);
            return;
        }

        $request_path = $proxy_host ? $file : $path;
        $request = "GET $request_path HTTP/1.0\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n";

        if (isset($params['user']) && isset($params['pass'])) {
            $auth = base64_encode($params['user'] . ':' . $params['pass']);
            $request .= "Authorization: Basic $auth\r\n";
        }

        $request .= "\r\n";

        fwrite($fp, $request);
        $response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $response .= fgets($fp, 4096);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        list($headers, $content) = preg_split('!\r?\n\r?\n!', $response, 2);
        $headers_array = array();
        foreach (explode("\r\n", $headers) as $header_line) {
            if (preg_match('!^HTTP/\d+\.\d+\s+(\d+)\s+(.+)$!', $header_line, $matches)) {
                $headers_array['Status'] = $matches[1] . ' ' . $matches[2];
            } elseif (strpos($header_line, ':') !== false) {
                list($key, $value) = explode(':', $header_line, 2);
                $headers_array[trim($key)] = trim($value);
            }
        }

        if (isset($params['assign_headers'])) {
            $template->assign($params['assign_headers'], $headers_array);
        }
    } else {
        if (!preg_match('!^(\w+://|[/\\\\]|[a-zA-Z]:[\\\\/])!', $file)) {
            trigger_error("fetch: invalid file path '$file'", E_USER_NOTICE);
            return;
        }

        $content = @file_get_contents($file);
        if ($content === false) {
            trigger_error("fetch: unable to read file '$file'", E_USER_NOTICE);
            return;
        }
    }

    if (isset($params['assign'])) {
        $template->assign($params['assign'], $content);
    } else {
        return $content;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class for handling trackback requests using low-level HTTP socket communication.

Class Description: The CI_Trackback class provides functionality to send and process trackback pings to remote servers. It handles HTTP communication directly using fsockopen, processes responses, and manages errors.

Attributes:
- charset: string - Character encoding to use (default: 'UTF-8')
- data: array - Trackback data including url, title, excerpt, blog_name, and charset
- convert_ascii: bool - Whether to convert non-ASCII characters (default: TRUE)
- response: string - Raw HTTP response from the trackback server
- error_msg: array - Collection of error messages encountered during processing

Methods:
- process(string $url, string $data) -> bool - Sends a trackback ping to the specified URL with the given data. Returns TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.
  Input: 
    $url: string - Target URL for the trackback
    $data: string - URL-encoded trackback data
  Output: bool - Success status

- get_id(string $url) -> mixed - Extracts a numeric ID from the given URL. Returns the ID as string or FALSE if not found.
  Input: $url: string - URL to parse for an ID
  Output: mixed - Extracted ID string or FALSE

- set_error(string $msg) -> void - Adds an error message to the error collection.
  Input: $msg: string - Error message to store
  Output: void
right_result:
<?php
class CI_Trackback {
    public $charset = 'UTF-8';
    public $data = array('url' => '', 'title' => '', 'excerpt' => '', 'blog_name' => '', 'charset' => '');
    public $convert_ascii = TRUE;
    public $response = '';
    public $error_msg = array();

    public function process($url, $data) {
        $target = parse_url($url);
        if (empty($target['host'])) {
            $this->set_error('Invalid URL: ' . $url);
            return FALSE;
        }

        $data['charset'] = $this->charset;
        $query = http_build_query($data);
        $port = isset($target['port']) ? $target['port'] : 80;
        $path = isset($target['path']) ? $target['path'] : '/';
        $fp = @fsockopen($target['host'], $port, $errno, $errstr, 30);

        if (!$fp) {
            $this->set_error('Failed to open socket to ' . $target['host']);
            return FALSE;
        }

        $request = "POST " . $path . " HTTP/1.0\r\n";
        $request .= "Host: " . $target['host'] . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded\r\n";
        $request .= "Content-Length: " . strlen($query) . "\r\n";
        $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
        $request .= $query;

        fwrite($fp, $request);
        $this->response = '';
        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $this->response .= fgets($fp, 128);
        }
        fclose($fp);

        if (stripos($this->response, '<error>0</error>') === FALSE) {
            $message = preg_match('/<message>(.*?)<\/message>/is', $this->response, $match) ? trim($match[1]) : 'Unknown Error';
            $this->set_error($message);
            return FALSE;
        }

        return TRUE;
    }

    public function get_id($url) {
        preg_match('#id=([0-9]+)#', $url, $matches);
        return isset($matches[1]) ? $matches[1] : FALSE;
    }

    public function set_error($msg) {
        $this->error_msg[] = $msg;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class for handling HTTP/HTTPS communications using either socket-based connections (via fsockopen) or cURL, supporting both standard and persistent connections, with proper header and cookie management.

Class Description: The soap_transport_http class provides low-level HTTP transport capabilities for SOAP communications, supporting both socket and cURL implementations. It handles connection management, request/response processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- url: string - The target URL for HTTP requests
- uri: string - The URI portion of the URL
- scheme: string - The protocol scheme (http/https)
- host: string - The target hostname
- port: string - The target port number
- path: string - The path portion of the URL
- request_method: string - HTTP method (default: POST)
- protocol_version: string - HTTP version (default: 1.0)
- outgoing_headers: array - Headers to be sent with the request
- incoming_headers: array - Headers received in the response
- outgoing_payload: string - Data to be sent in the request
- incoming_payload: string - Data received in the response
- persistentConnection: bool - Flag for persistent connections
- use_curl: bool - Flag to use cURL instead of sockets
- proxy: array|null - Proxy configuration if used

Methods:
- __construct(string $url, array $curl_options=null, bool $use_curl=false) -> void - Initializes the transport with target URL and options
- connect(int $connection_timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30) -> bool - Establishes connection to server
- send(string $data, int $timeout=0, int $response_timeout=30, array $cookies=null) -> mixed - Sends data and returns response
- sendRequest(string $data, array $cookies=null) -> bool - Sends the HTTP request with headers
- getResponse() -> string|bool - Reads and processes the server response
- setHeader(string $name, string $value) -> void - Adds a header to outgoing request
- setCurlOption(mixed $option, mixed $value) -> void - Sets cURL option when using cURL
- parseCookie(string $cookie_str) -> array|bool - Parses Set-Cookie header into array
right_result:
<?php
class soap_transport_http {
    public $url;
    public $uri;
    public $scheme;
    public $host;
    public $port;
    public $path;
    public $request_method = 'POST';
    public $protocol_version = '1.0';
    public $outgoing_headers = array();
    public $incoming_headers = array();
    public $outgoing_payload = '';
    public $incoming_payload = '';
    public $persistentConnection = false;
    public $use_curl = false;
    public $proxy = null;
    private $socket = null;
    private $curl_handle = null;
    private $curl_options = array();

    public function __construct($url, $curl_options = null, $use_curl = false) {
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->use_curl = $use_curl;
        if ($curl_options !== null) {
            $this->curl_options = $curl_options;
        }
        $this->parseUrl($url);
    }

    private function parseUrl($url) {
        $parts = parse_url($url);
        $this->scheme = isset($parts['scheme']) ? $parts['scheme'] : 'http';
        $this->host = isset($parts['host']) ? $parts['host'] : '';
        $this->port = isset($parts['port']) ? $parts['port'] : ($this->scheme == 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $this->path = isset($parts['path']) ? $parts['path'] : '/';
        $this->uri = $this->scheme . '://' . $this->host . ':' . $this->port . $this->path;
    }

    public function connect($connection_timeout = 0, $response_timeout = 30) {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            $this->curl_handle = curl_init();
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_URL, $this->url);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, $connection_timeout);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $response_timeout);
            foreach ($this->curl_options as $option => $value) {
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, $option, $value);
            }
            if ($this->scheme == 'https') {
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
                curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
            }
            return true;
        } else {
            $host = $this->host;
            if ($this->proxy !== null) {
                $host = $this->proxy['host'];
                $this->port = $this->proxy['port'];
            }
            $errno = null;
            $errstr = null;
            $this->socket = fsockopen(
                ($this->scheme == 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $host,
                $this->port,
                $errno,
                $errstr,
                $connection_timeout
            );
            if (!$this->socket) {
                return false;
            }
            stream_set_timeout($this->socket, $response_timeout);
            return true;
        }
    }

    public function send($data, $timeout = 0, $response_timeout = 30, $cookies = null) {
        $this->outgoing_payload = $data;
        if (!$this->connect($timeout, $response_timeout)) {
            return false;
        }
        if (!$this->sendRequest($data, $cookies)) {
            return false;
        }
        return $this->getResponse();
    }

    public function sendRequest($data, $cookies = null) {
        $this->outgoing_payload = $data;
        $headers = array();
        foreach ($this->outgoing_headers as $name => $value) {
            $headers[] = "$name: $value";
        }
        if ($cookies !== null) {
            $cookie_str = '';
            foreach ($cookies as $name => $value) {
                $cookie_str .= "$name=$value; ";
            }
            $headers[] = "Cookie: " . rtrim($cookie_str, '; ');
        }
        $headers[] = "Content-Length: " . strlen($data);
        $headers[] = "Connection: " . ($this->persistentConnection ? "Keep-Alive" : "Close");

        if ($this->use_curl) {
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            curl_setopt($this->curl_handle, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
            return true;
        } else {
            $request = $this->request_method . " " . $this->path . " HTTP/" . $this->protocol_version . "\r\n";
            $request .= "Host: " . $this->host . "\r\n";
            $request .= implode("\r\n", $headers) . "\r\n\r\n";
            $request .= $data;
            return fwrite($this->socket, $request) !== false;
        }
    }

    public function getResponse() {
        if ($this->use_curl) {
            $response = curl_exec($this->curl_handle);
            if ($response === false) {
                return false;
            }
            $header_size = curl_getinfo($this->curl_handle, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
            $headers = substr($response, 0, $header_size);
            $this->incoming_payload = substr($response, $header_size);
            $this->parseHeaders($headers);
            return $this->incoming_payload;
        } else {
            $response = '';
            while (!feof($this->socket)) {
                $response .= fgets($this->socket, 4096);
            }
            if (!$this->persistentConnection) {
                fclose($this->socket);
            }
            $parts = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);
            $headers = $parts[0];
            $this->incoming_payload = isset($parts[1]) ? $parts[1] : '';
            $this->parseHeaders($headers);
            return $this->incoming_payload;
        }
    }

    private function parseHeaders($headers) {
        $this->incoming_headers = array();
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $headers);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($name, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
                $this->incoming_headers[trim($name)] = trim($value);
            }
        }
    }

    public function setHeader($name, $value) {
        $this->outgoing_headers[$name] = $value;
    }

    public function setCurlOption($option, $value) {
        $this->curl_options[$option] = $value;
    }

    public function parseCookie($cookie_str) {
        $cookie = array();
        $parts = explode(';', $cookie_str);
        foreach ($parts as $part) {
            $part = trim($part);
            if (strpos($part, '=') !== false) {
                list($name, $value) = explode('=', $part, 2);
                $cookie[trim($name)] = trim($value);
            } else {
                $cookie[$part] = true;
            }
        }
        return !empty($cookie) ? $cookie : false;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a remote HTTP server using low-level socket operations, with support for various HTTP request parameters and proxy configuration.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy), sends an HTTP GET request with customizable headers, reads the response, and returns the content body. It supports authentication, custom headers, timeout settings, and proxy configuration. The function can either return the content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: [array] - An associative array containing the following possible keys:
  - 'file': [string] - The URL to fetch (required)
  - 'assign': [string] - Template variable name to assign content to (optional)
  - 'assign_headers': [string] - Template variable name to assign response headers to (optional)
  - 'user': [string] - Username for HTTP authentication (optional)
  - 'pass': [string] - Password for HTTP authentication (optional)
  - 'accept': [string] - Accept header value (optional)
  - 'header': [string|array] - Additional HTTP headers (optional)
  - 'proxy_host': [string] - Proxy server hostname (optional)
  - 'proxy_port': [int] - Proxy server port (optional)
  - 'agent': [string] - User-Agent header value (optional)
  - 'referer': [string] - Referer header value (optional)
  - 'timeout': [int] - Connection timeout in seconds (optional)
- $template: [object] - Template engine object for variable assignment (optional)

Output:
- If 'assign' parameter is provided: [void] - Assigns content to template variable
- If 'assign' parameter is not provided: [string] - Returns the fetched content
- On error: [void] - Triggers notice and returns nothing
right_result:
<?php
function smarty_fetch_http($params, &$template) {
    if (!isset($params['file'])) {
        trigger_error("fetch: missing 'file' parameter", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $url = parse_url($params['file']);
    if (!isset($url['host'])) {
        trigger_error("fetch: invalid URL '{$params['file']}'", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    $host = $url['host'];
    $port = isset($url['port']) ? $url['port'] : 80;
    $path = isset($url['path']) ? $url['path'] : '/';
    $query = isset($url['query']) ? '?' . $url['query'] : '';
    $path .= $query;

    $use_proxy = isset($params['proxy_host']) && isset($params['proxy_port']);
    $target_host = $use_proxy ? $params['proxy_host'] : $host;
    $target_port = $use_proxy ? $params['proxy_port'] : $port;

    $timeout = isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 10;
    $errno = 0;
    $errstr = '';
    $fp = @fsockopen($target_host, $target_port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    if (!$fp) {
        trigger_error("fetch: unable to connect to {$target_host}:{$target_port} - {$errstr}", E_USER_NOTICE);
        return;
    }

    stream_set_timeout($fp, $timeout);

    $request = "GET " . ($use_proxy ? "http://{$host}:{$port}{$path}" : $path) . " HTTP/1.0\r\n";
    $request .= "Host: {$host}\r\n";

    if (isset($params['user']) && isset($params['pass'])) {
        $auth = base64_encode("{$params['user']}:{$params['pass']}");
        $request .= "Authorization: Basic {$auth}\r\n";
    }

    if (isset($params['accept'])) {
        $request .= "Accept: {$params['accept']}\r\n";
    }

    if (isset($params['agent'])) {
        $request .= "User-Agent: {$params['agent']}\r\n";
    }

    if (isset($params['referer'])) {
        $request .= "Referer: {$params['referer']}\r\n";
    }

    if (isset($params['header'])) {
        if (is_array($params['header'])) {
            foreach ($params['header'] as $header) {
                $request .= "{$header}\r\n";
            }
        } else {
            $request .= "{$params['header']}\r\n";
        }
    }

    $request .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";

    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 4096);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    list($headers, $content) = explode("\r\n\r\n", $response, 2);

    if (isset($params['assign_headers'])) {
        $template->assign($params['assign_headers'], $headers);
    }

    if (isset($params['assign'])) {
        $template->assign($params['assign'], $content);
    } else {
        return $content;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using fsockopen for making HTTP requests when CURL extension is not available. The class should support both GET and POST methods, handle headers, cookies, timeouts, and allow configuration of various connection parameters.

Class Description: The Http class provides low-level HTTP client functionality using PHP's fsockopen function. It's designed as a fallback when CURL isn't available, offering stable performance for making HTTP requests. The class contains one static method that handles the complete HTTP request lifecycle from connection establishment to response processing.

Methods:

Method1: fsockopenDownload(string $url, array $conf = []) -> mixed - Performs an HTTP request using fsockopen
  Input Parameters:
    - $url: string - The target URL to request
    - $conf: array - Configuration options including:
      - limit: int - Maximum bytes to read (0 for unlimited)
      - post: mixed - POST data (array or string)
      - cookie: string - Cookie header content
      - ip: string - Force specific IP address
      - timeout: int - Connection timeout in seconds
      - block: bool - Whether to use blocking mode
  Return Type: mixed - Returns the HTTP response body as string, or empty string on failure

The method follows these steps:
1. Parses the URL and merges configuration with defaults
2. Prepares appropriate HTTP request headers (GET/POST)
3. Establishes TCP connection using fsockopen
4. Sends the HTTP request
5. Reads and processes the response
6. Closes the connection and returns the response body
right_result:
<?php
class Http {
    public static function fsockopenDownload($url, $conf = array()) {
        $defaults = array(
            'limit' => 0,
            'post' => '',
            'cookie' => '',
            'ip' => '',
            'timeout' => 15,
            'block' => true
        );
        $conf = array_merge($defaults, $conf);

        $urlParts = parse_url($url);
        $scheme = isset($urlParts['scheme']) ? strtolower($urlParts['scheme']) : 'http';
        $host = isset($urlParts['host']) ? $urlParts['host'] : '';
        $port = isset($urlParts['port']) ? $urlParts['port'] : ($scheme == 'https' ? 443 : 80);
        $path = isset($urlParts['path']) ? $urlParts['path'] : '/';
        $query = isset($urlParts['query']) ? '?' . $urlParts['query'] : '';
        $path .= $query;

        $target = $conf['ip'] ? $conf['ip'] : $host;
        $connectTimeout = $conf['timeout'];
        $block = $conf['block'] ? 1 : 0;

        $fp = @fsockopen(
            ($scheme == 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '') . $target,
            $port,
            $errno,
            $errstr,
            $connectTimeout
        );

        if (!$fp) {
            return '';
        }

        stream_set_blocking($fp, $block);
        stream_set_timeout($fp, $connectTimeout);

        $headers = array();
        $headers[] = ($conf['post'] ? 'POST' : 'GET') . " $path HTTP/1.0";
        $headers[] = "Host: $host";
        $headers[] = "Connection: Close";

        if ($conf['post']) {
            $postData = is_array($conf['post']) ? http_build_query($conf['post']) : $conf['post'];
            $headers[] = "Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded";
            $headers[] = "Content-Length: " . strlen($postData);
        }

        if ($conf['cookie']) {
            $headers[] = "Cookie: " . $conf['cookie'];
        }

        $request = implode("\r\n", $headers) . "\r\n\r\n";
        if ($conf['post']) {
            $request .= $postData;
        }

        fwrite($fp, $request);

        $response = '';
        $length = 0;
        $limit = $conf['limit'];
        $started = false;

        while (!feof($fp)) {
            $line = fgets($fp, 1024);
            if ($line === false) {
                break;
            }

            if (!$started) {
                if (trim($line) === '') {
                    $started = true;
                }
                continue;
            }

            $response .= $line;
            $length += strlen($line);

            if ($limit > 0 && $length >= $limit) {
                break;
            }
        }

        fclose($fp);
        return $response;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that fetches content from a specified HTTP URL using fsockopen for low-level HTTP communication, with support for proxy configuration and timeout settings.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to an HTTP server (or proxy server if configured), sends an HTTP GET request, reads the response, and returns the response body. It handles URL parsing, connection establishment, request sending, response reading, and connection closing. The function can either return the fetched content directly or assign it to a template variable.

Input:
- $params: An associative array containing:
  - 'file': (string, required) The HTTP URL to fetch
  - 'proxy_host': (string, optional) Proxy server hostname
  - 'proxy_port': (integer, optional) Proxy server port
  - 'timeout': (integer, optional) Connection timeout in seconds (default: 30)
  - 'assign': (string, optional) Template variable name to assign the content to
- $template: (object) The template object for assigning content when 'assign' parameter is used

Output:
- Returns the fetched content as a string if 'assign' parameter is not provided
- Returns nothing (void) if 'assign' parameter is provided (content is assigned to template instead)
right_result:
<?php
function fetch_url_content($params, $template) {
    $url = $params['file'];
    $proxyHost = isset($params['proxy_host']) ? $params['proxy_host'] : null;
    $proxyPort = isset($params['proxy_port']) ? $params['proxy_port'] : null;
    $timeout = isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 30;
    $assign = isset($params['assign']) ? $params['assign'] : null;

    $parsedUrl = parse_url($url);
    $host = $parsedUrl['host'];
    $port = isset($parsedUrl['port']) ? $parsedUrl['port'] : 80;
    $path = isset($parsedUrl['path']) ? $parsedUrl['path'] : '/';
    $query = isset($parsedUrl['query']) ? '?' . $parsedUrl['query'] : '';
    $fullPath = $path . $query;

    $targetHost = $proxyHost ? $proxyHost : $host;
    $targetPort = $proxyHost ? ($proxyPort ? $proxyPort : 8080) : $port;

    $fp = @fsockopen($targetHost, $targetPort, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    if (!$fp) {
        return null;
    }

    $request = "GET " . ($proxyHost ? $url : $fullPath) . " HTTP/1.1\r\n";
    $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    $request .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";

    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 4096);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    $headerEndPos = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    if ($headerEndPos !== false) {
        $body = substr($response, $headerEndPos + 4);
    } else {
        $body = $response;
    }

    if ($assign) {
        $template->assign($assign, $body);
        return;
    } else {
        return $body;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that retrieves content from a specified URL using low-level socket operations (fsockopen) rather than higher-level HTTP client libraries. The function should handle both HTTP and HTTPS protocols, manage connection timeouts, and properly process the HTTP response.

Function Description: The function establishes a TCP connection to the specified HTTP server, sends a GET request, reads the response (separating headers from body), and returns the content. It handles both HTTP and HTTPS connections with appropriate ports, includes basic error handling, and follows proper HTTP protocol for request/response cycles.

Input:
- $url (string): The URL to fetch content from (e.g., "http://example.com" or "https://example.com")
- &$data (string, passed by reference): Variable that will contain the response body content

Output:
- bool: Returns true if the request was successful and content was retrieved, false if any error occurred (connection failure, empty response, etc.)
- The response body content is stored in the $data parameter passed by reference

Note: The function does not return the content directly but instead modifies the $data parameter. This follows the pattern seen in the reference code where output is handled via parameter reference rather than return value.
right_result:
<?php
function fetchUrlWithSocket($url, &$data) {
    $data = '';
    $parsedUrl = parse_url($url);
    if (!isset($parsedUrl['host'])) {
        return false;
    }

    $host = $parsedUrl['host'];
    $path = isset($parsedUrl['path']) ? $parsedUrl['path'] : '/';
    $query = isset($parsedUrl['query']) ? '?' . $parsedUrl['query'] : '';
    $port = isset($parsedUrl['port']) ? $parsedUrl['port'] : (strpos($url, 'https') === 0 ? 443 : 80);
    $scheme = isset($parsedUrl['scheme']) ? $parsedUrl['scheme'] : 'http';

    $timeout = 10;
    $errno = 0;
    $errstr = '';
    $fp = false;

    if ($scheme === 'https') {
        $context = stream_context_create(['ssl' => ['verify_peer' => false, 'verify_peer_name' => false]]);
        $fp = @stream_socket_client("ssl://$host:$port", $errno, $errstr, $timeout, STREAM_CLIENT_CONNECT, $context);
    } else {
        $fp = @fsockopen($host, $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    }

    if (!$fp) {
        return false;
    }

    $request = "GET $path$query HTTP/1.1\r\n";
    $request .= "Host: $host\r\n";
    $request .= "Connection: close\r\n\r\n";

    fwrite($fp, $request);

    $response = '';
    while (!feof($fp)) {
        $response .= fgets($fp, 1024);
    }
    fclose($fp);

    $headerEndPos = strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n");
    if ($headerEndPos === false) {
        return false;
    }

    $headers = substr($response, 0, $headerEndPos);
    $data = substr($response, $headerEndPos + 4);

    return true;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using either cURL (if available) or fsockopen as a fallback, supporting both GET and POST methods with various configurations.

Function Description: The function _dfsockopen performs HTTP requests to a specified URL with support for POST data, cookies, custom headers, file uploads, and timeout settings. It first attempts to use cURL if available, falling back to fsockopen for basic socket communication. The function handles both URL-encoded and multipart form data for POST requests.

Input:
- $url: (string) The target URL for the HTTP request
- $limit: (int) Maximum number of bytes to read from response (0 for unlimited)
- $post: (string|array) POST data to send (either query string or associative array)
- $cookie: (string) Cookie header string
- $bysocket: (bool) Force using fsockopen (unused in this implementation)
- $ip: (string) Specific IP to connect to (bypassing DNS)
- $timeout: (int) Connection timeout in seconds
- $block: (bool) Whether to use blocking I/O
- $encodetype: (string) POST data encoding type ('URLENCODE' or other for multipart)
- $allowcurl: (bool) Whether to allow cURL usage
- $position: (int) Unused parameter
- $files: (array) Associative array of file paths for file uploads

Output:
- Returns: (string) The HTTP response body (limited by $limit if specified)
- Side effect: Sets $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] with response headers
- Returns empty string on connection failure or non-200 status code (for cURL)
right_result:
<?php
function _dfsockopen($url, $limit = 0, $post = '', $cookie = '', $bysocket = FALSE, $ip = '', $timeout = 15, $block = TRUE, $encodetype = 'URLENCODE', $allowcurl = TRUE, $position = 0, $files = array()) {
    $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] = $header = $body = '';
    $matches = parse_url($url);
    $scheme = $matches['scheme'];
    $host = $matches['host'];
    $path = !empty($matches['path']) ? $matches['path'] : '/';
    $port = !empty($matches['port']) ? $matches['port'] : ($scheme == 'https' ? 443 : 80);
    $query = !empty($matches['query']) ? '?'.$matches['query'] : '';
    $path .= $query;

    if(function_exists('curl_init') && function_exists('curl_exec') && $allowcurl) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $scheme.'://'.$host.':'.$port.$path);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, $timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $timeout);
        if($ip) curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_IPRESOLVE, CURL_IPRESOLVE_V4);

        if($post) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
            if(is_array($post)) {
                if($encodetype == 'URLENCODE') {
                    $post = http_build_query($post);
                } else {
                    foreach($post as $k => $v) {
                        $post[$k] = '@'.$v;
                    }
                }
            }
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $post);
        }

        if($cookie) curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIE, $cookie);

        $data = curl_exec($ch);
        if(curl_errno($ch)) return '';
        $header_size = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] = substr($data, 0, $header_size);
        $body = substr($data, $header_size);
        curl_close($ch);
        if($limit && strlen($body) > $limit) $body = substr($body, 0, $limit);
        return $body;
    }

    if($post) {
        if(is_array($post)) {
            if($encodetype == 'URLENCODE') {
                $post = http_build_query($post);
            } else {
                $boundary = '--------------------------'.substr(md5(rand(0,32000)),0,12);
                $encodetype = 'multipart/form-data; boundary='.$boundary;
                $data = '';
                foreach($post as $k => $v) {
                    $data .= "--$boundary\r\n";
                    $data .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$k\"\r\n\r\n$v\r\n";
                }
                foreach($files as $k => $file) {
                    if(!file_exists($file)) continue;
                    $filename = basename($file);
                    $content = file_get_contents($file);
                    $data .= "--$boundary\r\n";
                    $data .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$k\"; filename=\"$filename\"\r\n";
                    $data .= "Content-Type: application/octet-stream\r\n\r\n$content\r\n";
                }
                $data .= "--$boundary--\r\n";
                $post = $data;
            }
        }
        $out = "POST $path HTTP/1.0\r\n";
        $out .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        $out .= "Content-Type: $encodetype\r\n";
        $out .= "Content-Length: ".strlen($post)."\r\n";
        if($cookie) $out .= "Cookie: $cookie\r\n";
        $out .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
        $out .= $post;
    } else {
        $out = "GET $path HTTP/1.0\r\n";
        $out .= "Host: $host\r\n";
        if($cookie) $out .= "Cookie: $cookie\r\n";
        $out .= "Connection: Close\r\n\r\n";
    }

    $fp = @fsockopen(($scheme == 'https' ? 'ssl://' : '').($ip ? $ip : $host), $port, $errno, $errstr, $timeout);
    if(!$fp) return '';
    stream_set_blocking($fp, $block);
    stream_set_timeout($fp, $timeout);
    @fwrite($fp, $out);
    $status = stream_get_meta_data($fp);
    if($status['timed_out']) return '';

    $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] = '';
    while(!feof($fp)) {
        $header .= @fgets($fp);
        if($header && substr($header, -4) == "\r\n\r\n") break;
    }
    $GLOBALS['filesockheader'] = $header;

    $stop = false;
    while(!feof($fp) && !$stop) {
        $data = fread($fp, ($limit && $limit > 0 ? min($limit, 8192) : 8192));
        $body .= $data;
        if($limit) {
            $limit -= strlen($data);
            $stop = $limit <= 0;
        }
    }
    fclose($fp);
    return $body;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a RabbitMQ consumer class in PHP that connects to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, and processes incoming messages until a termination signal is received.

Class Description: The RabbitMQConsumer class handles the consumption of messages from a RabbitMQ queue. It establishes a connection to the server, sets up the necessary queue and exchange, processes messages, and provides shutdown functionality.

Attributes:
- msgCount: [int] - Tracks the number of messages processed
- startTime: [float|null] - Records the start time of message processing
- conn: [AMQPStreamConnection] - Holds the RabbitMQ server connection
- ch: [AMQPChannel] - Represents the communication channel
- exchange: [string] - Name of the exchange to bind to
- queue: [string] - Name of the queue to consume from
- consumer_tag: [string] - Identifier for the consumer (empty in this implementation)

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the RabbitMQ connection, channel, exchange, and queue
- process_message([AMQPMessage] $msg) -> [void] - Processes incoming messages and handles termination signal
- startConsuming() -> [void] - Starts consuming messages from the queue
- shutdown() -> [void] - Closes the channel and connection cleanly
right_result:
<?php
require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

class RabbitMQConsumer {
    private $msgCount = 0;
    private $startTime = null;
    private $conn;
    private $ch;
    private $exchange;
    private $queue;
    private $consumer_tag = '';

    public function __construct($host, $port, $user, $password, $exchange, $queue) {
        $this->exchange = $exchange;
        $this->queue = $queue;
        $this->conn = new AMQPStreamConnection($host, $port, $user, $password);
        $this->ch = $this->conn->channel();
        $this->ch->exchange_declare($this->exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $this->ch->queue_declare($this->queue, false, true, false, false);
        $this->ch->queue_bind($this->queue, $this->exchange);
        $this->startTime = microtime(true);
        pcntl_signal(SIGTERM, [$this, 'shutdown']);
        pcntl_signal(SIGINT, [$this, 'shutdown']);
    }

    public function process_message(AMQPMessage $msg) {
        $this->msgCount++;
        $body = $msg->body;
        echo "Processing message: $body\n";
        $msg->ack();
        pcntl_signal_dispatch();
    }

    public function startConsuming() {
        $this->ch->basic_consume(
            $this->queue,
            $this->consumer_tag,
            false,
            false,
            false,
            false,
            [$this, 'process_message']
        );

        while ($this->ch->is_consuming()) {
            $this->ch->wait();
        }
    }

    public function shutdown() {
        echo "Shutting down...\n";
        $totalTime = microtime(true) - $this->startTime;
        echo "Processed {$this->msgCount} messages in {$totalTime} seconds\n";
        if ($this->ch) {
            $this->ch->close();
        }
        if ($this->conn) {
            $this->conn->close();
        }
        exit(0);
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a function that sends a delayed message to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and the PhpAmqpLib library. The function should establish a connection to RabbitMQ, declare a delayed exchange and queue, and publish a message with a specified delay time.

Function Description: The function `send_delayed_message` sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue with a specified delay. It uses a delayed exchange to achieve the delay functionality. The function handles the connection setup, exchange and queue declaration, message creation with delay headers, and cleanup of resources.

Input:
- `$message_content` [string] - The content of the message to be sent.
- `$delay_ms` [int] - The delay time in milliseconds before the message is delivered to the queue.

Output: None. The function does not return any value but publishes the message to the specified RabbitMQ queue with the given delay.

Note: The function assumes the existence of a `config.php` file containing the RabbitMQ connection parameters (HOST, PORT, USER, PASS, VHOST).
right_result:
<?php
require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;
use PhpAmqpLib\Wire\AMQPTable;

function send_delayed_message($message_content, $delay_ms) {
    require 'config.php';
    
    $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection(RABBITMQ_HOST, RABBITMQ_PORT, RABBITMQ_USER, RABBITMQ_PASS, RABBITMQ_VHOST);
    $channel = $connection->channel();
    
    $exchangeName = 'delayed_exchange';
    $queueName = 'delayed_queue';
    $exchangeType = 'x-delayed-message';
    $args = new AMQPTable(['x-delayed-type' => 'direct']);
    
    $channel->exchange_declare($exchangeName, $exchangeType, false, true, false, false, false, $args);
    $channel->queue_declare($queueName, false, true, false, false);
    $channel->queue_bind($queueName, $exchangeName, $queueName);
    
    $headers = new AMQPTable(['x-delay' => $delay_ms]);
    $message = new AMQPMessage($message_content, ['delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT]);
    $message->set('application_headers', $headers);
    
    $channel->basic_publish($message, $exchangeName, $queueName);
    
    $channel->close();
    $connection->close();
}

Task Description: Create a function that sends a message to a RabbitMQ queue using PHP and the PhpAmqpLib library.

Function Description: The function establishes a connection to a RabbitMQ server, declares a queue and exchange, binds them, publishes a message with persistent delivery mode, and then closes the connection. It handles errors gracefully by returning false if an exception occurs.

Input:  
- $messageBody: [string] - The content of the message to be sent  
- $exchange: [string] - The name of the exchange (default: 'router')  
- $queue: [string] - The name of the queue (default: 'msgs')  

Output:  
- [bool] - Returns true if the message was successfully sent, false if an error occurred
right_result:
<?php
require_once __DIR__ . '/vendor/autoload.php';
use PhpAmqpLib\Connection\AMQPStreamConnection;
use PhpAmqpLib\Message\AMQPMessage;

function sendToRabbitMQ($messageBody, $exchange = 'router', $queue = 'msgs') {
    try {
        $connection = new AMQPStreamConnection('localhost', 5672, 'guest', 'guest');
        $channel = $connection->channel();

        $channel->queue_declare($queue, false, true, false, false);
        $channel->exchange_declare($exchange, 'direct', false, true, false);
        $channel->queue_bind($queue, $exchange);

        $message = new AMQPMessage($messageBody, ['delivery_mode' => AMQPMessage::DELIVERY_MODE_PERSISTENT]);
        $channel->basic_publish($message, $exchange);

        $channel->close();
        $connection->close();

        return true;
    } catch (Exception $e) {
        return false;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a Redis-based session handler class that extends a base session driver and implements the SessionHandlerInterface for use in a web application framework.

Class Description: The CI_Session_redis_driver class provides Redis-based session management functionality, including session data storage, retrieval, locking mechanisms, and cleanup. It handles connection management, session data persistence, and concurrency control through Redis operations.

Attributes:
- _redis: [Redis] - Instance of the Redis client used for all operations
- _key_prefix: [string] - Prefix for all Redis keys used in session storage

Methods:
