- open($save_path, $name) -> [bool] - Opens a connection to the Redis server using configured parameters
- read($session_id) -> [string] - Reads session data from Redis for the given session ID
- write($session_id, $session_data) -> [bool] - Writes session data to Redis for the given session ID
- close() -> [bool] - Closes the Redis connection and releases any locks
- destroy($session_id) -> [bool] - Removes session data from Redis for the given session ID
- gc($maxlifetime) -> [bool] - Garbage collection handler (not implemented for Redis)
- _get_lock($session_id) -> [bool] - Internal method to acquire a lock for session operations
- _release_lock() -> [bool] - Internal method to release the current session lock
- _fail() -> [bool] - Internal method to handle operation failures
- _success() -> [bool] - Internal method to handle operation successes
right_result:
<?php
class CI_Session_redis_driver extends CI_Session_driver implements SessionHandlerInterface {
    protected $_redis;
    protected $_key_prefix = 'ci_session:';
    protected $_lock_key;
    protected $_key_exists = false;
    protected $_config;
    protected $_session_id;
    protected $_fingerprint;

    public function __construct(&$params) {
        parent::__construct($params);
        $this->_config = array(
            'host' => isset($params['host']) ? $params['host'] : '127.0.0.1',
            'port' => isset($params['port']) ? $params['port'] : 6379,
            'timeout' => isset($params['timeout']) ? $params['timeout'] : 0,
            'password' => isset($params['password']) ? $params['password'] : null,
            'database' => isset($params['database']) ? $params['database'] : 0,
            'key_prefix' => isset($params['key_prefix']) ? $params['key_prefix'] : $this->_key_prefix,
        );
        $this->_key_prefix = $this->_config['key_prefix'];
    }

    public function open($save_path, $name) {
        if (empty($this->_config['host'])) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        $redis = new Redis();
        try {
            if (!$redis->connect($this->_config['host'], $this->_config['port'], $this->_config['timeout'])) {
                return $this->_fail();
            }

            if (isset($this->_config['password']) && !$redis->auth($this->_config['password'])) {
                return $this->_fail();
            }

            if (isset($this->_config['database']) && !$redis->select($this->_config['database'])) {
                return $this->_fail();
            }

            $this->_redis = $redis;
            return $this->_success();
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }
    }

    public function read($session_id) {
        if (isset($this->_redis) && $this->_get_lock($session_id)) {
            $this->_session_id = $session_id;
            $session_key = $this->_key_prefix.$session_id;
            $session_data = $this->_redis->get($session_key);

            if (is_string($session_data)) {
                $this->_key_exists = true;
                $this->_fingerprint = md5($session_data);
                return $session_data;
            }

            $this->_fingerprint = md5('');
            return '';
        }

        return $this->_fail();
    }

    public function write($session_id, $session_data) {
        if (!isset($this->_redis) || $this->_lock_key !== $this->_key_prefix.$session_id.':lock') {
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        $session_key = $this->_key_prefix.$session_id;
        if ($this->_fingerprint !== md5($session_data) || $this->_key_exists === false) {
            if ($this->_redis->set($session_key, $session_data, $this->_config['expiration'])) {
                $this->_fingerprint = md5($session_data);
                $this->_key_exists = true;
                return $this->_success();
            }
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        return ($this->_redis->expire($session_key, $this->_config['expiration'])) ? $this->_success() : $this->_fail();
    }

    public function close() {
        if (isset($this->_redis)) {
            try {
                if ($this->_lock_key) {
                    $this->_release_lock();
                }
                $this->_redis->close();
                $this->_redis = null;
                return $this->_success();
            } catch (Exception $e) {
                return $this->_fail();
            }
        }
        return $this->_success();
    }

    public function destroy($session_id) {
        if (isset($this->_redis, $this->_lock_key)) {
            $session_key = $this->_key_prefix.$session_id;
            $this->_redis->del($session_key);
            $this->_fingerprint = md5('');
            $this->_key_exists = false;
            return $this->_success();
        }
        return $this->_fail();
    }

    public function gc($maxlifetime) {
        return $this->_success();
    }

    protected function _get_lock($session_id) {
        $lock_key = $this->_key_prefix.$session_id.':lock';
        $attempt = 0;
        $lock_acquired = false;

        while ($attempt++ < 30) {
            if (($lock_acquired = $this->_redis->setnx($lock_key, time()))) {
                $this->_lock_key = $lock_key;
                break;
            }

            if ($this->_redis->ttl($lock_key) === -1) {
                $this->_redis->del($lock_key);
            }

            usleep(rand(100000, 500000));
        }

        if (!$lock_acquired) {
            return $this->_fail();
        }

        return $this->_redis->expire($lock_key, 300);
    }

    protected function _release_lock() {
        if (isset($this->_redis, $this->_lock_key) && $this->_lock_key) {
            $this->_redis->del($this->_lock_key);
            $this->_lock_key = null;
        }
        return true;
    }

    protected function _fail() {
        $this->close();
        return false;
    }

    protected function _success() {
        return true;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a Redis-based queue management system with connection handling, basic Redis operations, and error recovery mechanisms.

Class Description: The `queue` class is a Redis wrapper that manages connections to Redis servers and provides common Redis operations with automatic reconnection on failure. It supports multiple Redis connections, connection pooling, and prefixing of keys.

Attributes:
- `$redis`: [static, mixed] - Placeholder for Redis instance (deprecated in favor of `$links`)
- `$configs`: [static, array] - Stores configuration for different Redis connections
- `$links`: [static, array] - Maintains active Redis connections
- `$link_name`: [static, string] - Current connection name (defaults to 'default')
- `$prefix`: [static, string] - Default prefix for Redis keys
- `$error`: [static, string] - Stores the last error message

Methods:
- `init()` -> [bool|Redis] - Initializes Redis connection using current configuration. Returns Redis instance or false on failure.
- `set($key, $value, $expire = 0)` -> [bool|null] - Sets a key-value pair in Redis with optional expiration. Returns true on success, null on failure.
- `get($key)` -> [mixed|null] - Retrieves a value by key from Redis. Returns the value or null on failure.
- `del($key)` -> [int|null] - Deletes a key from Redis. Returns number of deleted keys or null on failure.
- `_get_default_config()` -> [array] - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings.
- `clear_link()` -> [void] - Closes all active Redis connections and clears the connection pool.

Input:
- Configuration via `$GLOBALS['config']['redis']` for default connection
- Method parameters as described above

Output:
- For connection methods: Redis instance or boolean
- For data operations: Various return types as described above
- Error messages stored in `$error` property
right_result:
<?php
class queue {
    public static $redis;
    public static $configs = array();
    public static $links = array();
    public static $link_name = 'default';
    public static $prefix = '';
    public static $error = '';

    public static function init() {
        if (empty(self::$configs[self::$link_name])) {
            self::$configs[self::$link_name] = self::_get_default_config();
        }

        if (!empty(self::$links[self::$link_name])) {
            return self::$links[self::$link_name];
        }

        try {
            $redis = new Redis();
            $config = self::$configs[self::$link_name];
            $connected = $redis->connect($config['host'], $config['port'], $config['timeout']);

            if (!$connected) {
                self::$error = "Redis connection failed";
                return false;
            }

            if (!empty($config['auth'])) {
                if (!$redis->auth($config['auth'])) {
                    self::$error = "Redis authentication failed";
                    return false;
                }
            }

            if (!empty($config['database'])) {
                $redis->select($config['database']);
            }

            self::$links[self::$link_name] = $redis;
            return $redis;
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            self::$error = $e->getMessage();
            return false;
        }
    }

    public static function set($key, $value, $expire = 0) {
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) {
            return null;
        }

        try {
            $prefixed_key = self::$prefix . $key;
            $result = $redis->set($prefixed_key, $value);
            if ($expire > 0) {
                $redis->expire($prefixed_key, $expire);
            }
            return $result;
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            self::$error = $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public static function get($key) {
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) {
            return null;
        }

        try {
            $prefixed_key = self::$prefix . $key;
            return $redis->get($prefixed_key);
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            self::$error = $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public static function del($key) {
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) {
            return null;
        }

        try {
            $prefixed_key = self::$prefix . $key;
            return $redis->del($prefixed_key);
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            self::$error = $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    private static function _get_default_config() {
        $default = array(
            'host' => '127.0.0.1',
            'port' => 6379,
            'timeout' => 1,
            'auth' => '',
            'database' => 0
        );

        if (!empty($GLOBALS['config']['redis'])) {
            return array_merge($default, $GLOBALS['config']['redis']);
        }

        return $default;
    }

    public static function clear_link() {
        foreach (self::$links as $link) {
            try {
                $link->close();
            } catch (Exception $e) {
                self::$error = $e->getMessage();
            }
        }
        self::$links = array();
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Redis cache driver class for CodeIgniter that implements basic cache operations using Redis as the backend storage.

Class Description: The CI_Cache_redis class extends CI_Driver and provides an interface for caching data in Redis. It handles connection management, serialization of complex data types, and standard cache operations like get, save, delete, increment, and decrement.

Attributes:
- $_default_config: [array] - Default configuration for Redis connection
- $_redis: [Redis] - Redis client instance
- $_serialized: [array] - Track which keys contain serialized data

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes Redis connection using configuration
- get($key) -> [mixed] - Retrieves data from cache by key
- save($id, $data, $ttl = 60, $raw = FALSE) -> [bool] - Stores data in cache with optional TTL
- delete($key) -> [bool] - Removes data from cache by key
- increment($id, $offset = 1) -> [int|bool] - Increments a numeric value in cache
- decrement($id, $offset = 1) -> [int|bool] - Decrements a numeric value in cache
- clean() -> [bool] - Clears all cache entries
- cache_info($type = NULL) -> [array] - Returns Redis server information
- get_metadata($key) -> [array|bool] - Returns metadata about a cache entry
- is_supported() -> [bool] - Checks if Redis extension is loaded
- __destruct() -> [void] - Closes Redis connection when object is destroyed
right_result:
<?php
class CI_Cache_redis extends CI_Driver {
	protected $_default_config = array(
		'socket_type' => 'tcp',
		'host' => '127.0.0.1',
		'password' => NULL,
		'port' => 6379,
		'timeout' => 0
	);

	protected $_redis;
	protected $_serialized = array();

	public function __construct()
	{
		if ( ! $this->is_supported())
		{
			log_message('error', 'Cache: Failed to create Redis instance; extension not loaded.');
			return;
		}

		$CI =& get_instance();
		if ($CI->config->load('redis', TRUE, TRUE))
		{
			$this->_default_config = array_merge($this->_default_config, $CI->config->item('redis'));
		}

		$this->_redis = new Redis();

		try
		{
			if ($this->_default_config['socket_type'] === 'unix')
			{
				$success = $this->_redis->connect($this->_default_config['socket']);
			}
			else
			{
				$success = $this->_redis->connect(
					$this->_default_config['host'],
					$this->_default_config['port'],
					$this->_default_config['timeout']
				);
			}

			if ( ! $success)
			{
				log_message('error', 'Cache: Redis connection failed. Check your configuration.');
			}

			if (isset($this->_default_config['password']) && ! $this->_redis->auth($this->_default_config['password']))
			{
				log_message('error', 'Cache: Redis authentication failed.');
			}
		}
		catch (RedisException $e)
		{
			log_message('error', 'Cache: Redis connection refused ('.$e->getMessage().')');
		}
	}

	public function get($key)
	{
		$value = $this->_redis->get($key);

		if ($value !== FALSE && isset($this->_serialized[$key]))
		{
			return unserialize($value);
		}

		return $value;
	}

	public function save($id, $data, $ttl = 60, $raw = FALSE)
	{
		if (is_array($data) || is_object($data))
		{
			if ( ! $raw && ! $this->_redis->sIsMember('_ci_redis_serialized', $id))
			{
				$this->_redis->sAdd('_ci_redis_serialized', $id);
			}

			$data = serialize($data);
		}
		elseif ($raw && $this->_redis->sIsMember('_ci_redis_serialized', $id))
		{
			$this->_redis->sRemove('_ci_redis_serialized', $id);
		}

		return ($ttl)
			? $this->_redis->setex($id, $ttl, $data)
			: $this->_redis->set($id, $data);
	}

	public function delete($key)
	{
		if ($this->_redis->delete($key) !== 1)
		{
			return FALSE;
		}

		if ($this->_redis->sIsMember('_ci_redis_serialized', $key))
		{
			$this->_redis->sRemove('_ci_redis_serialized', $key);
		}

		return TRUE;
	}

	public function increment($id, $offset = 1)
	{
		return $this->_redis->incrBy($id, $offset);
	}

	public function decrement($id, $offset = 1)
	{
		return $this->_redis->decrBy($id, $offset);
	}

	public function clean()
	{
		return $this->_redis->flushDB();
	}

	public function cache_info($type = NULL)
	{
		return $this->_redis->info($type);
	}

	public function get_metadata($key)
	{
		$value = $this->get($key);
		if ($value !== FALSE)
		{
			return array(
				'expire' => time() + $this->_redis->ttl($key),
				'data' => $value
			);
		}

		return FALSE;
	}

	public function is_supported()
	{
		return extension_loaded('redis');
	}

	public function __destruct()
	{
		if ($this->_redis)
		{
			$this->_redis->close();
		}
	}
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a Redis wrapper class in PHP that provides a simplified interface for connecting to and interacting with a Redis server, including connection management, basic operations, and error handling.

Class Description: The cls_redis class is a singleton-style wrapper for PHP's Redis extension that manages Redis connections, provides common Redis operations, and handles connection errors gracefully. It supports multiple connection configurations, automatic reconnection on failure, and key prefixing.

Attributes:

Attribute1: protected static $redis - Redis - Singleton Redis instance (deprecated)
Attribute2: protected static $configs - array - Stores Redis connection configurations
Attribute3: private static $links - array - Maintains active Redis connections
Attribute4: private static $link_name - string - Current connection name (default 'default')
Attribute5: public static $prefix - string - Default key prefix ('phpspider')
Attribute6: public static $error - string - Stores last error message

Methods:

Method1: init() -> Redis|false - Initializes and returns a Redis connection instance
Method2: set(string $key, mixed $value, int $expire = 0) -> bool|null - Stores a value in Redis with optional expiration
Method3: get(string $key) -> mixed|null - Retrieves a value from Redis by key
Method4: clear_link() -> void - Closes all active Redis connections
Method5: _get_default_config() -> array - Retrieves default Redis configuration from global settings
right_result:
<?php
class cls_redis
{
    protected static $redis;
    protected static $configs = array();
    private static $links = array();
    private static $link_name = 'default';
    public static $prefix = 'phpspider';
    public static $error = '';

    public static function init()
    {
        if (empty(self::$configs)) {
            self::$configs = self::_get_default_config();
        }

        if (!isset(self::$links[self::$link_name])) {
            try {
                $redis = new Redis();
                $config = self::$configs[self::$link_name];
                $connected = $redis->connect($config['host'], $config['port'], $config['timeout']);
                if (!$connected) {
                    self::$error = "Redis connection failed";
                    return false;
                }
                if (!empty($config['auth'])) {
                    $redis->auth($config['auth']);
                }
                if (!empty($config['database'])) {
                    $redis->select($config['database']);
                }
                self::$links[self::$link_name] = $redis;
            } catch (Exception $e) {
                self::$error = $e->getMessage();
                return false;
            }
        }
        return self::$links[self::$link_name];
    }

    public static function set($key, $value, $expire = 0)
    {
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) {
            return null;
        }
        $key = self::$prefix . $key;
        try {
            if ($expire > 0) {
                return $redis->setex($key, $expire, $value);
            } else {
                return $redis->set($key, $value);
            }
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            self::$error = $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public static function get($key)
    {
        $redis = self::init();
        if (!$redis) {
            return null;
        }
        $key = self::$prefix . $key;
        try {
            return $redis->get($key);
        } catch (Exception $e) {
            self::$error = $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public static function clear_link()
    {
        foreach (self::$links as $link) {
            try {
                $link->close();
            } catch (Exception $e) {
                continue;
            }
        }
        self::$links = array();
    }

    private static function _get_default_config()
    {
        global $config;
        $default = array(
            'default' => array(
                'host' => isset($config['redis']['host']) ? $config['redis']['host'] : '127.0.0.1',
                'port' => isset($config['redis']['port']) ? $config['redis']['port'] : 6379,
                'timeout' => isset($config['redis']['timeout']) ? $config['redis']['timeout'] : 1,
                'auth' => isset($config['redis']['auth']) ? $config['redis']['auth'] : '',
                'database' => isset($config['redis']['database']) ? $config['redis']['database'] : 0
            )
        );
        return $default;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements a Redis client connection using TCP sockets and the phpiredis extension for efficient communication with a Redis server.

Class Description: PhpiredisSocketConnection is a Redis client connection class that handles TCP socket communication with a Redis server. It manages socket creation, connection, data transmission, and response parsing using the phpiredis extension for optimal performance.

Attributes:
- reader: [resource] - The phpiredis reader resource used for parsing Redis protocol responses
- parameters: [ParametersInterface] - Connection parameters including host, port, timeout, etc.

Methods:
- __construct(ParametersInterface $parameters) -> [void] - Initializes the connection and verifies required extensions
- __destruct() -> [void] - Cleans up resources when the object is destroyed
- assertExtensions() -> [void] - Verifies required PHP extensions are loaded
- createReader() -> [resource] - Creates and configures a phpiredis reader resource
- getStatusHandler() -> [callable] - Returns the handler for status responses
- getErrorHandler() -> [callable] - Returns the handler for error responses
- createResource() -> [resource] - Creates and connects the socket resource
- connectWithTimeout(resource $socket, string $address, ParametersInterface $parameters) -> [void] - Establishes connection with timeout handling
- write(string $buffer) -> [void] - Writes data to the socket connection
- read() -> [mixed] - Reads and parses response from the server
- writeRequest(CommandInterface $command) -> [void] - Formats and writes a Redis command to the server
right_result:
<?php

class PhpiredisSocketConnection
{
    private $reader;
    private $parameters;

    public function __construct(ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        $this->assertExtensions();
        $this->parameters = $parameters;
        $this->reader = $this->createReader();
    }

    public function __destruct()
    {
        if (is_resource($this->reader)) {
            phpiredis_reader_destroy($this->reader);
        }
    }

    private function assertExtensions()
    {
        if (!extension_loaded('phpiredis')) {
            throw new RuntimeException('The phpiredis extension is required.');
        }
        if (!extension_loaded('sockets')) {
            throw new RuntimeException('The sockets extension is required.');
        }
    }

    private function createReader()
    {
        $reader = phpiredis_reader_create();
        phpiredis_reader_set_status_handler($reader, $this->getStatusHandler());
        phpiredis_reader_set_error_handler($reader, $this->getErrorHandler());
        return $reader;
    }

    private function getStatusHandler()
    {
        return function ($payload) {
            return $payload;
        };
    }

    private function getErrorHandler()
    {
        return function ($payload) {
            throw new RuntimeException($payload);
        };
    }

    private function createResource()
    {
        $socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, SOL_TCP);
        if ($socket === false) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Failed to create socket.');
        }
        $this->connectWithTimeout($socket, $this->parameters->getHost(), $this->parameters);
        return $socket;
    }

    private function connectWithTimeout($socket, $address, ParametersInterface $parameters)
    {
        socket_set_nonblock($socket);
        @socket_connect($socket, $address, $parameters->getPort());
        socket_set_block($socket);
        $timeout = ['sec' => $parameters->getTimeout(), 'usec' => 0];
        socket_set_option($socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_RCVTIMEO, $timeout);
        socket_set_option($socket, SOL_SOCKET, SO_SNDTIMEO, $timeout);
    }

    public function write($buffer)
    {
        $socket = $this->createResource();
        $length = strlen($buffer);
        while ($length > 0) {
            $written = socket_write($socket, $buffer);
            if ($written === false) {
                throw new RuntimeException('Failed to write to socket.');
            }
            $buffer = substr($buffer, $written);
            $length -= $written;
        }
        socket_close($socket);
    }

    public function read()
    {
        $socket = $this->createResource();
        while (true) {
            $buffer = socket_read($socket, 4096);
            if ($buffer === false || $buffer === '') {
                break;
            }
            phpiredis_reader_feed($this->reader, $buffer);
            if (phpiredis_reader_get_state($this->reader) === PHPIREDIS_READER_STATE_COMPLETE) {
                return phpiredis_reader_get_reply($this->reader);
            }
        }
        socket_close($socket);
        throw new RuntimeException('Failed to read from socket.');
    }

    public function writeRequest(CommandInterface $command)
    {
        $arguments = $command->getArguments();
        array_unshift($arguments, $command->getId());
        $buffer = '*' . count($arguments) . "\r\n";
        foreach ($arguments as $argument) {
            $buffer .= '$' . strlen($argument) . "\r\n" . $argument . "\r\n";
        }
        $this->write($buffer);
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Symfony's HTTP client components to handle HTTP requests and responses.

Class Description: The HttpClientKernel class is an implementation of HttpKernelInterface that provides HTTP client capabilities using Symfony's HTTP client components. It handles HTTP requests by sending them to a remote server and returning the response, supporting various request methods, headers, cookies, and body content (including form data and file uploads).

Attributes:
- client: [HttpClientInterface] - The Symfony HTTP client instance used to send requests

Methods:
- __construct(?HttpClientInterface $client = null) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client. If no client is provided, creates a default HttpClient instance. Throws an exception if the HttpClient component is not installed.
- handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true) -> [Response] - Processes an HTTP request by sending it to the target server and returns the response. Handles headers, cookies, and request body preparation.
- getBody(Request $request) -> [?AbstractPart] - Prepares the request body content. Returns null for GET/HEAD requests, a TextPart for raw content, or a FormDataPart for form data including file uploads. Throws an exception if the Mime component is not installed when needed.
- getHeaders(Request $request) -> [array] - Extracts and formats headers from the request object, including cookies, into an array suitable for the HTTP client.
right_result:
<?php

use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Request;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Response;
use Symfony\Component\HttpKernel\HttpKernelInterface;
use Symfony\Contracts\HttpClient\HttpClientInterface;
use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\HttpClient;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\AbstractPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\TextPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\Multipart\FormDataPart;

class HttpClientKernel implements HttpKernelInterface
{
    private HttpClientInterface $client;

    public function __construct(?HttpClientInterface $client = null)
    {
        if (!interface_exists(HttpClientInterface::class)) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('The Symfony HttpClient component is not installed.');
        }

        $this->client = $client ?? HttpClient::create();
    }

    public function handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true): Response
    {
        $headers = $this->getHeaders($request);
        $body = $this->getBody($request);

        $options = [
            'headers' => $headers,
        ];

        if ($body !== null) {
            $options['body'] = $body;
        }

        $response = $this->client->request(
            $request->getMethod(),
            $request->getUri(),
            $options
        );

        return new Response(
            $response->getContent(),
            $response->getStatusCode(),
            $response->getHeaders()
        );
    }

    public function getBody(Request $request): ?AbstractPart
    {
        if (in_array($request->getMethod(), ['GET', 'HEAD'])) {
            return null;
        }

        if (!class_exists(AbstractPart::class)) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('The Symfony Mime component is not installed.');
        }

        if ($request->files->count() > 0 || $request->request->count() > 0) {
            $fields = array_merge(
                $request->request->all(),
                $request->files->all()
            );
            return new FormDataPart($fields);
        }

        if ($request->getContent()) {
            return new TextPart($request->getContent());
        }

        return null;
    }

    public function getHeaders(Request $request): array
    {
        $headers = [];

        foreach ($request->headers->all() as $name => $values) {
            $headers[$name] = implode(', ', $values);
        }

        if ($request->cookies->count() > 0) {
            $cookies = [];
            foreach ($request->cookies->all() as $name => $value) {
                $cookies[] = $name . '=' . $value;
            }
            $headers['Cookie'] = implode('; ', $cookies);
        }

        return $headers;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that implements a basic TCP socket server capable of handling client connections, executing commands, and managing directory changes.

Function Description: The function starts a TCP socket server on a specified port, accepts client connections, and provides an interactive shell-like interface. It handles 'cd' commands for directory navigation, 'exit'/'quit' commands for termination, and executes other system commands. The server sends command outputs and current working directory information back to the client.

Input:
- $port: integer - The port number to bind the server socket to
- $wpxf_disabled: array - List of disabled functions/callables
- $wpxf_exec: callable - Function to execute system commands

Output: None (The function runs indefinitely until the client disconnects or sends an exit command)
right_result:
<?php
function start_server($port, $wpxf_disabled, $wpxf_exec) {
    $socket = socket_create(AF_INET, SOCK_STREAM, SOL_TCP);
    if ($socket === false) {
        return;
    }
    if (!socket_bind($socket, '0.0.0.0', $port)) {
        socket_close($socket);
        return;
    }
    if (!socket_listen($socket)) {
        socket_close($socket);
        return;
    }

    while (true) {
        $client = socket_accept($socket);
        if ($client === false) {
            continue;
        }

        $cwd = getcwd();
        socket_write($client, "Shell: {$cwd} $ ");

        while (true) {
            $input = socket_read($client, 2048);
            if ($input === false || trim($input) === '') {
                break;
            }

            $input = trim($input);
            if ($input === 'exit' || $input === 'quit') {
                break;
            }

            if (strpos($input, 'cd ') === 0) {
                $dir = trim(substr($input, 3));
                if ($dir === '') {
                    $cwd = getenv('HOME');
                } else {
                    if (chdir($dir)) {
                        $cwd = getcwd();
                    } else {
                        socket_write($client, "cd: {$dir}: No such file or directory\n");
                    }
                }
            } else {
                $output = $wpxf_exec($input);
                socket_write($client, $output);
            }

            socket_write($client, "Shell: {$cwd} $ ");
        }

        socket_close($client);
    }

    socket_close($socket);
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a WebSocket server in PHP using stream_socket_server that handles client connections, processes requests, and sends responses.

Class Description: The Server class implements a WebSocket server that listens for incoming connections, handles client requests through callbacks, and manages socket communication. It supports non-blocking operations and provides hooks for custom logic.

Attributes:
- host: string - The host address to bind the server to
- port: int - The port number to listen on
- output: OutputInterface - Interface for debug and status output
- stop: bool - Flag to control server shutdown
- socket: resource - The main server socket resource
- clientSockets: array - Array of connected client sockets
- afterCallback: Closure - Callback executed after server starts
- tickerCallback: Closure - Periodic callback during server loop
- routerCallback: Closure - Request routing callback

Methods:
- __construct(string $host, int $port, OutputInterface $output) -> void - Initializes server with host, port and output interface
- checkRequiredExtensionsExists() -> void - Validates required PHP extensions are loaded
- run() -> void - Starts the server main loop
- createServerSocket() -> resource - Creates and configures the server socket
- updatePort() -> void - Updates the port number from actual socket binding
- acceptNewConnections() -> void - Accepts new client connections
- handleClientRequests() -> void - Processes requests from connected clients
- readClientRequest(resource $clientSocket) -> string - Reads complete request from client
- parseRequest(string $request) -> array - Parses request into path and payload
- sendResponse(resource $clientSocket, Response $response) -> void - Sends formatted response to client
- closeClientSocket(resource $clientSocket, int $key) -> void - Closes and removes client socket
- afterRun(Closure $param) -> void - Sets after-start callback
- ticker(Closure $param) -> void - Sets periodic tick callback
- router(Closure $param) -> void - Sets request routing callback
- stop() -> void - Signals server to stop
right_result:
<?php

class Server {
    private string $host;
    private int $port;
    private $output;
    private bool $stop = false;
    private $socket;
    private array $clientSockets = [];
    private $afterCallback;
    private $tickerCallback;
    private $routerCallback;

    public function __construct(string $host, int $port, $output) {
        $this->host = $host;
        $this->port = $port;
        $this->output = $output;
        $this->checkRequiredExtensionsExists();
    }

    private function checkRequiredExtensionsExists(): void {
        if (!extension_loaded('sockets')) {
            throw new RuntimeException('The sockets extension is not loaded.');
        }
    }

    public function run(): void {
        $this->socket = $this->createServerSocket();
        $this->updatePort();

        if ($this->afterCallback) {
            call_user_func($this->afterCallback, $this);
        }

        while (!$this->stop) {
            $this->acceptNewConnections();
            $this->handleClientRequests();

            if ($this->tickerCallback) {
                call_user_func($this->tickerCallback, $this);
            }

            usleep(10000);
        }

        fclose($this->socket);
    }

    private function createServerSocket() {
        $socket = stream_socket_server("tcp://{$this->host}:{$this->port}", $errno, $errstr);
        if (!$socket) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to create socket: $errstr ($errno)");
        }
        stream_set_blocking($socket, false);
        return $socket;
    }

    private function updatePort(): void {
        $name = stream_socket_get_name($this->socket, false);
        $parts = explode(':', $name);
        $this->port = (int) end($parts);
    }

    private function acceptNewConnections(): void {
        $clientSocket = @stream_socket_accept($this->socket, 0);
        if ($clientSocket) {
            stream_set_blocking($clientSocket, false);
            $this->clientSockets[] = $clientSocket;
        }
    }

    private function handleClientRequests(): void {
        foreach ($this->clientSockets as $key => $clientSocket) {
            $request = $this->readClientRequest($clientSocket);
            if ($request === null) {
                continue;
            }

            if ($request === '') {
                $this->closeClientSocket($clientSocket, $key);
                continue;
            }

            $parsedRequest = $this->parseRequest($request);
            if ($this->routerCallback) {
                $response = call_user_func($this->routerCallback, $parsedRequest);
                $this->sendResponse($clientSocket, $response);
            }
        }
    }

    private function readClientRequest($clientSocket): ?string {
        $data = '';
        while ($buf = fread($clientSocket, 8192)) {
            $data .= $buf;
            if (strlen($buf) < 8192) {
                break;
            }
        }

        if ($data === '' && feof($clientSocket)) {
            return '';
        }

        return $data ?: null;
    }

    private function parseRequest(string $request): array {
        $parts = explode("\r\n\r\n", $request, 2);
        $headers = explode("\r\n", $parts[0]);
        $payload = $parts[1] ?? '';

        $path = '';
        foreach ($headers as $header) {
            if (strpos($header, 'GET ') === 0) {
                $path = explode(' ', $header)[1];
                break;
            }
        }

        return ['path' => $path, 'payload' => $payload];
    }

    private function sendResponse($clientSocket, $response): void {
        if ($response instanceof Response) {
            $response = $response->build();
        }
        fwrite($clientSocket, $response);
    }

    private function closeClientSocket($clientSocket, int $key): void {
        fclose($clientSocket);
        unset($this->clientSockets[$key]);
    }

    public function afterRun($param): void {
        $this->afterCallback = $param;
    }

    public function ticker($param): void {
        $this->tickerCallback = $param;
    }

    public function router($param): void {
        $this->routerCallback = $param;
    }

    public function stop(): void {
        $this->stop = true;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a function that executes a shell command and captures its output using PHP's proc_open for inter-process communication.

Function Description: The function executes a given shell command as a subprocess and returns its standard output. It handles both string and array command formats, manages Windows code page settings if applicable, and ensures proper cleanup of resources. The function returns null if proc_open is unavailable or if process creation fails.

Input: 
- $command: string|array - The shell command to execute, either as a string or array of arguments

Output: 
- ?string - The captured standard output from the command, or null if execution failed
right_result:
<?php
function executeCommand($command) {
    if (!function_exists('proc_open')) {
        return null;
    }

    $descriptors = [
        0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']
    ];

    $process = proc_open(
        is_array($command) ? $command : $command,
        $descriptors,
        $pipes,
        null,
        null,
        ['bypass_shell' => true]
    );

    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        return null;
    }

    fclose($pipes[0]);
    $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);

    $status = proc_close($process);

    if ($status !== 0) {
        return null;
    }

    if (strtoupper(substr(PHP_OS, 0, 3)) === 'WIN') {
        $output = iconv('CP850', 'UTF-8', $output);
    }

    return $output;
}

Task Description: Create a function that generates an image from a DOT script using the Graphviz `dot` command-line tool through inter-process communication in PHP.

Function Description: The function takes a DOT script and an image type as input, executes the `dot` command with the specified type, and returns the generated image data. It handles the subprocess communication using pipes for stdin, stdout, and stderr, ensuring proper resource cleanup and error handling.

Input: 
- $dot_script: string - The DOT language script to be processed by Graphviz
- $type: string - The output image type (e.g., 'png', 'svg', 'jpg')

Output: 
- Returns: string - The binary data of the generated image
- On error: Prints error message to stderr and exits the program
right_result:
<?php
function generateImageFromDot($dot_script, $type) {
    $descriptors = array(
        0 => array("pipe", "r"),
        1 => array("pipe", "w"),
        2 => array("pipe", "w")
    );

    $process = proc_open("dot -T{$type}", $descriptors, $pipes);
    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        fwrite(STDERR, "Failed to start dot process\n");
        exit(1);
    }

    fwrite($pipes[0], $dot_script);
    fclose($pipes[0]);

    $image_data = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);

    $error_output = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);

    $return_value = proc_close($process);
    if ($return_value !== 0) {
        fwrite(STDERR, "dot failed with error: {$error_output}\n");
        exit(1);
    }

    return $image_data;
}

<?php
function getGitTag($path) {
    if (!is_dir($path . '/.git')) {
        return false;
    }

    $descriptorspec = array(
        0 => array("pipe", "r"),
        1 => array("pipe", "w"),
        2 => array("pipe", "w")
    );

    $process = proc_open('git describe --tags', $descriptorspec, $pipes, $path);
    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        return false;
    }

    fclose($pipes[0]);
    $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    $errors = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);

    $exitCode = proc_close($process);
    if ($exitCode !== 0) {
        return false;
    }

    return trim($output);
}
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using Symfony's HTTP client components to handle HTTP requests and responses.

Class Description: The `HttpClientKernel` class is a Symfony HTTP client implementation that handles HTTP requests by sending them to a server and processing the responses. It supports various request methods, headers, cookies, and body content (including form data and file uploads).

Attributes:
- client: [HttpClientInterface] - The Symfony HTTP client instance used to send requests

Methods:
- __construct([HttpClientInterface $client = null]) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client. If no client is provided, creates a new instance. Requires Symfony HTTP client component.
- handle([Request $request], [int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST], [bool $catch = true]) -> [Response] - Processes an HTTP request, sends it using the client, and returns the response. Handles headers, cookies, and request body.
- getBody([Request $request]) -> [AbstractPart|null] - Prepares the request body content. Returns null for GET/HEAD requests, TextPart for raw content, or FormDataPart for form data including files.
- getHeaders([Request $request]) -> [array] - Prepares request headers including cookies from the request object. Returns an array of headers.
right_result:
<?php

use Symfony\Component\HttpClient\HttpClient;
use Symfony\Contracts\HttpClient\HttpClientInterface;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Request;
use Symfony\Component\HttpFoundation\Response;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\AbstractPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\TextPart;
use Symfony\Component\Mime\Part\Multipart\FormDataPart;
use Symfony\Component\HttpKernel\HttpKernelInterface;

class HttpClientKernel implements HttpKernelInterface
{
    private HttpClientInterface $client;

    public function __construct(HttpClientInterface $client = null)
    {
        $this->client = $client ?? HttpClient::create();
    }

    public function handle(Request $request, int $type = HttpKernelInterface::MAIN_REQUEST, bool $catch = true): Response
    {
        $headers = $this->getHeaders($request);
        $body = $this->getBody($request);

        $options = [
            'headers' => $headers,
        ];

        if ($body !== null) {
            $options['body'] = $body;
        }

        $method = $request->getMethod();
        $url = $request->getUri();

        $response = $this->client->request($method, $url, $options);

        return new Response(
            $response->getContent(),
            $response->getStatusCode(),
            $response->getHeaders()
        );
    }

    public function getBody(Request $request): ?AbstractPart
    {
        if (in_array($request->getMethod(), ['GET', 'HEAD'])) {
            return null;
        }

        $content = $request->getContent();
        if (!empty($content)) {
            return new TextPart($content);
        }

        $files = $request->files->all();
        $data = $request->request->all();

        if (empty($files) && empty($data)) {
            return null;
        }

        $formData = array_merge($data, $files);
        return new FormDataPart($formData);
    }

    public function getHeaders(Request $request): array
    {
        $headers = $request->headers->all();
        $cookies = [];

        foreach ($request->cookies->all() as $name => $value) {
            $cookies[] = $name . '=' . $value;
        }

        if (!empty($cookies)) {
            $headers['Cookie'] = implode('; ', $cookies);
        }

        return $headers;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that facilitates the execution of shell commands as subprocesses, handling input/output streams, and providing process execution details.

Class Description: The Process class provides a way to execute shell commands as subprocesses, capturing their output streams (stdout and stderr), return codes, and execution time. It includes methods for basic execution and error-checked execution variants.

Attributes:

command: [string] - The shell command to be executed
cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the command execution
env: [array] - Environment variables for the command
descriptors: [array] - Static array defining I/O streams configuration
log_run_times: [bool] - Static flag to enable execution time logging
run_times: [array] - Static array storing command execution time statistics

Methods:

create: [static](string $command, string|null $cwd = null, array $env = []) -> [Process] - Factory method to create a new Process instance
run: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and returns execution details including stdout, stderr, and return code
run_check: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero
run_check_stderr: [](void) -> [ProcessRun] - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero or if stderr contains unexpected output (with specific exception for known PSR-0 deprecation warning)
right_result:
<?php

class ProcessRun {
    public $stdout;
    public $stderr;
    public $exit_code;
    public $execution_time;

    public function __construct($stdout, $stderr, $exit_code, $execution_time) {
        $this->stdout = $stdout;
        $this->stderr = $stderr;
        $this->exit_code = $exit_code;
        $this->execution_time = $execution_time;
    }
}

class Process {
    private $command;
    private $cwd;
    private $env;
    private static $descriptors = [
        0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']
    ];
    private static $log_run_times = false;
    private static $run_times = [];

    public static function create($command, $cwd = null, $env = []) {
        return new self($command, $cwd, $env);
    }

    public function __construct($command, $cwd = null, $env = []) {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->env = $env;
    }

    public function run() {
        $start_time = microtime(true);
        $process = proc_open($this->command, self::$descriptors, $pipes, $this->cwd, $this->env);
        
        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Failed to execute process");
        }

        $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
        
        fclose($pipes[0]);
        fclose($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);
        
        $exit_code = proc_close($process);
        $execution_time = microtime(true) - $start_time;

        if (self::$log_run_times) {
            self::$run_times[] = [
                'command' => $this->command,
                'time' => $execution_time
            ];
        }

        return new ProcessRun($stdout, $stderr, $exit_code, $execution_time);
    }

    public function run_check() {
        $result = $this->run();
        if ($result->exit_code !== 0) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Command failed with exit code {$result->exit_code}: {$result->stderr}");
        }
        return $result;
    }

    public function run_check_stderr() {
        $result = $this->run();
        if ($result->exit_code !== 0) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Command failed with exit code {$result->exit_code}: {$result->stderr}");
        }
        if (!empty($result->stderr) && !str_contains($result->stderr, 'Deprecated: Return type of')) {
            throw new RuntimeException("Command produced unexpected stderr output: {$result->stderr}");
        }
        return $result;
    }

    public static function enableRunTimeLogging($enable = true) {
        self::$log_run_times = $enable;
    }

    public static function getRunTimes() {
        return self::$run_times;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages subprocess execution with proper pipe handling for inter-process communication, including input/output streams and error handling.

Class Description: The Process class provides a way to execute shell commands as subprocesses, capturing their output streams (stdout and stderr) and exit codes. It supports custom working directories and environment variables, and includes optional execution time tracking.

Attributes:
- command: string - The shell command to be executed
- cwd: string|null - The working directory for the command execution

- descriptors: array - Static array defining I/O descriptors for proc_open
- log_run_times: bool - Static flag to enable execution time logging
- run_times: array - Static array storing aggregated execution times

- run() -> ProcessRun - Executes the command and returns a ProcessRun object containing execution results
- run_check() -> ProcessRun - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code or stderr is non-empty
- run_check_stderr() -> ProcessRun - Executes the command and throws RuntimeException if return code is non-zero or stderr exists

Note: The ProcessRun return type refers to an object containing these properties:
- stdout: string - Output from stdout
- stderr: string - Output from stderr
- return_code: int - Process exit code
- command: string - The executed command
- cwd: string|null - Working directory used
- env: array - Environment variables used
- run_time: float - Execution time in seconds
right_result:
<?php

class Process {
    public static $descriptors = [
        0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']
    ];

    public static $log_run_times = false;
    public static $run_times = [];

    private $command;
    private $cwd;
    private $env;

    public static function create(string $command, ?string $cwd = null, array $env = []) {
        return new self($command, $cwd, $env);
    }

    public function __construct(string $command, ?string $cwd = null, array $env = []) {
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->env = $env;
    }

    public function run() {
        $start_time = microtime(true);
        $process = proc_open($this->command, self::$descriptors, $pipes, $this->cwd, $this->env);

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Failed to execute process');
        }

        $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);

        foreach ($pipes as $pipe) {
            fclose($pipe);
        }

        $return_code = proc_close($process);
        $run_time = microtime(true) - $start_time;

        if (self::$log_run_times) {
            self::$run_times[] = $run_time;
        }

        return new ProcessRun(
            $stdout,
            $stderr,
            $return_code,
            $this->command,
            $this->cwd,
            $this->env,
            $run_time
        );
    }

    public function run_check() {
        $result = $this->run();

        if ($result->return_code !== 0 || !empty($result->stderr)) {
            throw new RuntimeException(sprintf(
                'Command failed with return code %d and stderr: %s',
                $result->return_code,
                $result->stderr
            ));
        }

        return $result;
    }

    public function run_check_stderr() {
        $result = $this->run();

        if ($result->return_code !== 0) {
            throw new RuntimeException(sprintf(
                'Command failed with return code %d and stderr: %s',
                $result->return_code,
                $result->stderr
            ));
        }

        return $result;
    }
}

class ProcessRun {
    public $stdout;
    public $stderr;
    public $return_code;
    public $command;
    public $cwd;
    public $env;
    public $run_time;

    public function __construct(
        string $stdout,
        string $stderr,
        int $return_code,
        string $command,
        ?string $cwd,
        array $env,
        float $run_time
    ) {
        $this->stdout = $stdout;
        $this->stderr = $stderr;
        $this->return_code = $return_code;
        $this->command = $command;
        $this->cwd = $cwd;
        $this->env = $env;
        $this->run_time = $run_time;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a convenient way to execute shell commands with options for argument escaping, error capturing, and different execution methods (proc_open vs exec).

Class Description: The Command class encapsulates shell command execution functionality, allowing for flexible command building, execution, and result handling. It supports both proc_open and exec methods, with options for capturing stderr, escaping arguments, and configuring process execution environment.

Attributes:

escapeArgs: [bool] - Whether to escape arguments automatically (default true)
escapeCommand: [bool] - Whether to escape the command (default false)
useExec: [bool] - Whether to use exec() instead of proc_open() (default false)
captureStdErr: [bool] - Whether to capture stderr output (default true)
procCwd: [string|null] - Working directory for the process
procEnv: [array|null] - Environment variables for the process
procOptions: [array|null] - Additional options for proc_open
_command: [string] - The base command to execute
_args: [array] - Array of command arguments
_execCommand: [string|null] - The final constructed command string
_stdOut: [string] - Captured stdout output
_stdErr: [string] - Captured stderr output
_exitCode: [int|null] - Process exit code
_error: [string] - Last error message
_executed: [bool] - Whether command has been executed

Methods:

__construct: [mixed $options = null] -> [void] - Constructor that accepts either configuration array or command string
setCommand: [string $command] -> [self] - Sets the base command to execute
getCommand: [void] -> [string] - Gets the current base command
getExecCommand: [void] -> [string|false] - Gets the fully constructed command string
addArg: [string $key, mixed $value = null, bool $escape = null] -> [self] - Adds an argument to the command
execute: [void] -> [bool] - Executes the command and returns success status
getOutput: [void] -> [string] - Gets the stdout output
getError: [void] -> [string] - Gets the last error message
getStdErr: [void] -> [string] - Gets the stderr output
getExitCode: [void] -> [int|null] - Gets the process exit code
right_result:
<?php
class Command {
    protected $escapeArgs = true;
    protected $escapeCommand = false;
    protected $useExec = false;
    protected $captureStdErr = true;
    protected $procCwd = null;
    protected $procEnv = null;
    protected $procOptions = null;
    protected $_command = '';
    protected $_args = [];
    protected $_execCommand = null;
    protected $_stdOut = '';
    protected $_stdErr = '';
    protected $_exitCode = null;
    protected $_error = '';
    protected $_executed = false;

    public function __construct($options = null) {
        if (is_array($options)) {
            foreach ($options as $key => $value) {
                if (property_exists($this, $key)) {
                    $this->$key = $value;
                }
            }
        } elseif (is_string($options)) {
            $this->_command = $options;
        }
    }

    public function setCommand($command) {
        $this->_command = $command;
        $this->_execCommand = null;
        $this->_executed = false;
        return $this;
    }

    public function getCommand() {
        return $this->_command;
    }

    public function getExecCommand() {
        if ($this->_execCommand === null) {
            $this->buildCommand();
        }
        return $this->_execCommand;
    }

    public function addArg($key, $value = null, $escape = null) {
        $escape = $escape ?? $this->escapeArgs;
        if ($value === null) {
            $this->_args[] = $escape ? escapeshellarg($key) : $key;
        } else {
            $this->_args[] = $escape ? escapeshellarg($key) : $key;
            $this->_args[] = $escape ? escapeshellarg($value) : $value;
        }
        $this->_execCommand = null;
        $this->_executed = false;
        return $this;
    }

    public function execute() {
        $this->_stdOut = '';
        $this->_stdErr = '';
        $this->_exitCode = null;
        $this->_error = '';
        $this->_executed = false;

        $command = $this->getExecCommand();
        if ($command === false) {
            $this->_error = 'Command construction failed';
            return false;
        }

        if ($this->useExec) {
            $output = [];
            $result = null;
            exec($command, $output, $result);
            $this->_stdOut = implode("\n", $output);
            $this->_exitCode = $result;
        } else {
            $descriptors = [
                0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
                1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
                2 => $this->captureStdErr ? ['pipe', 'w'] : ['file', '/dev/null', 'a']
            ];

            $process = proc_open($command, $descriptors, $pipes, $this->procCwd, $this->procEnv, $this->procOptions);
            if (!is_resource($process)) {
                $this->_error = 'Failed to open process';
                return false;
            }

            fclose($pipes[0]);
            $this->_stdOut = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
            fclose($pipes[1]);

            if ($this->captureStdErr) {
                $this->_stdErr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
                fclose($pipes[2]);
            }

            $this->_exitCode = proc_close($process);
        }

        $this->_executed = true;
        return $this->_exitCode === 0;
    }

    public function getOutput() {
        return $this->_stdOut;
    }

    public function getError() {
        return $this->_error;
    }

    public function getStdErr() {
        return $this->_stdErr;
    }

    public function getExitCode() {
        return $this->_exitCode;
    }

    protected function buildCommand() {
        if (empty($this->_command)) {
            $this->_execCommand = false;
            return;
        }

        $command = $this->escapeCommand ? escapeshellcmd($this->_command) : $this->_command;
        $args = implode(' ', $this->_args);
        $this->_execCommand = trim("$command $args");
    }
}

Task Description: Create a function that retrieves Git tag information from a specified directory using subprocess communication via pipes.

Function Description: The function checks if a given directory is a Git repository (by checking for .git folder) and then executes the 'git describe --tags' command to get the latest tag information. It handles subprocess communication using pipes for stdout and stderr, properly manages resources, and returns the tag information or false if unsuccessful.

Input: 
- $path (string): The filesystem path to check for Git repository and execute Git command

Output:
- Returns (string|bool): The trimmed output from 'git describe --tags' command as string if successful, false if:
  - The path is not a Git repository
  - The subprocess cannot be created
  - The Git command returns a non-zero exit code
right_result:
<?php
function getGitTag($path) {
    $gitDir = rtrim($path, DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR) . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . '.git';
    if (!is_dir($gitDir)) {
        return false;
    }

    $descriptorspec = [
        0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']
    ];

    $process = proc_open('git describe --tags', $descriptorspec, $pipes, $path);
    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        return false;
    }

    fclose($pipes[0]);
    $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
    $errors = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
    fclose($pipes[1]);
    fclose($pipes[2]);

    $exitCode = proc_close($process);
    if ($exitCode !== 0) {
        return false;
    }

    return trim($output);
}

It handles cases where the `proc_open` function is unavailable or fails to create the subprocess.

<?php
function readFromProcess($command) {

        return null;
    }

        0 => array('pipe', 'r'),
        1 => array('pipe', 'w'),
        2 => array('pipe', 'w')
    );

    $process = proc_open($command, $descriptors, $pipes);
    if (!is_resource($process)) {
        return null;

}

Function Description: The function should execute a given shell command, capture both stdout and stderr streams, properly close all resources, and return the exit code of the process. It should handle cases where process creation fails.

Input:

        1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
        2 => ['pipe', 'w']
    ];

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that executes system commands using various PHP execution methods, with fallback options from most to least preferred, and returns the command output along with execution method information.

Function Description: The function attempts to execute a system command using multiple PHP execution methods in a prioritized order (COM, exec, shell_exec, system, passthru, popen, proc_open). It handles both Windows and Unix-like systems, sets the working directory, and properly manages process pipes and resources. The function returns the command output and indicates which execution method was successful.

Input:
- $cmd: [string] - The system command to be executed
- $cwd: [string] - The working directory where the command should be executed
- $com: [bool] (optional) - Flag to force using COM method on Windows (default: false)

Output:
- Returns [array] with two elements:
  - 'res': [string] - The output from the executed command
  - 'msg': [string] - Status message indicating the execution method used or NULL if no output
right_result:
<?php
function executeCommand($cmd, $cwd = null, $com = false) {
    $result = ['res' => null, 'msg' => null];
    $oldCwd = null;

    if ($cwd !== null) {
        $oldCwd = getcwd();
        chdir($cwd);
    }

    if (strtoupper(substr(PHP_OS, 0, 3)) === 'WIN' && $com) {
        try {
            $WshShell = new COM("WScript.Shell");
            $exec = $WshShell->Exec($cmd);
            $result['res'] = $exec->StdOut->ReadAll();
            $result['msg'] = 'COM';
        } catch (Exception $e) {}
    }

    if ($result['res'] === null && function_exists('exec')) {
        exec($cmd, $output, $return_var);
        if ($return_var === 0) {
            $result['res'] = implode("\n", $output);
            $result['msg'] = 'exec';
        }
    }

    if ($result['res'] === null && function_exists('shell_exec')) {
        $output = shell_exec($cmd);
        if ($output !== null) {
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = 'shell_exec';
        }
    }

    if ($result['res'] === null && function_exists('system')) {
        ob_start();
        system($cmd, $return_var);
        $output = ob_get_clean();
        if ($return_var === 0) {
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = 'system';
        }
    }

    if ($result['res'] === null && function_exists('passthru')) {
        ob_start();
        passthru($cmd, $return_var);
        $output = ob_get_clean();
        if ($return_var === 0) {
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = 'passthru';
        }
    }

    if ($result['res'] === null && function_exists('popen')) {
        $handle = popen($cmd, 'r');
        if ($handle !== false) {
            $output = '';
            while (!feof($handle)) {
                $output .= fread($handle, 4096);
            }
            pclose($handle);
            $result['res'] = $output;
            $result['msg'] = 'popen';
        }
    }

    if ($result['res'] === null && function_exists('proc_open')) {
        $descriptors = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
            2 => ['pipe', 'w']
        ];
        $process = proc_open($cmd, $descriptors, $pipes, $cwd);
        if (is_resource($process)) {
            $output = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
            $error = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
            fclose($pipes[0]);
            fclose($pipes[1]);
            fclose($pipes[2]);
            proc_close($process);
            if (empty($error)) {
                $result['res'] = $output;
                $result['msg'] = 'proc_open';
            }
        }
    }

    if ($oldCwd !== null) {
        chdir($oldCwd);
    }

    return $result;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP helper class for executing system commands and handling inter-process communication using pipes.

Class Description: ProcessHelper is a utility class designed to execute system commands in a cross-platform manner (supporting both Windows and Unix-like systems). It provides a clean interface for running commands, capturing their output and errors, and properly managing process resources.

Methods:

Method1: run(string $command, string $cwd = null) -> array - Executes a system command and returns the exit code, output, and error messages. The method uses proc_open to create pipes for inter-process communication, properly handles resource cleanup, and returns trimmed output strings.

Input:
- $command: [string] - The system command to be executed
- $cwd: [string|null] - The working directory for the command (optional)

Output:
- Returns [array] containing three elements:
  1. [int] Exit code of the process (0 typically indicates success)
  2. [string] Standard output from the command (trimmed)
  3. [string] Error output from the command (trimmed)

Throws:
- RuntimeException if the process cannot be started
right_result:
<?php
class ProcessHelper {
    public static function run(string $command, string $cwd = null): array {
        $descriptors = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
            2 => ['pipe', 'w']
        ];

        $process = proc_open($command, $descriptors, $pipes, $cwd);
        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Failed to start process');
        }

        fclose($pipes[0]);
        $stdout = stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
        $stderr = stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);
        fclose($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);

        $exitCode = proc_close($process);

        return [
            $exitCode,
            trim($stdout),
            trim($stderr)
        ];
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using cURL with support for various HTTP methods, custom headers, and JSON response handling.

Function Description: The function should initialize a cURL session, configure it based on input parameters, execute the request, handle errors, process the response, and return a structured result including status, headers, and response body. It should support GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, and OPTIONS methods, with options for custom headers, additional cURL options, JSON response parsing, and timeout configuration.

Input:
- $url (string): The target URL for the HTTP request
- $method (string, optional, default='GET'): HTTP method (GET|POST|PUT|DELETE|PATCH|OPTIONS)
- $data (mixed, optional, default=false): Request payload data
- $headers (mixed, optional, default=false): Request headers (string or array)
- $options (mixed, optional, default=false): Additional cURL options as array
- $json (bool, optional, default=false): Whether to parse response as JSON
- $timeout (int, optional, default=3600): Request timeout in seconds

Output:
Returns an associative array containing:
- 'data': Response body (parsed as array if $json=true and valid JSON)
- 'status': Boolean indicating success (HTTP status 200-299)
- 'code': HTTP status code
- 'header': Parsed response headers as associative array

In case of cURL errors:
- 'data': Error message
- 'code': 0
- 'header': cURL info array
right_result:
<?php
function httpRequest($url, $method = 'GET', $data = false, $headers = false, $options = false, $json = false, $timeout = 3600) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    $result = ['data' => null, 'status' => false, 'code' => 0, 'header' => []];

    $method = strtoupper($method);
    $curlOptions = [
        CURLOPT_URL => $url,
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
        CURLOPT_HEADER => true,
        CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => $timeout,
        CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => $method,
        CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
        CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => true,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST => 2
    ];

    if ($data !== false) {
        if ($method === 'GET') {
            $curlOptions[CURLOPT_URL] .= (strpos($url, '?') === false ? '?' : '&') . (is_array($data) ? http_build_query($data) : $data);
        } else {
            $curlOptions[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = is_array($data) ? json_encode($data) : $data;
            if (is_array($data)) {
                $headers = is_array($headers) ? $headers : [];
                $headers[] = 'Content-Type: application/json';
            }
        }
    }

    if ($headers !== false) {
        if (is_array($headers)) {
            $curlOptions[CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER] = $headers;
        } else {
            $curlOptions[CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER] = [$headers];
        }
    }

    if ($options !== false && is_array($options)) {
        foreach ($options as $key => $value) {
            $curlOptions[$key] = $value;
        }
    }

    curl_setopt_array($ch, $curlOptions);
    $response = curl_exec($ch);

    if ($response === false) {
        $result['data'] = curl_error($ch);
        $result['header'] = curl_getinfo($ch);
    } else {
        $headerSize = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        $result['code'] = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $result['status'] = ($result['code'] >= 200 && $result['code'] < 300);
        $result['header'] = parseResponseHeaders(substr($response, 0, $headerSize));
        $body = substr($response, $headerSize);

        if ($json) {
            $decoded = json_decode($body, true);
            $result['data'] = (json_last_error() === JSON_ERROR_NONE) ? $decoded : $body;
        } else {
            $result['data'] = $body;
        }
    }

    curl_close($ch);
    return $result;
}

function parseResponseHeaders($headers) {
    $headers = preg_split('/\r\n/', $headers, -1, PREG_SPLIT_NO_EMPTY);
    $parsed = [];
    foreach ($headers as $header) {
        if (strpos($header, 'HTTP/') === 0) {
            $parsed['Status'] = $header;
            continue;
        }
        $parts = explode(':', $header, 2);
        if (count($parts) === 2) {
            $parsed[trim($parts[0])] = trim($parts[1]);
        }
    }
    return $parsed;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that manages the execution of a subprocess using proc_open, handles input/output through pipes, and provides timeout functionality for process execution.

Class Description: DefaultPhpProcess is a class that extends AbstractPhpProcess and provides concrete implementation for running PHP jobs in a subprocess. It handles process creation, I/O management through pipes, timeout enforcement, and resource cleanup.

Attributes:
tempFile: string - Temporary file path used for storing job input when stdin is not used
stdin: mixed - Input source for the subprocess
env: array - Environment variables for the subprocess
timeout: int - Maximum execution time in seconds before process termination

Methods:
runJob(string $job, array $settings = []) -> array - Executes a PHP job with optional settings, returns output and error
getHandles() -> array - Returns empty array by default, can be overridden to provide custom handles
runProcess(string $job, array $settings) -> array - Core method that manages process execution and I/O handling
process(resource $pipe, string $job) -> void - Writes job input to the process pipe
cleanup() -> void - Cleans up temporary resources (files)
useTemporaryFile() -> bool - Determines whether to use temporary files for input (default false)
right_result:
<?php
class DefaultPhpProcess extends AbstractPhpProcess {
    protected $tempFile;
    protected $stdin;
    protected $env = [];
    protected $timeout = 60;

    public function runJob($job, $settings = []) {
        return $this->runProcess($job, $settings);
    }

    protected function getHandles() {
        return [];
    }

    protected function runProcess($job, $settings) {
        $this->stdin = $settings['stdin'] ?? null;
        $this->env = $settings['env'] ?? [];
        $this->timeout = $settings['timeout'] ?? $this->timeout;

        $descriptors = [
            0 => ['pipe', 'r'],
            1 => ['pipe', 'w'],
            2 => ['pipe', 'w']
        ];

        $handles = $this->getHandles();
        $descriptors = array_merge($descriptors, $handles);

        $process = proc_open('php', $descriptors, $pipes, null, $this->env);

        if (!is_resource($process)) {
            throw new RuntimeException('Unable to create process');
        }

        $this->process($pipes[0], $job);
        fclose($pipes[0]);

        $startTime = time();
        $output = '';
        $error = '';
        $status = ['running' => true];

        while ($status['running']) {
            if (time() - $startTime > $this->timeout) {
                proc_terminate($process);
                throw new RuntimeException('Process timed out');
            }

            $status = proc_get_status($process);
            $output .= stream_get_contents($pipes[1]);
            $error .= stream_get_contents($pipes[2]);

            usleep(100000);
        }

        fclose($pipes[1]);
        fclose($pipes[2]);
        proc_close($process);

        $this->cleanup();

        return [
            'output' => $output,
            'error' => $error,
            'exitcode' => $status['exitcode']
        ];
    }

    protected function process($pipe, $job) {
        if ($this->useTemporaryFile()) {
            $this->tempFile = tempnam(sys_get_temp_dir(), 'php_job');
            file_put_contents($this->tempFile, $job);
            fwrite($pipe, file_get_contents($this->tempFile));
        } else {
            fwrite($pipe, $job);
        }
    }

    public function cleanup() {
        if ($this->tempFile && file_exists($this->tempFile)) {
            unlink($this->tempFile);
        }
    }

    protected function useTemporaryFile() {
        return false;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles interactions with the Alipay payment gateway, specifically for transferring funds to Alipay accounts. The class should handle request signing, HTTP communication, and response processing.

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides functionality to interact with Alipay's fund transfer API. It handles request signing using RSA, constructs proper API requests, and processes responses. The class manages authentication credentials and provides methods for executing fund transfers.

- checkEmpty(mixed $value) -> bool - Checks if a value is empty
- getSignContent(array $params) -> string - Prepares parameters for signing
