right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    protected $appId;
    protected $rsaPrivateKey;
    protected $alipayRootCertSn;
    protected $appCertSn;
    protected $charset = 'utf-8';

    public function __construct($appid, $rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setAlipayRootCertSn($alipayRootCertSn) {
        $this->alipayRootCertSn = $alipayRootCertSn;
    }

    public function setAppCertSn($appCertSn) {
        $this->appCertSn = $appCertSn;
    }

    public function doTransfer($totalFee, $outTradeNo, $account, $realName, $remark='') {
        $bizContent = [
            'out_biz_no' => $outTradeNo,
            'trans_amount' => $totalFee,
            'product_code' => 'TRANS_ACCOUNT_NO_PWD',
            'biz_scene' => 'DIRECT_TRANSFER',
            'payee_info' => [
                'identity' => $account,
                'identity_type' => 'ALIPAY_LOGON_ID',
                'name' => $realName
            ]
        ];

        if (!empty($remark)) {
            $bizContent['remark'] = $remark;
        }

        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'method' => 'alipay.fund.trans.uni.transfer',
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA2',
            'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
            'version' => '1.0',
            'biz_content' => json_encode($bizContent)
        ];

        if (!empty($this->alipayRootCertSn)) {
            $params['alipay_root_cert_sn'] = $this->alipayRootCertSn;
        }

        if (!empty($this->appCertSn)) {
            $params['app_cert_sn'] = $this->appCertSn;
        }

        $params['sign'] = $this->generateSign($params, 'RSA2');

        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do';
        $result = $this->curlPost($url, $params);
        return json_decode($result, true);
    }

    protected function curlPost($url = '', $postData = '', $options = array()) {
        if (is_array($postData)) {
            $postData = http_build_query($postData);
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);

        if (!empty($options)) {
            curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);
        }

        $data = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $data;
    }

    protected function generateSign($params, $signType = "RSA") {
        $signContent = $this->getSignContent($params);
        return $this->sign($signContent, $signType);
    }

    protected function sign($data, $signType = "RSA") {
        $res = "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\n" .
            wordwrap($this->rsaPrivateKey, 64, "\n", true) .
            "\n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----";

        if ("RSA2" == $signType) {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        } else {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res);
        }

        return base64_encode($sign);
    }

    protected function checkEmpty($value) {
        if (!isset($value))
            return true;
        if ($value === null)
            return true;
        if (trim($value) === "")
            return true;

        return false;
    }

    protected function getSignContent($params) {
        ksort($params);
        $stringToBeSigned = "";
        $i = 0;
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if (false === $this->checkEmpty($v) && "@" != substr($v, 0, 1)) {
                if ($i == 0) {
                    $stringToBeSigned .= "$k" . "=" . "$v";
                } else {
                    $stringToBeSigned .= "&" . "$k" . "=" . "$v";
                }
                $i++;
            }
        }
        unset ($k, $v);
        return $stringToBeSigned;
    }

    protected function characet($data, $targetCharset) {
        if (!empty($data)) {
            $fileType = $this->charset;
            if (strcasecmp($fileType, $targetCharset) != 0) {
                $data = mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, $fileType);
            }
        }
        return $data;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL for sending upgrade notifications, with error handling and response processing capabilities.

Class Description: UpgradeNoticeBehavior is a class designed to manage HTTP communications for upgrade notifications. It encapsulates cURL functionality to send requests to specified URLs, handle parameters and headers, process responses, and manage errors.

Attributes:
header_: [string] - Stores HTTP headers for requests
httpCode_: [int] - Stores HTTP status code from responses
httpDesc_: [string] - Stores HTTP status description from responses
accesskey_: [string] - Stores access key for authentication
secretkey_: [string] - Stores secret key for authentication

Methods:
send: [send]([string $url, array $params = array(), array $headers = array()]) -> [mixed] - Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL with optional parameters and headers. Returns the decoded JSON response on success or false on failure. Handles cURL errors and invalid response formats.
right_result:
<?php
class UpgradeNoticeBehavior {
    private $header_ = '';
    private $httpCode_ = 0;
    private $httpDesc_ = '';
    private $accesskey_ = '';
    private $secretkey_ = '';

    public function send($url, $params = array(), $headers = array()) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        $options = array(
            CURLOPT_URL => $url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_HEADER => false,
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
            CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
            CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
            CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
            CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => 'POST',
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => json_encode($params),
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array_merge(
                array('Content-Type: application/json'),
                $headers
            )
        );

        curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->httpCode_ = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->httpDesc_ = curl_error($ch);
        $this->header_ = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_OUT);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        $decoded = json_decode($response, true);
        return json_last_error() === JSON_ERROR_NONE ? $decoded : false;
    }

    public function getHeader() {
        return $this->header_;
    }

    public function getHttpCode() {
        return $this->httpCode_;
    }

    public function getHttpDesc() {
        return $this->httpDesc_;
    }

    public function setAccessKey($key) {
        $this->accesskey_ = $key;
    }

    public function setSecretKey($key) {
        $this->secretkey_ = $key;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL with support for custom headers, payloads, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: The Meting class provides functionality to make HTTP requests using PHP's cURL library. It supports GET/POST requests, custom headers, timeout settings, retry mechanism, and proxy configuration.

Attributes:
- header: array - Stores HTTP headers to be sent with the request
- proxy: string - Stores proxy server address if configured
- raw: mixed - Stores the raw response from the cURL request
- info: array - Stores cURL request information
- error: int - Stores cURL error code if any
- status: string - Stores cURL error message if any

Methods:
- curl(string $url, mixed $payload = null, int $headerOnly = 0) -> self - Makes an HTTP request to the specified URL with optional payload and header-only response flag. Returns the class instance for method chaining.
  Parameters:
    - $url: string - The target URL for the request
    - $payload: mixed - Optional request payload (array or string)
    - $headerOnly: int - Flag to return only headers (1) or full response (0)
right_result:
<?php
class Meting {
    public $header = array();
    public $proxy = '';
    public $raw;
    public $info;
    public $error;
    public $status;

    public function curl($url, $payload = null, $headerOnly = 0) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, $headerOnly);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 10);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, 10);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

        if (!empty($this->header)) {
            $headers = array();
            foreach ($this->header as $key => $value) {
                $headers[] = $key . ': ' . $value;
            }
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }

        if (!empty($this->proxy)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $this->proxy);
        }

        if (!is_null($payload)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
            if (is_array($payload)) {
                $payload = http_build_query($payload);
            }
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $payload);
        }

        $this->raw = curl_exec($ch);
        $this->info = curl_getinfo($ch);
        $this->error = curl_errno($ch);
        $this->status = curl_error($ch);

        curl_close($ch);
        return $this;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class for handling HTTP requests to interact with WeChat Pay API, supporting both GET and POST methods with proper SSL configuration.

Class Description: The Wechatpay class provides methods for making HTTP requests to WeChat Pay API endpoints. It handles both GET and POST requests, with special consideration for HTTPS connections and SSL configuration. The class includes error handling through HTTP status codes.

Methods:

Method1: http_get(string $url) -> string|false - Performs a GET request to the specified URL. Returns the response content if successful (HTTP 200), or false otherwise.
Method2: http_post(string $url, array $param, bool $post_file=false) -> string|false - Performs a POST request to the specified URL with given parameters. Handles both regular form data and file uploads. Returns the response content if successful (HTTP 200), or false otherwise.
right_result:
<?php
class Wechatpay {
    public function http_get($url) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        return $httpCode == 200 ? $response : false;
    }

    public function http_post($url, $param, $post_file = false) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);

        if ($post_file) {
            if (class_exists('CURLFile')) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SAFE_UPLOAD, true);
                foreach ($param as $key => $value) {
                    if (is_string($value) && is_file($value)) {
                        $param[$key] = new CURLFile($value);
                    }
                }
            } else {
                foreach ($param as $key => $value) {
                    if (is_string($value) && is_file($value)) {
                        $param[$key] = '@' . $value;
                    }
                }
            }
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $param);
        } else {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($param));
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        return $httpCode == 200 ? $response : false;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a class that handles file downloads using cURL in PHP, with support for temporary file management and cleanup.

Class Description: The CurlDownloader class provides functionality to download files from a given URL using cURL, storing them in a temporary directory, and managing the downloaded files' lifecycle.

Attributes:
- tempDir: string - The directory path where temporary files will be stored. Defaults to system temp directory if not specified.
- outputFile: string - The path to the downloaded file.

Methods:
- setTempDir(string $tempDir) -> void - Sets the temporary directory for storing downloaded files.
- download(string $url) -> bool - Downloads a file from the specified URL using cURL. Returns true on success, throws ErrorException on failure.
- getFilename() -> string - Returns the path to the downloaded file.
- cleanup() -> void - Removes the downloaded file if it exists.

Input:
- For setTempDir(): A string representing the directory path.
- For download(): A string representing the URL to download from.

Output:
- For download(): A boolean indicating success (true) or failure (false).
- For getFilename(): A string representing the path to the downloaded file.
- Other methods do not return values.
right_result:
<?php

class CurlDownloader {
    private $tempDir;
    private $outputFile;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->tempDir = sys_get_temp_dir();
    }

    public function setTempDir(string $tempDir): void {
        if (!is_dir($tempDir)) {
            throw new ErrorException("Directory does not exist: $tempDir");
        }
        $this->tempDir = rtrim($tempDir, DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR);
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool {
        if (!filter_var($url, FILTER_VALIDATE_URL)) {
            throw new ErrorException("Invalid URL: $url");
        }

        $this->outputFile = $this->tempDir . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . basename($url);
        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'w+');

        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 60);

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        fclose($fp);

        if ($result === false) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            throw new ErrorException("Download failed: $error");
        }

        return true;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string {
        if (!isset($this->outputFile)) {
            throw new ErrorException("No file has been downloaded yet");
        }
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup(): void {
        if (isset($this->outputFile) && file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests to the OpenAI API using cURL, with support for different content types, streaming, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: The OpenAi class is designed to interact with OpenAI's API by sending HTTP requests. It manages API keys, content types, headers, and request configurations. The class supports both JSON and multipart/form-data content types, allows for request streaming, and can be configured to use a proxy.

Attributes:

engine: string - The default OpenAI engine to use (default: "davinci")
model: string - The default model for completions (default: "text-davinci-002")
chatModel: string - The default model for chat completions (default: "gpt-3.5-turbo")
assistantsBetaVersion: string - The version for assistants API (default: "v1")
headers: array - Array of HTTP headers to be sent with requests
contentTypes: array - Mapping of content types to their header strings
timeout: int - cURL timeout in seconds (default: 0)
stream_method: object - Callback method for streaming responses
customUrl: string - Custom base URL to override the default OpenAI API URL
proxy: string - Proxy server address if needed
curlInfo: array - Information about the last cURL request

Methods:

__construct: __construct(string $OPENAI_API_KEY) -> void - Initializes the class with the OpenAI API key and sets default headers
sendRequest: sendRequest(string $url, string $method, array $opts = []) -> bool|string - Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL with given method and options
baseUrl: baseUrl(string &$url) -> void - Modifies the base URL if a custom URL is set
right_result:
<?php

class OpenAi {
    public $engine = "davinci";
    public $model = "text-davinci-002";
    public $chatModel = "gpt-3.5-turbo";
    public $assistantsBetaVersion = "v1";
    public $headers = [];
    public $contentTypes = [
        'application/json' => 'Content-Type: application/json',
        'multipart/form-data' => 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data',
    ];
    public $timeout = 0;
    public $stream_method = null;
    public $customUrl = '';
    public $proxy = '';
    public $curlInfo = [];

    public function __construct($OPENAI_API_KEY) {
        $this->headers = [
            "Content-Type: application/json",
            "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY"
        ];
    }

    public function sendRequest($url, $method, $opts = []) {
        $this->baseUrl($url);
        $curl_info = [
            CURLOPT_URL => $url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
            CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
            CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => $this->timeout,
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
            CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
            CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => $method,
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $this->headers,
        ];

        if (!empty($this->proxy)) {
            $curl_info[CURLOPT_PROXY] = $this->proxy;
        }

        if (isset($opts['stream']) && $opts['stream']) {
            $curl_info[CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION] = $this->stream_method;
        }

        if (isset($opts['headers']) && is_array($opts['headers'])) {
            $curl_info[CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER] = array_merge($this->headers, $opts['headers']);
        }

        if ($method === 'POST') {
            if (isset($opts['content_type']) && $opts['content_type'] === 'multipart/form-data') {
                $curl_info[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = $opts['data'];
            } else {
                $curl_info[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = json_encode($opts['data']);
            }
        }

        $curl = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($curl, $curl_info);
        $response = curl_exec($curl);
        $this->curlInfo = curl_getinfo($curl);
        curl_close($curl);

        return $response;
    }

    public function baseUrl(&$url) {
        if (!empty($this->customUrl)) {
            $url = str_replace('https://api.openai.com', $this->customUrl, $url);
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using cURL for making GET and POST requests, with error handling and resource management.

Class Description: The HttpClient class encapsulates cURL functionality to perform HTTP requests. It includes methods for GET requests, POST requests, and POST requests with download capability. The class handles cURL initialization, option setting, execution, error checking, and resource cleanup.

Methods:

Method1: getCurl(string $url) -> mixed - Performs a GET request to the specified URL and returns the response data. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Method2: postDownloadCurl(string $url, mixed $data) -> array - Performs a POST request with the given data to the specified URL, returns the response as a decoded JSON array. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Method3: postCurl(string $url, mixed $data) -> array - Performs a POST request with the given data to the specified URL, decrypts the response using Faveo private key, and returns it as a decoded JSON array. Throws an exception if cURL is not enabled.

Note: All methods include error handling that returns error messages to the caller when exceptions occur. Each method follows proper cURL resource management by initializing, executing, and closing the cURL session.
right_result:
<?php
class HttpClient {
    public function getCurl($url) {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new Exception('cURL is not enabled');
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new Exception($error);
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    public function postDownloadCurl($url, $data) {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new Exception('cURL is not enabled');
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new Exception($error);
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    public function postCurl($url, $data) {
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            throw new Exception('cURL is not enabled');
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);

        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new Exception($error);
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        $decrypted = $this->decryptResponse($response);
        return json_decode($decrypted, true);
    }

    private function decryptResponse($response) {
        $privateKey = file_get_contents('/path/to/private_key.pem');
        openssl_private_decrypt($response, $decrypted, $privateKey);
        return $decrypted;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP client functionality using cURL for making API requests to Facebook's various domains, with support for handling authentication, error management, and request configuration.

Class Description: The BaseFacebook class provides core functionality for interacting with Facebook's APIs using cURL. It handles request construction, authentication, error handling, and includes utility methods for common operations. The class supports different Facebook domains and manages API credentials.

Attributes:

Attribute1: [array] - $CURL_OPTS - Default cURL options including timeout settings and user agent
Attribute2: [array] - $DROP_QUERY_PARAMS - Query parameters to be removed from requests
Attribute3: [array] - $DOMAIN_MAP - Mapping of Facebook API domains and their base URLs
Attribute4: [string] - $appId - Facebook application ID
Attribute5: [string] - $appSecret - Facebook application secret
Attribute6: [mixed] - $user - Current authenticated user
Attribute7: [mixed] - $signedRequest - Signed request data
Attribute8: [mixed] - $state - Application state
Attribute9: [string|null] - $accessToken - Current access token
Attribute10: [bool] - $fileUploadSupport - Flag for file upload support
Attribute11: [bool] - $trustForwarded - Flag for trusting forwarded headers

Methods:

Method1: [makeRequest]($url, $params, $ch=null) -> [mixed] - Makes an HTTP request using cURL with the specified URL and parameters. Handles errors and SSL certificate verification.
Method2: [_oauthRequest]($url, $params) -> [mixed] - Makes an OAuth-authenticated request by adding access token and app secret proof to parameters before making the request.
Method3: [getAppSecretProof]($access_token) -> [string] - Generates an app secret proof using HMAC-SHA256 for the given access token.
Method4: [errorLog]($msg) -> [void] - Logs error messages, with special handling for CLI environments.
right_result:
<?php
class BaseFacebook {
    protected $CURL_OPTS = array(
        CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT => 10,
        CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
        CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 60,
        CURLOPT_USERAGENT => 'facebook-php-5.0',
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => true,
        CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST => 2,
    );

    protected $DROP_QUERY_PARAMS = array(
        'code',
        'state',
        'signed_request',
    );

    protected $DOMAIN_MAP = array(
        'api' => 'https://api.facebook.com/',
        'api_video' => 'https://api-video.facebook.com/',
        'api_read' => 'https://api-read.facebook.com/',
        'graph' => 'https://graph.facebook.com/',
        'graph_video' => 'https://graph-video.facebook.com/',
        'www' => 'https://www.facebook.com/',
    );

    protected $appId;
    protected $appSecret;
    protected $user;
    protected $signedRequest;
    protected $state;
    protected $accessToken = null;
    protected $fileUploadSupport = false;
    protected $trustForwarded = false;

    public function makeRequest($url, $params, $ch = null) {
        if (!$ch) {
            $ch = curl_init();
        }

        $opts = $this->CURL_OPTS;
        $opts[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = http_build_query($params, null, '&');
        $opts[CURLOPT_URL] = $url;

        curl_setopt_array($ch, $opts);
        $result = curl_exec($ch);

        if ($result === false) {
            $e = new FacebookApiException(array(
                'error_code' => curl_errno($ch),
                'error' => array(
                    'message' => curl_error($ch),
                    'type' => 'CurlException',
                ),
            ));
            curl_close($ch);
            throw $e;
        }
        curl_close($ch);
        return $result;
    }

    protected function _oauthRequest($url, $params) {
        if (!isset($params['access_token'])) {
            $params['access_token'] = $this->getAccessToken();
        }

        if (isset($params['access_token'])) {
            $params['appsecret_proof'] = $this->getAppSecretProof($params['access_token']);
        }

        return $this->makeRequest($url, $params);
    }

    public function getAppSecretProof($access_token) {
        return hash_hmac('sha256', $access_token, $this->appSecret);
    }

    public function errorLog($msg) {
        if (php_sapi_name() != 'cli') {
            error_log($msg);
        } else {
            echo $msg . "\n";
        }
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a PHP class for sending notifications through the Pushover.net API using cURL for HTTP requests.

Class Description: The Notifications_Pushover class implements push notification functionality through the Pushover.net service. It handles authentication, message formatting, and API communication to send notifications with different severity levels.

Attributes:
- token: string - The API token/key for Pushover.net authentication
- user: string - The user key for Pushover.net authentication
- priorities: static array - Mapping of priority levels to their string representations

Methods:
- __construct(string $token, string $user) -> void - Initializes the class with API credentials
- static getName() -> string - Returns the service name "pushover.net"
- static getParameters() -> array - Returns required configuration parameters for the service
- notify(string $message, string $severity = 'info', ?string $event = null) -> void - Sends a notification with the given message, severity level, and optional event title
right_result:
<?php
class Notifications_Pushover {
    private $token;
    private $user;
    private static $priorities = [
        'info' => 0,
        'warning' => 1,
        'critical' => 2
    ];

    public function __construct($token, $user) {
        $this->token = $token;
        $this->user = $user;
    }

    public static function getName() {
        return 'pushover.net';
    }

    public static function getParameters() {
        return ['token', 'user'];
    }

    public function notify($message, $severity = 'info', $event = null) {
        if (!array_key_exists($severity, self::$priorities)) {
            $severity = 'info';
        }

        $data = [
            'token' => $this->token,
            'user' => $this->user,
            'message' => $message,
            'priority' => self::$priorities[$severity]
        ];

        if ($event !== null) {
            $data['title'] = $event;
        }

        $ch = curl_init('https://api.pushover.net/1/messages.json');
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
    }
}

Task Description: The task involves creating PHP functions to interact with a logistics tracking API (kuaidi100.com) to retrieve shipping company information and tracking data for a given tracking number.

Function Description: The code consists of three functions that work together to:
1. Identify the logistics company from a tracking number
2. Retrieve tracking details for the shipment
3. Generate random IP addresses for request headers

Input: 
- For get_company(): A string representing the tracking number ($text)
- For get_data(): Two strings - tracking number ($text) and company code ($com)
- For Rand_IP(): No input parameters

Output:
- get_company(): Returns a string representing the logistics company code
- get_data(): Returns a JSON string containing the tracking information
- Rand_IP(): Returns a string representing a randomly generated IP address

Methods:
1. get_company($text) -> string - Identifies the logistics company from a tracking number by making an HTTP request to kuaidi100.com's autocomplete API and extracting the company code from the response.
2. get_data($text, $com) -> string - Retrieves tracking details for a given tracking number and company code by making an HTTP request to kuaidi100.com's query API.
3. Rand_IP() -> string - Generates a random IP address to be used in request headers for bypassing potential IP-based restrictions.

Note: The functions use cURL for HTTP requests with specific headers and options, including SSL verification disabled, custom user agent, and random IP addresses in headers to mimic browser requests.
right_result:
<?php
function get_company($text) {
    $url = "https://www.kuaidi100.com/autonumber/autoComNum?resultv2=1&text=" . $text;
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, array(
        'Referer: https://www.kuaidi100.com/',
        'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36',
        'X-Forwarded-For: ' . Rand_IP(),
        'CLIENT-IP: ' . Rand_IP()
    ));
    $output = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    $result = json_decode($output, true);
    return $result['auto'][0]['comCode'] ?? '';
}

function get_data($text, $com) {
    $url = "https://www.kuaidi100.com/query?type=" . $com . "&postid=" . $text . "&temp=" . mt_rand() . "&phone=";
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, array(
        'Referer: https://www.kuaidi100.com/',
        'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36',
        'X-Forwarded-For: ' . Rand_IP(),
        'CLIENT-IP: ' . Rand_IP()
    ));
    $output = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    return $output;
}

function Rand_IP() {
    return mt_rand(0, 255) . '.' . mt_rand(0, 255) . '.' . mt_rand(0, 255) . '.' . mt_rand(0, 255);
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that monitors the availability of a URL by periodically checking its HTTP response code until it meets the desired state (available or unavailable) within a specified timeout period.

Class Description: The URLChecker class provides functionality to wait for a URL to become available (returns HTTP 200) or unavailable (returns non-200) within a given timeout period, using cURL for HTTP requests with configurable polling intervals and connection timeouts.

Attributes:
- POLL_INTERVAL_MS: int - The interval in milliseconds between consecutive URL checks
- CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS: int - The connection timeout in milliseconds for each HTTP request

Methods:
- waitUntilAvailable(int $timeout_in_ms, string $url) -> self - Waits until the specified URL returns HTTP 200 status code or throws TimeoutException if not achieved within timeout
- waitUntilUnavailable(int $timeout_in_ms, string $url) -> self - Waits until the specified URL returns non-200 status code or throws TimeoutException if not achieved within timeout
- getHTTPResponseCode(string $url) -> ?int - Private method that makes the actual HTTP request and returns the response code (null if request fails)
right_result:
<?php
class URLChecker {
    const POLL_INTERVAL_MS = 500;
    const CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS = 1000;

    public function waitUntilAvailable(int $timeout_in_ms, string $url): self {
        $start_time = microtime(true) * 1000;
        while (true) {
            $code = $this->getHTTPResponseCode($url);
            if ($code === 200) {
                return $this;
            }
            if ((microtime(true) * 1000 - $start_time) >= $timeout_in_ms) {
                throw new TimeoutException("Timeout waiting for URL to become available");
            }
            usleep(self::POLL_INTERVAL_MS * 1000);
        }
    }

    public function waitUntilUnavailable(int $timeout_in_ms, string $url): self {
        $start_time = microtime(true) * 1000;
        while (true) {
            $code = $this->getHTTPResponseCode($url);
            if ($code !== 200) {
                return $this;
            }
            if ((microtime(true) * 1000 - $start_time) >= $timeout_in_ms) {
                throw new TimeoutException("Timeout waiting for URL to become unavailable");
            }
            usleep(self::POLL_INTERVAL_MS * 1000);
        }
    }

    private function getHTTPResponseCode(string $url): ?int {
        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT_MS, self::CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT_MS, self::CONNECT_TIMEOUT_MS);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_NOBODY, true);
        curl_exec($ch);
        $code = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $code ?: null;
    }
}

class TimeoutException extends Exception {}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class for interacting with Alipay's API to query fund transfer orders, including request signing and HTTP communication functionality.

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides methods to interact with Alipay's payment API, specifically for querying fund transfer orders. It handles request signing, parameter encoding, and HTTP communication using cURL.

Attributes:
- appId: string - The application ID provided by Alipay
- rsaPrivateKey: string - The RSA private key for request signing
- charset: string - The character encoding to use (default: 'utf-8')

Methods:
- __construct(string $appid, string $saPrivateKey) -> void - Initializes the service with Alipay app ID and private key
- doQuery(string $outBizBo='', string $orderId='') -> array - Queries a fund transfer order using either out business number or order ID
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType='RSA') -> string - Generates a signature for the request parameters
- sign(string $data, string $signType='RSA') -> string - Signs the given data using the configured private key
- checkEmpty(mixed $value) -> bool - Checks if a value is empty or null
- getSignContent(array $params) -> string - Prepares the parameter string for signing
- characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) -> string - Converts character encoding if needed
- curlPost(string $url='', mixed $postData='', array $options=[]) -> string - Executes a POST request using cURL
right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    protected $appId;
    protected $rsaPrivateKey;
    protected $charset = 'utf-8';

    public function __construct($appid, $rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function doQuery($outBizNo='', $orderId='') {
        $bizContent = [];
        if (!$this->checkEmpty($outBizNo)) {
            $bizContent['out_biz_no'] = $outBizNo;
        } else if (!$this->checkEmpty($orderId)) {
            $bizContent['order_id'] = $orderId;
        } else {
            throw new Exception('Both out_biz_no and order_id are empty');
        }

        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'method' => 'alipay.fund.trans.order.query',
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA',
            'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
            'version' => '1.0',
            'biz_content' => json_encode($bizContent)
        ];

        $params['sign'] = $this->generateSign($params);
        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do';
        $result = $this->curlPost($url, $params);
        return json_decode($result, true);
    }

    public function generateSign($params, $signType = 'RSA') {
        $signContent = $this->getSignContent($params);
        return $this->sign($signContent, $signType);
    }

    public function sign($data, $signType = 'RSA') {
        $res = "-----BEGIN RSA PRIVATE KEY-----\n" .
            wordwrap($this->rsaPrivateKey, 64, "\n", true) .
            "\n-----END RSA PRIVATE KEY-----";
        openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        return base64_encode($sign);
    }

    public function checkEmpty($value) {
        if (!isset($value))
            return true;
        if ($value === null)
            return true;
        if (trim($value) === "")
            return true;
        return false;
    }

    public function getSignContent($params) {
        ksort($params);
        $stringToBeSigned = "";
        $i = 0;
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if ($this->checkEmpty($v) === false) {
                if ($i == 0) {
                    $stringToBeSigned .= "$k" . "=" . "$v";
                } else {
                    $stringToBeSigned .= "&" . "$k" . "=" . "$v";
                }
                $i++;
            }
        }
        return $stringToBeSigned;
    }

    public function characet($data, $targetCharset) {
        if (!empty($data)) {
            $fileType = $this->charset;
            if (strcasecmp($fileType, $targetCharset) != 0) {
                $data = mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, $fileType);
            }
        }
        return $data;
    }

    public function curlPost($url = '', $postData = '', $options = []) {
        if (is_array($postData)) {
            $postData = http_build_query($postData);
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);

        if (!empty($options)) {
            curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);
        }

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $result;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs HTTP requests using cURL with support for GET/POST methods, custom headers, cookies, and SSL configuration.

Function Description: The function should make HTTP requests to a specified URL with optional cookies and user agent. It should handle both HTTP and HTTPS protocols, with configurable SSL verification. The function should follow redirects (302 status) and return the response data or false on failure. Timeouts should be configurable for connection and request execution.

Input:
- $url: string - The target URL for the HTTP request
- $cookies: string (optional) - Cookie string to be sent with the request
- $useragent: string (optional) - User-Agent header value
- $method: string (optional) - HTTP method ('GET' or 'POST'), defaults to 'GET'

Output:
- Returns: mixed - The response data as string on success (HTTP 200), follows redirects automatically (HTTP 302), or returns false on failure
right_result:
<?php
function httpRequest($url, $cookies = '', $useragent = '', $method = 'GET', $postData = null, $headers = array(), $verifySSL = true, $connectTimeout = 10, $execTimeout = 30) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, $connectTimeout);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $execTimeout);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, $verifySSL);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, $verifySSL ? 2 : 0);

    if (!empty($cookies)) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_COOKIE, $cookies);
    }

    if (!empty($useragent)) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, $useragent);
    }

    if (strtoupper($method) === 'POST') {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        if ($postData !== null) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
        }
    }

    if (!empty($headers)) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    }

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

    if (curl_errno($ch) {
        curl_close($ch);
        return false;
    }

    curl_close($ch);

    if ($httpCode >= 200 && $httpCode < 300) {
        return $response;
    } else {
        return false;
    }
}

It provides methods for making GET and POST requests with basic configuration options and error handling. The class is initialized with a Request object and maintains it as an instance variable.

<?php

class ApiExceptAuthController {
    protected $api_controller;
    protected $request;

    public function __construct($request) {
        $this->request = $request;
    }

    public function callGetApi($url) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        
        if (curl_errno($ch) {
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }
        
        curl_close($ch);
        
        if ($httpCode >= 200 && $httpCode < 300) {
            return $response;
        } else {
            return false;
        }
    }

    public function callPostApi($url, $data) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            curl_close($ch);
            return false;
        }
        
        curl_close($ch);
        
        if ($httpCode >= 200 && $httpCode < 300) {
            return $response;
        } else {
            return false;
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes an HTTP POST request to a specified API endpoint to fetch content using cURL, with appropriate headers and request parameters.

Function Description: The function `curl_pipigaoxiao` initiates a cURL session to send a POST request to the 'http://h5.ippzone.com/ppapi/share/fetch_content' endpoint. It sets necessary headers including Content-Type, Origin, and User-Agent, along with a Referer header. The function sends JSON-formatted POST data containing a post ID and type, then returns the response from the server.

Input: 
- `$id` (string|integer): The post ID to be included in the request payload

Output:
- `$data` (string): The raw HTTP response including headers and body from the API endpoint
right_result:
<?php
function curl_pipigaoxiao($id) {
    $url = 'http://h5.ippzone.com/ppapi/share/fetch_content';
    $headers = array(
        'Content-Type: application/json',
        'Origin: http://h5.ippzone.com',
        'User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.75 Safari/537.36',
        'Referer: http://h5.ippzone.com/pp/post/'.$id
    );
    $postData = json_encode(array('pid' => $id, 'type' => 'post'));

    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);

    $data = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);

    return $data;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that generates placeholder images by downloading them from a remote HTTP server using either cURL or file operations, with various customization options.

Class Description: The Image class provides functionality to generate placeholder images with customizable dimensions, categories, formats, and other visual properties. It handles the download process using either cURL or file operations depending on server capabilities.

Attributes:
- BASE_URL: string - Base URL for the placeholder image service
- FORMAT_JPG: string - Constant for JPG format
- FORMAT_JPEG: string - Constant for JPEG format  
- FORMAT_PNG: string - Constant for PNG format
- categories: array - Available image categories

Methods:
- image(
    string|null $dir = null,
    int $width = 640,
    int $height = 480,
    string|null $category = null,
    bool $fullPath = true,
    bool $randomize = true,
    string|null $word = null,
    bool $gray = false,
    string $format = 'png'
  ) -> string|false - Downloads and saves an image with specified parameters, returning the file path or false on failure
- imageUrl(
    int $width,
    int $height,
    string|null $category,
    bool $randomize,
    string|null $word,
    bool $gray,
    string $format
  ) -> string - Generates the URL for the placeholder image (assumed to exist based on reference code)
right_result:
<?php

class Image
{
    const BASE_URL = 'https://via.placeholder.com';
    const FORMAT_JPG = 'jpg';
    const FORMAT_JPEG = 'jpeg';
    const FORMAT_PNG = 'png';

    protected static $categories = [
        'abstract', 'animals', 'business', 'cats', 'city', 'food',
        'nightlife', 'fashion', 'people', 'nature', 'sports',
        'technics', 'transport'
    ];

    public static function image(
        ?string $dir = null,
        int $width = 640,
        int $height = 480,
        ?string $category = null,
        bool $fullPath = true,
        bool $randomize = true,
        ?string $word = null,
        bool $gray = false,
        string $format = 'png'
    ) {
        $url = static::imageUrl($width, $height, $category, $randomize, $word, $gray, $format);
        $dir = $dir === null ? sys_get_temp_dir() : $dir;
        $filename = md5(uniqid('', true)) . '.' . $format;
        $filepath = rtrim($dir, DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR) . DIRECTORY_SEPARATOR . $filename;

        if (function_exists('curl_exec')) {
            $fp = fopen($filepath, 'w');
            $ch = curl_init($url);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
            $success = curl_exec($ch) && curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE) === 200;
            curl_close($ch);
            fclose($fp);
        } else {
            $success = file_put_contents($filepath, file_get_contents($url)) !== false;
        }

        if (!$success) {
            return false;
        }

        return $fullPath ? $filepath : $filename;
    }

    public static function imageUrl(
        int $width,
        int $height,
        ?string $category,
        bool $randomize,
        ?string $word,
        bool $gray,
        string $format
    ): string {
        $baseUrl = static::BASE_URL;
        $size = $width . 'x' . $height;

        if ($category) {
            if (!in_array($category, static::$categories, true)) {
                throw new \InvalidArgumentException(sprintf(
                    'Unknown image category "%s". Available categories: %s',
                    $category,
                    implode(', ', static::$categories)
                );
            }
            $url = "{$baseUrl}/{$size}/{$category}";
            if ($randomize) {
                $url .= '/' . mt_rand(1, 10000);
            }
        } elseif ($word) {
            $url = "{$baseUrl}/{$size}?text=" . urlencode($word);
        } else {
            $url = "{$baseUrl}/{$size}";
        }

        if ($gray) {
            $url .= '&grayscale';
        }

        $url .= '.' . $format;

        return $url;
    }
}

Function Description: The function uses PHP's cURL functions to make an HTTP request to the specified URL. It configures the cURL session to return the response as a string rather than outputting it directly, follows any redirects, and sets a mobile user agent string to mimic a mobile browser. }
?>

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements Alipay payment integration using cURL for HTTP communication with Alipay's API.

Class Description: The AlipayService class provides functionality to interact with Alipay's payment gateway. It handles payment request creation, signing, and communication with Alipay's API endpoints.

Attributes:
- appId: [string] - The application ID provided by Alipay
- notifyUrl: [string] - The URL where Alipay will send payment notifications
- charset: [string] - Character encoding (default: 'utf-8')
- rsaPrivateKey: [string] - The RSA private key for signing requests
- totalFee: [float] - The total payment amount
- outTradeNo: [string] - The merchant's unique order number
- orderName: [string] - Description of the order

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the class with default charset
- setAppid(string $appid) -> [void] - Sets the Alipay application ID
- setNotifyUrl(string $notifyUrl) -> [void] - Sets the notification URL
- setRsaPrivateKey(string $saPrivateKey) -> [void] - Sets the RSA private key
- setTotalFee(float $payAmount) -> [void] - Sets the payment amount
- setOutTradeNo(string $outTradeNo) -> [void] - Sets the merchant order number
- setOrderName(string $orderName) -> [void] - Sets the order description
- doPay() -> [array] - Prepares and sends payment request to Alipay, returns response
- curlPost(string $url, mixed $postData, array $options) -> [string] - Executes cURL POST request to specified URL
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType) -> [string] - Generates signature for request parameters (implementation not shown in reference code)
right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    private $appId;
    private $notifyUrl;
    private $charset = 'utf-8';
    private $rsaPrivateKey;
    private $totalFee;
    private $outTradeNo;
    private $orderName;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->charset = 'utf-8';
    }

    public function setAppid($appid) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
    }

    public function setNotifyUrl($notifyUrl) {
        $this->notifyUrl = $notifyUrl;
    }

    public function setRsaPrivateKey($rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setTotalFee($payAmount) {
        $this->totalFee = $payAmount;
    }

    public function setOutTradeNo($outTradeNo) {
        $this->outTradeNo = $outTradeNo;
    }

    public function setOrderName($orderName) {
        $this->orderName = $orderName;
    }

    public function doPay() {
        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'method' => 'alipay.trade.page.pay',
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA2',
            'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
            'version' => '1.0',
            'notify_url' => $this->notifyUrl,
            'biz_content' => json_encode([
                'out_trade_no' => $this->outTradeNo,
                'product_code' => 'FAST_INSTANT_TRADE_PAY',
                'total_amount' => $this->totalFee,
                'subject' => $this->orderName
            ], JSON_UNESCAPED_UNICODE)
        ];

        $params['sign'] = $this->generateSign($params, 'RSA2');

        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do';
        $result = $this->curlPost($url, $params);
        return json_decode($result, true);
    }

    public function curlPost($url, $postData, $options = []) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

        if (!empty($options)) {
            curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);
        }

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $result;
    }

    public function generateSign($params, $signType) {
        ksort($params);
        $stringToBeSigned = '';
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if ($v && substr($v, 0, 1) != '@' && $k != 'sign') {
                $stringToBeSigned .= $k . '=' . $v . '&';
            }
        }
        $stringToBeSigned = rtrim($stringToBeSigned, '&');
        $res = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
        if ($signType == 'RSA2') {
            openssl_sign($stringToBeSigned, $sign, $res, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        } else {
            openssl_sign($stringToBeSigned, $sign, $res);
        }
        openssl_free_key($res);
        $sign = base64_encode($sign);
        return $sign;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests using cURL with file writing capabilities, including error handling and response status checking.

Class Description: The timthumb class provides functionality to fetch remote URLs using cURL with controlled file writing, including size limitations and error handling. It falls back to file_get_contents if cURL is not available.

Attributes:
- $curlFH: [resource|false] - File handle for writing cURL response data
- $curlDataWritten: [int] - Tracks the amount of data written during cURL transfer
- $lastURLError: [string|false] - Stores the last URL fetch error message

Methods:
- curlWrite($h, $d) -> [int] - Static callback function for cURL write operation that writes data to file and enforces size limits
  - $h: [resource] - cURL handle
  - $d: [string] - Data to write
  - Returns: [int] - Number of bytes written (0 if size limit exceeded)

- getURL($url, $tempfile) -> [bool] - Fetches content from a URL and saves it to a temporary file
  - $url: [string] - URL to fetch
  - $tempfile: [string] - Path to temporary file for storing the response
  - Returns: [bool] - True on success, False on failure
  - Side effects: Sets $lastURLError on failure, may call set404() or error() methods
right_result:
<?php
class timthumb {
    protected $curlFH = false;
    protected $curlDataWritten = 0;
    protected $lastURLError = false;

    public static function curlWrite($h, $d) {
        $timthumb = timthumb::getInstance();
        $len = strlen($d);
        if($timthumb->curlDataWritten + $len > MAX_FILE_SIZE){
            return 0;
        }
        $written = fwrite($timthumb->curlFH, $d);
        if($written){
            $timthumb->curlDataWritten += $written;
        }
        return $written;
    }

    public function getURL($url, $tempfile) {
        $this->lastURLError = false;
        if(preg_match('/^https?:\/\/[^\/]+/i', $url)){
            if(function_exists('curl_init')){
                $this->curlFH = fopen($tempfile, 'w');
                if(!$this->curlFH){
                    $this->lastURLError = 'Could not open temp file for writing';
                    return false;
                }
                $this->curlDataWritten = 0;
                $ch = curl_init($url);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, CURL_TIMEOUT);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 4);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, 0);
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, array($this, 'curlWrite'));
                $curlResult = curl_exec($ch);
                fclose($this->curlFH);
                $httpStatus = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
                if($httpStatus == 404){
                    $this->set404();
                    return false;
                }
                if($curlResult === false || $httpStatus != 200){
                    $this->lastURLError = curl_error($ch);
                    curl_close($ch);
                    return false;
                }
                curl_close($ch);
                return true;
            } else {
                $img = @file_get_contents($url);
                if($img === false){
                    $err = error_get_last();
                    $this->lastURLError = $err['message'];
                    return false;
                }
                if(!file_put_contents($tempfile, $img)){
                    $this->lastURLError = 'Could not write to file';
                    return false;
                }
                return true;
            }
        }
        $this->lastURLError = 'Invalid URL';
        return false;
    }

    protected function set404() {
        $this->lastURLError = '404 Not Found';
    }

    protected function error($err) {
        $this->lastURLError = $err;
    }

    public static function getInstance() {
        static $instance = null;
        if($instance === null){
            $instance = new timthumb();
        }
        return $instance;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that performs an HTTP request using cURL in PHP, with support for proxy configuration and error handling.

Function Description: The function makes an HTTP GET request to a specified URL using PHP's cURL library. It includes configuration options for handling redirects, timeouts, SSL verification, and proxy settings. The function returns the content of the response or null if an error occurs.

Input: 
- $encUrl: string - The URL to which the HTTP request will be made
- $proxy: string|null - (Optional) Proxy server address if proxy is required
- $proxyAuth: array|null - (Optional) Associative array containing 'user' and 'pwd' keys for proxy authentication

Output: 
- string|null - Returns the response content as a string if successful, or null if an error occurs
right_result:
<?php
function makeHttpRequest($encUrl, $proxy = null, $proxyAuth = null) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $encUrl);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

    if ($proxy !== null) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXY, $proxy);
        if ($proxyAuth !== null && isset($proxyAuth['user']) && isset($proxyAuth['pwd'])) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_PROXYUSERPWD, $proxyAuth['user'] . ':' . $proxyAuth['pwd']);
        }
    }

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        curl_close($ch);
        return null;
    }

    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    curl_close($ch);

    if ($httpCode >= 200 && $httpCode < 300) {
        return $response;
    } else {
        return null;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a function that makes an HTTP POST request to a specified API endpoint using cURL in PHP, with configurable parameters and SSL verification settings.

Function Description: The function sends a POST request to a Taobao API endpoint to convert a Taobao share link (tkl) using provided authentication and configuration parameters. It handles SSL verification and returns the API response.

Input:
- $appkey (string): The application key for API authentication
- $sid (string): The session ID or user identifier
- $pid (string): The product ID or parameter
- $tkl (string): The Taobao share link (tkl) to be converted

Output:
- Returns the raw response from the API as a string, or false if the request fails
right_result:
<?php
function convertTaobaoLink($appkey, $sid, $pid, $tkl) {
    $url = 'https://api.taobao.com/router/rest';
    $postData = [
        'method' => 'taobao.tbk.tpwd.convert',
        'app_key' => $appkey,
        'session' => $sid,
        'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
        'format' => 'json',
        'v' => '2.0',
        'sign_method' => 'md5',
        'pid' => $pid,
        'password_content' => $tkl
    ];

    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        return false;
    }
    curl_close($ch);

    return $response;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that interacts with the Xiami music API to fetch details about songs, albums, or collections using cURL for HTTP requests.

Class Description: The HermitJson class provides functionality to make HTTP requests to the Xiami API and retrieve JSON responses containing music details. It handles different types of requests (song, album, or collection) through a single method.

Attributes: 
[This class has no explicitly defined attributes in the reference code]

Methods:
1: xiami_http(int $type, string $id) -> array|bool - Makes an HTTP request to the Xiami API based on the specified type and ID. Returns the decoded JSON response as an array or false on failure.
   - $type: Integer specifying request type (0 for song, 1 for album, 2 for collection)
   - $id: String containing the ID of the requested item
   - Returns: Array containing the API response data or false if the request fails
right_result:
<?php
class HermitJson {
    public function xiami_http($type, $id) {
        $url = '';
        switch ($type) {
            case 0:
                $url = 'http://www.xiami.com/song/playlist/id/' . $id . '/object_name/default/object_id/0/cat/json';
                break;
            case 1:
                $url = 'http://www.xiami.com/song/playlist/id/' . $id . '/type/1/cat/json';
                break;
            case 2:
                $url = 'http://www.xiami.com/song/playlist/id/' . $id . '/type/3/cat/json';
                break;
            default:
                return false;
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, 10);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_REFERER, 'http://www.xiami.com/');
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/45.0.2454.101 Safari/537.36');
        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($result) {
            return json_decode($result, true);
        } else {
            return false;
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP HTTP client class that handles various types of HTTP requests (GET, POST, DELETE, multipart POST) using cURL, with proper error handling and response processing.

Class Description: The Client class provides static methods to send HTTP requests and process responses. It handles request construction, cURL session management, response parsing, and error handling. The class supports standard HTTP methods and multipart form data for file uploads.

Attributes: (This class has no instance attributes as all methods are static)

Methods:

Method1: get(string $url, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a GET request to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method2: delete(string $url, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a DELETE request to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method3: post(string $url, mixed $body, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a POST request with the given body to the specified URL with optional headers.

Method4: multipartPost(string $url, array $fields, string $name, string $fileName, string $fileBody, string $mimeType = null, array $headers = array()) -> Response - Sends a multipart/form-data POST request for file upload with additional form fields.

Method5: sendRequest(Request $request) -> Response - Internal method that executes the cURL request and returns a Response object. Handles request setup, execution, and response processing.

Method6: userAgent() -> string - Generates a User-Agent string with SDK, system, and PHP version information.

Method7: parseHeaders(string $raw) -> array - Parses raw HTTP response headers into an associative array.

Method8: escapeQuotes(string $str) -> string - Escapes quotes in a string for use in HTTP headers.

Method9: ucwordsHyphen(string $str) -> string - Properly capitalizes hyphenated header names.
right_result:
<?php
class Client {
    public static function get(string $url, array $headers = array()) {
        $request = new Request('GET', $url, null, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function delete(string $url, array $headers = array()) {
        $request = new Request('DELETE', $url, null, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function post(string $url, $body, array $headers = array()) {
        $request = new Request('POST', $url, $body, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function multipartPost(string $url, array $fields, string $name, string $fileName, string $fileBody, string $mimeType = null, array $headers = array()) {
        $boundary = uniqid();
        $headers[] = 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data; boundary=' . $boundary;
        $body = '';

        foreach ($fields as $key => $value) {
            $body .= "--$boundary\r\n";
            $body .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$key\"\r\n\r\n";
            $body .= "$value\r\n";
        }

        $body .= "--$boundary\r\n";
        $body .= "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"$name\"; filename=\"$fileName\"\r\n";
        if ($mimeType) {
            $body .= "Content-Type: $mimeType\r\n";
        }
        $body .= "\r\n$fileBody\r\n";
        $body .= "--$boundary--\r\n";

        $request = new Request('POST', $url, $body, $headers);
        return self::sendRequest($request);
    }

    public static function sendRequest(Request $request) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $request->url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $request->method);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, self::userAgent());

        if ($request->body !== null) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $request->body);
        }

        if (!empty($request->headers)) {
            $headers = array();
            foreach ($request->headers as $key => $value) {
                $headers[] = self::ucwordsHyphen($key) . ': ' . $value;
            }
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        $errno = curl_errno($ch);
        $statusCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $headerSize = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($errno) {
            throw new \RuntimeException($error, $errno);
        }

        $rawHeaders = substr($response, 0, $headerSize);
        $body = substr($response, $headerSize);
        $headers = self::parseHeaders($rawHeaders);

        return new Response($statusCode, $headers, $body);
    }

    public static function userAgent() {
        $userAgent = 'SDK/1.0';
        $userAgent .= ' (' . php_uname('s') . ' ' . php_uname('m') . ')';
        $userAgent .= ' PHP/' . PHP_VERSION;
        return $userAgent;
    }

    public static function parseHeaders(string $raw) {
        $headers = array();
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $raw);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($key, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
                $headers[trim($key)] = trim($value);
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    public static function escapeQuotes(string $str) {
        return str_replace('"', '\"', $str);
    }

    public static function ucwordsHyphen(string $str) {
        return str_replace(' ', '-', ucwords(str_replace('-', ' ', $str)));
    }
}

class Request {
    public $method;
    public $url;
    public $body;
    public $headers;

    public function __construct(string $method, string $url, $body = null, array $headers = array()) {
        $this->method = $method;
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->body = $body;
        $this->headers = $headers;
    }
}

class Response {
    public $statusCode;
    public $headers;
    public $body;

    public function __construct(int $statusCode, array $headers, string $body) {
        $this->statusCode = $statusCode;
        $this->headers = $headers;
        $this->body = $body;
    }
}

Task Description: Implement a PHP class for interacting with the BTCPay payment gateway to create invoices and process payments.

Class Description: The BTCPay class encapsulates functionality for communicating with the BTCPay server API. It handles authentication, request formatting, and response processing for invoice creation.

Attributes:
- config: [array] - Stores configuration parameters including BTCPay server URL, store ID, and API key

Methods:
- __construct($config): [void] - Initializes the class with configuration parameters
  - $config: [array] - Configuration array containing:
    - btcpay_url: [string] - Base URL of BTCPay server
    - btcpay_storeId: [string] - Store identifier
    - btcpay_api_key: [string] - API authentication token

- pay($order): [array] - Creates a payment invoice in BTCPay
  - $order: [array] - Order details containing:
    - total_amount: [numeric] - Order amount in smallest currency unit (e.g., cents)
    - trade_no: [string] - Unique order identifier
  - Returns: [array] - Payment response containing:
    - type: [integer] - Response type identifier
    - data: [string] - Checkout URL for payment

- _curlPost($url, $params): [string] - Internal method for making HTTP POST requests
  - $url: [string] - API endpoint URL
  - $params: [string|false] - JSON-encoded request body or false for empty body
  - Returns: [string] - Raw API response
right_result:
<?php
class BTCPay {
    private $config;

    public function __construct($config) {
        $this->config = $config;
    }

    public function pay($order) {
        $url = $this->config['btcpay_url'] . '/api/v1/stores/' . $this->config['btcpay_storeId'] . '/invoices';
        $params = [
            'amount' => $order['total_amount'],
            'currency' => 'USD',
            'metadata' => [
                'orderId' => $order['trade_no']
            ]
        ];

        $response = $this->_curlPost($url, json_encode($params));
        $responseData = json_decode($response, true);

        return [
            'type' => 1,
            'data' => $responseData['checkoutLink']
        ];
    }

    private function _curlPost($url, $params) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $params);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
            'Content-Type: application/json',
            'Authorization: token ' . $this->config['btcpay_api_key']
        ]);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }
}
