Task Description: Implement a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using Guzzle library, supporting various HTTP methods, request/response handling, and error logging.

Class Description: The Guzzle class is an HTTP client implementation that wraps GuzzleHttp\Client functionality. It supports GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE methods, handles different content types (including multipart/form-data and JSON), manages request/response data, and provides logging capabilities.

Attributes:
- requestArguments: [array] - Stores request parameters including URI, method, parameters, and headers
- requestHeader: [array] - Contains HTTP headers for the request
- responseBody: [string] - Stores the response body content
- responseHeader: [array] - Contains HTTP headers from the response
- responseHttpCode: [int] - HTTP status code from the response
- responseClientError: [string|null] - Stores any client error messages
- responseClientInfo: [array] - Additional client information
- logger: [object|null] - Logger instance for debugging and error logging
- client: [GuzzleHttp\Client] - Guzzle HTTP client instance

Methods:
- __construct([GuzzleHttp\Client|null] $client, [array] $config) -> [void] - Initializes the HTTP client with optional existing client instance and configuration
- request([string] $uri, [string] $method, [array] $parameters, [array] $headers, [bool] $multipart) -> [string] - Executes HTTP request and returns response body
- getResponse() -> [array] - Returns complete request/response information including headers, body, and status code
- setLogger([object] $logger) -> [void] - Sets a logger instance for debugging
- getResponseBody() -> [string] - Returns the response body content
- getResponseHeader() -> [array] - Returns response headers
- getResponseHttpCode() -> [int] - Returns HTTP status code
- getResponseClientError() -> [string|null] - Returns client error message if any
- getResponseClientInfo() -> [array] - Returns additional client information (protected)
- getRequestArguments() -> [array] - Returns request arguments (protected)
right_result:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;
use Psr\Log\LoggerInterface;

class Guzzle
{
    protected $requestArguments = [];
    protected $requestHeader = [];
    protected $responseBody = '';
    protected $responseHeader = [];
    protected $responseHttpCode = 0;
    protected $responseClientError = null;
    protected $responseClientInfo = [];
    protected $logger = null;
    protected $client;

    public function __construct(Client $client = null, array $config = [])
    {
        $this->client = $client ?: new Client($config);
    }

    public function request(string $uri, string $method = 'GET', array $parameters = [], array $headers = [], bool $multipart = false): string
    {
        $this->requestArguments = [
            'uri' => $uri,
            'method' => $method,
            'parameters' => $parameters,
            'headers' => $headers,
            'multipart' => $multipart
        ];

        $this->requestHeader = $headers;
        $options = ['headers' => $headers];

        if ($multipart) {
            $options['multipart'] = [];
            foreach ($parameters as $name => $contents) {
                $options['multipart'][] = [
                    'name' => $name,
                    'contents' => $contents
                ];
            }
        } elseif (!empty($parameters)) {
            if ($method === 'GET') {
                $options['query'] = $parameters;
            } else {
                $options['json'] = $parameters;
            }
        }

        try {
            $response = $this->client->request($method, $uri, $options);
            $this->responseBody = $response->getBody()->getContents();
            $this->responseHeader = $response->getHeaders();
            $this->responseHttpCode = $response->getStatusCode();
            $this->responseClientInfo = [
                'effectiveUri' => $response->getEffectiveUri(),
                'protocolVersion' => $response->getProtocolVersion()
            ];
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            $this->responseClientError = $e->getMessage();
            $this->responseHttpCode = $e->getCode();
            if ($e->hasResponse()) {
                $this->responseBody = $e->getResponse()->getBody()->getContents();
                $this->responseHeader = $e->getResponse()->getHeaders();
            }
            if ($this->logger) {
                $this->logger->error($e->getMessage(), ['exception' => $e]);
            }
        }

        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponse(): array
    {
        return [
            'request' => $this->requestArguments,
            'response' => [
                'body' => $this->responseBody,
                'headers' => $this->responseHeader,
                'http_code' => $this->responseHttpCode,
                'error' => $this->responseClientError,
                'info' => $this->responseClientInfo
            ]
        ];
    }

    public function setLogger(LoggerInterface $logger): void
    {
        $this->logger = $logger;
    }

    public function getResponseBody(): string
    {
        return $this->responseBody;
    }

    public function getResponseHeader(): array
    {
        return $this->responseHeader;
    }

    public function getResponseHttpCode(): int
    {
        return $this->responseHttpCode;
    }

    public function getResponseClientError(): ?string
    {
        return $this->responseClientError;
    }

    protected function getResponseClientInfo(): array
    {
        return $this->responseClientInfo;
    }

    protected function getRequestArguments(): array
    {
        return $this->requestArguments;
    }
}

  - $amount (numeric): Transaction amount to verify

<?php
function verify_nowpayment_transaction($paymentKeys, $hash_id) {
    $api_key = $paymentKeys['nowpayments'];
    $url = "https://api.nowpayments.io/v1/payment/" . $hash_id;
    
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
        "x-api-key: $api_key"
    ]);
    
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    
    return json_decode($response);
}

function verify_nextpay_transaction($paymentKeys, $amount, $payid) {
    $api_key = $paymentKeys['nextpay'];
    $url = "https://nextpay.org/nx/gateway/verify";
    
    $data = [
        'api_key' => $api_key,
        'amount' => $amount,
        'trans_id' => $payid
    ];
    
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    
    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);
    
    return json_decode($response);
}

function verify_zarinpal_transaction($paymentKeys, $Authority, $amount) {
    $merchant_id = $paymentKeys['zarinpal'];
    $client = new SoapClient('https://www.zarinpal.com/pg/services/WebGate/wsdl', ['encoding' => 'UTF-8']);
    
    $result = $client->PaymentVerification([
        'MerchantID' => $merchant_id,
        'Authority' => $Authority,
        'Amount' => $amount
    ]);
    
    return $result;
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class for interacting with the GoDaddy DNS API to manage domain records, including retrieving domains, getting DNS records, and creating/updating records.

Class Description: The GodaddyDns class provides methods to interact with GoDaddy's DNS API. It handles authentication, domain parsing, and various DNS record operations through HTTP requests using cURL.

Attributes:
- accessKeyId: [string] - The API access key ID for GoDaddy authentication
- accessSecrec: [string] - The API secret key for GoDaddy authentication
- DomainName: [string] - The domain name being managed
- Host: [string] - The host portion of the domain (default empty)
- Path: [string] - The path portion of the domain (default empty)

Methods:
- __construct([string]$accessKeyId, [string]$accessSecrec, [string]$domain = "") -> [void] - Initializes the class with API credentials and optional domain name
- getDomain([string]$domain) -> [array] - Static method that parses a domain into its components (self domain, second-level domain)
- curl([string]$url, [array]$header = '', [string]$data = '', [string]$method = 'get') -> [array] - Private method that handles cURL requests and returns response
- getDomains() -> [array] - Retrieves all domains associated with the account
- GetDNSRecord([string]$domain, [string]$record, [string]$recordType = 'TXT') -> [array] - Gets a specific DNS record for a domain
- UpdateDNSRecord([string]$domain, [string]$name, [string]$value, [string]$recordType = 'TXT') -> [array] - Updates an existing DNS record
- CreateDNSRecord([string]$domain, [string]$name, [string]$value, [string]$recordType = 'TXT') -> [array] - Creates a new DNS record
right_result:
<?php
class GodaddyDns {
    private $accessKeyId;
    private $accessSecrec;
    private $DomainName;
    private $Host;
    private $Path;

    public function __construct($accessKeyId, $accessSecrec, $domain = "") {
        $this->accessKeyId = $accessKeyId;
        $this->accessSecrec = $accessSecrec;
        if (!empty($domain)) {
            $this->DomainName = $domain;
            $domainParts = self::getDomain($domain);
            $this->Host = $domainParts['host'];
            $this->Path = $domainParts['path'];
        }
    }

    public static function getDomain($domain) {
        $parts = parse_url($domain);
        $host = isset($parts['host']) ? $parts['host'] : $parts['path'];
        $path = isset($parts['path']) ? $parts['path'] : '';
        $hostParts = explode('.', $host);
        $sld = implode('.', array_slice($hostParts, -2));
        return [
            'host' => $host,
            'path' => $path,
            'sld' => $sld
        ];
    }

    private function curl($url, $header = '', $data = '', $method = 'get') {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $header);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, strtoupper($method));
        if (!empty($data)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, json_encode($data));
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);
        return [
            'code' => $httpCode,
            'response' => json_decode($response, true)
        ];
    }

    public function getDomains() {
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        return $this->curl($url, $header);
    }

    public function GetDNSRecord($domain, $record, $recordType = 'TXT') {
        $domainParts = self::getDomain($domain);
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains/{$domainParts['sld']}/records/{$recordType}/{$record}";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        return $this->curl($url, $header);
    }

    public function UpdateDNSRecord($domain, $name, $value, $recordType = 'TXT') {
        $domainParts = self::getDomain($domain);
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains/{$domainParts['sld']}/records/{$recordType}/{$name}";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        $data = [[
            'data' => $value,
            'name' => $name,
            'ttl' => 600,
            'type' => $recordType
        ]];
        return $this->curl($url, $header, $data, 'put');
    }

    public function CreateDNSRecord($domain, $name, $value, $recordType = 'TXT') {
        $domainParts = self::getDomain($domain);
        $url = "https://api.godaddy.com/v1/domains/{$domainParts['sld']}/records";
        $header = [
            "Authorization: sso-key {$this->accessKeyId}:{$this->accessSecrec}",
            "Content-Type: application/json"
        ];
        $data = [[
            'data' => $value,
            'name' => $name,
            'ttl' => 600,
            'type' => $recordType
        ]];
        return $this->curl($url, $header, $data, 'patch');
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles file downloads using cURL with proper error handling and resource management.

Class Description: The CurlDownloader class provides functionality to download files from a given URL using PHP's cURL library. It manages temporary file creation, download execution, and cleanup of resources. The class includes methods to set a custom temporary directory, perform the download, retrieve the downloaded filename, and clean up downloaded files.

Attributes:
- tempDir: ?string - Optional custom directory for storing temporary files. If not set, uses system temp directory.
- outputFile: ?string - Path to the downloaded file. Null until download is completed.

Methods:
- setTempDir(string $tempDir) -> void - Sets a custom temporary directory for storing downloaded files.
- download(string $url) -> bool - Downloads a file from the specified URL. Returns true on success, throws ErrorException on failure.
- getFilename() -> string - Returns the path to the downloaded file. Throws RuntimeException if called before download().
- cleanup() -> void - Removes the downloaded file if it exists.
right_result:
<?php

class CurlDownloader {
    private $tempDir;
    private $outputFile;

    public function setTempDir(string $tempDir): void {
        if (!is_dir($tempDir) {
            throw new InvalidArgumentException("Directory does not exist: $tempDir");
        }
        if (!is_writable($tempDir)) {
            throw new InvalidArgumentException("Directory is not writable: $tempDir");
        }
        $this->tempDir = $tempDir;
    }

    public function download(string $url): bool {
        if (!filter_var($url, FILTER_VALIDATE_URL)) {
            throw new InvalidArgumentException("Invalid URL provided");
        }

        $tempDir = $this->tempDir ?? sys_get_temp_dir();
        $this->outputFile = tempnam($tempDir, 'curl_download_');

        $ch = curl_init($url);
        if ($ch === false) {
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to initialize cURL");
        }

        $fp = fopen($this->outputFile, 'w');
        if ($fp === false) {
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new ErrorException("Failed to open temporary file for writing");
        }

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FAILONERROR, true);

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

        curl_close($ch);
        fclose($fp);

        if ($result === false || $httpCode >= 400) {
            $this->cleanup();
            throw new ErrorException("Download failed: " . ($error ?: "HTTP $httpCode"));
        }

        return true;
    }

    public function getFilename(): string {
        if ($this->outputFile === null) {
            throw new RuntimeException("No file has been downloaded yet");
        }
        return $this->outputFile;
    }

    public function cleanup(): void {
        if ($this->outputFile !== null && file_exists($this->outputFile)) {
            unlink($this->outputFile);
            $this->outputFile = null;
        }
    }

    public function __destruct() {
        $this->cleanup();
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements OAuth 1.0 authentication for interacting with the Twitter API, handling both GET and POST requests with proper parameter encoding and signature generation.

Class Description: TwitterAPIExchange is a PHP class that provides a convenient way to interact with Twitter's API using OAuth 1.0 authentication. It handles the construction of OAuth signatures, request headers, and performs HTTP requests using cURL.

Attributes:
- oauth_access_token: string - Twitter OAuth access token
- oauth_access_token_secret: string - Twitter OAuth access token secret
- consumer_key: string - Twitter API consumer key
- consumer_secret: string - Twitter API consumer secret
- postfields: array - Data to be sent in POST requests
- getfield: string - Query string for GET requests
- oauth: array - OAuth parameters for request signing
- url: string - API endpoint URL

Methods:
- __construct(array $settings) -> void - Constructor that validates and sets OAuth credentials
- setPostfields(array $array) -> self - Sets POST data and returns instance for method chaining
- setGetfield(string $string) -> self - Sets GET query string and returns instance for method chaining
- getGetfield() -> string|null - Returns current GET query string
- getPostfields() -> array|null - Returns current POST data
- buildOauth(string $url, string $requestMethod) -> self - Builds OAuth signature and parameters
- performRequest(bool $return = true) -> string|void - Executes the API request and returns response
- buildBaseString(string $baseURI, string $method, array $params) -> string - Private method to build base string for signature
- buildAuthorizationHeader(array $oauth) -> string - Private method to build OAuth header
right_result:
<?php
class TwitterAPIExchange
{
    private $oauth_access_token;
    private $oauth_access_token_secret;
    private $consumer_key;
    private $consumer_secret;
    private $postfields;
    private $getfield;
    private $oauth;
    public $url;

    public function __construct(array $settings)
    {
        if (!isset($settings['oauth_access_token'])
            || !isset($settings['oauth_access_token_secret'])
            || !isset($settings['consumer_key'])
            || !isset($settings['consumer_secret']))
        {
            throw new Exception('Make sure you are passing in the correct parameters');
        }

        $this->oauth_access_token = $settings['oauth_access_token'];
        $this->oauth_access_token_secret = $settings['oauth_access_token_secret'];
        $this->consumer_key = $settings['consumer_key'];
        $this->consumer_secret = $settings['consumer_secret'];
    }

    public function setPostfields(array $array)
    {
        $this->postfields = $array;
        return $this;
    }

    public function setGetfield($string)
    {
        $this->getfield = $string;
        return $this;
    }

    public function getGetfield()
    {
        return $this->getfield;
    }

    public function getPostfields()
    {
        return $this->postfields;
    }

    public function buildOauth($url, $requestMethod)
    {
        if (!in_array(strtolower($requestMethod), array('post', 'get')))
        {
            throw new Exception('Request method must be either POST or GET');
        }

        $consumer_key = $this->consumer_key;
        $consumer_secret = $this->consumer_secret;
        $oauth_access_token = $this->oauth_access_token;
        $oauth_access_token_secret = $this->oauth_access_token_secret;

        $oauth = array(
            'oauth_consumer_key' => $consumer_key,
            'oauth_nonce' => time(),
            'oauth_signature_method' => 'HMAC-SHA1',
            'oauth_token' => $oauth_access_token,
            'oauth_timestamp' => time(),
            'oauth_version' => '1.0'
        );

        $getfield = $this->getGetfield();

        if (!is_null($getfield))
        {
            $getfields = str_replace('?', '', explode('&', $getfield));
            foreach ($getfields as $g)
            {
                $split = explode('=', $g);
                $oauth[$split[0]] = $split[1];
            }
        }

        $base_info = $this->buildBaseString($url, $requestMethod, $oauth);
        $composite_key = rawurlencode($consumer_secret) . '&' . rawurlencode($oauth_access_token_secret);
        $oauth_signature = base64_encode(hash_hmac('sha1', $base_info, $composite_key, true));
        $oauth['oauth_signature'] = $oauth_signature;

        $this->url = $url;
        $this->oauth = $oauth;

        return $this;
    }

    public function performRequest($return = true)
    {
        if (!is_bool($return))
        {
            throw new Exception('performRequest parameter must be true or false');
        }

        $header = array($this->buildAuthorizationHeader($this->oauth), 'Expect:');

        $getfield = $this->getGetfield();
        $postfields = $this->getPostfields();

        $options = array(
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $header,
            CURLOPT_HEADER => false,
            CURLOPT_URL => $this->url . ($getfield ? '?' . $getfield : ''),
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 10,
        );

        if (!is_null($postfields))
        {
            $options[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = $postfields;
        }

        $feed = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($feed, $options);
        $json = curl_exec($feed);
        curl_close($feed);

        if ($return) { return $json; }
    }

    private function buildBaseString($baseURI, $method, $params)
    {
        $return = array();
        ksort($params);

        foreach($params as $key => $value)
        {
            $return[] = rawurlencode($key) . '=' . rawurlencode($value);
        }

        return $method . '&' . rawurlencode($baseURI) . '&' . rawurlencode(implode('&', $return));
    }

    private function buildAuthorizationHeader($oauth)
    {
        $return = 'Authorization: OAuth ';
        $values = array();

        foreach($oauth as $key => $value)
        {
            $values[] = "$key=\"" . rawurlencode($value) . "\"";
        }

        $return .= implode(', ', $values);
        return $return;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes an HTTP request to the OpenAI API using cURL, handles the response, and manages potential errors.

Function Description: The function `make_curl_request` initializes a cURL session to interact with the OpenAI API. It sets necessary headers including authentication, configures cURL options for the request, and implements a callback function to handle the response stream. The function processes both successful responses and errors, setting appropriate cookies for error conditions and returning the response data.

Input:
- `$postData` (string) - The JSON-encoded data to be sent in the POST request body.
- `$OPENAI_API_KEY` (string) - The API key for authenticating with the OpenAI API.

Output:
- `$responsedata` (string) - The raw response data from the API, which could be either a successful response or an error message. The function also sets cookies for error conditions when they occur.
right_result:
<?php
function make_curl_request($postData, $OPENAI_API_KEY) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    $url = 'https://api.openai.com/v1/chat/completions';
    $headers = [
        'Content-Type: application/json',
        'Authorization: Bearer ' . $OPENAI_API_KEY
    ];

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $postData);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADERFUNCTION, function($curl, $header) {
        if (strpos($header, 'HTTP/') === 0) {
            $statusCode = explode(' ', $header)[1];
            if ($statusCode >= 400) {
                setcookie('api_error', '1', time() + 3600, '/');
            }
        }
        return strlen($header);
    });

    $responsedata = curl_exec($ch);
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        setcookie('curl_error', curl_error($ch), time() + 3600, '/');
    }
    curl_close($ch);
    return $responsedata;
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that performs an HTTP GET request using cURL with secure SSL verification and returns the response.

Function Description: The function should initialize a cURL session, configure it with appropriate security settings (including SSL verification with a custom CA certificate), set a timeout, execute the request, handle errors, and return the response. The function should properly clean up resources after execution.

Input: 
- $url (string): The URL to which the GET request will be sent

Output: 
- Returns the response from the server as a string if successful
- Returns false if the request fails (though error handling should be implemented separately)
right_result:
<?php
function secureHttpGet($url) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CAINFO, __DIR__ . '/cacert.pem');
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, 10);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 5);

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    if ($response === false) {
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        curl_close($ch);
        return false;
    }

    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    if ($httpCode >= 400) {
        curl_close($ch);
        return false;
    }

    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes HTTP requests to the Heroku API using cURL, with support for various HTTP methods, custom headers, and error handling.

Function Description: The function `HerokuAPI` is designed to interact with the Heroku API by sending HTTP requests. It supports multiple HTTP methods (including PATCH and POST for sending data), sets appropriate headers including authorization, and handles the response. The function includes timeout settings and SSL verification options for secure communication.

Input:
- $method: [string] - The HTTP method to use (e.g., 'GET', 'POST', 'PATCH', etc.)
- $url: [string] - The URL to which the request will be sent
- $data: [string] - Optional. The payload to send with the request (typically for POST/PATCH methods)
- $apikey: [string] - The Heroku API key used for authorization

Output:
- Returns an associative array with two keys:
  - 'body': [string] - The response body from the API
  - 'stat': [int] - The HTTP status code of the response
right_result:
<?php
function HerokuAPI($method, $url, $data = null, $apikey) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    $headers = array(
        'Accept: application/vnd.heroku+json; version=3',
        'Content-Type: application/json',
        'Authorization: Bearer ' . $apikey
    );

    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);

    switch (strtoupper($method)) {
        case 'POST':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        case 'PATCH':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PATCH');
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        case 'PUT':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PUT');
            if ($data) {
                curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            }
            break;
        case 'DELETE':
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'DELETE');
            break;
        default:
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'GET');
            break;
    }

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $status = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    curl_close($ch);

    return array(
        'body' => $response,
        'stat' => $status
    );
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement an OAuth2 client class in PHP that handles HTTP requests for OAuth2 authentication flows, including obtaining authorization codes and access tokens.

Class Description: This abstract class provides a base implementation for OAuth2 client functionality. It includes methods for making HTTP requests and stores OAuth2 configuration parameters. Concrete implementations should extend this class for specific OAuth2 providers.

Attributes:
- version: [string] - OAuth version being used (default: '2.0')
- appKey: [string] - Application/client ID for OAuth2
- appSecret: [string] - Application/client secret for OAuth2
- responseType: [string] - OAuth2 response type (default: 'code')
- grantType: [string] - OAuth2 grant type (default: 'authorization_code')
- callback: [string] - Callback URL for OAuth2 flow
- authorize: [string] - Authorization endpoint URL
- getRequestCodeURL: [string] - URL to request authorization code
- getAccessTokenURL: [string] - URL to exchange code for access token
- apiBase: [string] - Base URL for API endpoints
- token: [mixed] - Stores the access token (null by default)

Methods:
- http: [http](string $url, array $params, string $method = 'GET', array $header = [], bool $multi = false) -> string - Makes an HTTP request using cURL with the specified parameters. Handles both GET and POST methods, with support for multipart POST requests. Returns the response body or throws an exception on error.
right_result:
<?php
abstract class OAuth2Client {
    protected $version = '2.0';
    protected $appKey;
    protected $appSecret;
    protected $responseType = 'code';
    protected $grantType = 'authorization_code';
    protected $callback;
    protected $authorize;
    protected $getRequestCodeURL;
    protected $getAccessTokenURL;
    protected $apiBase;
    protected $token = null;

    public function __construct($appKey, $appSecret, $callback, $authorize, $getRequestCodeURL, $getAccessTokenURL, $apiBase) {
        $this->appKey = $appKey;
        $this->appSecret = $appSecret;
        $this->callback = $callback;
        $this->authorize = $authorize;
        $this->getRequestCodeURL = $getRequestCodeURL;
        $this->getAccessTokenURL = $getAccessTokenURL;
        $this->apiBase = $apiBase;
    }

    protected function http($url, $params, $method = 'GET', $header = array(), $multi = false) {
        $opts = array(
            CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 30,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => 1,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER => false,
            CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST => false,
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $header
        );

        if ($method == 'POST') {
            $opts[CURLOPT_URL] = $url;
            $opts[CURLOPT_POST] = 1;
            $opts[CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS] = $multi ? $params : http_build_query($params);
        } else {
            $opts[CURLOPT_URL] = $url . '?' . http_build_query($params);
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt_array($ch, $opts);
        $data = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($error) {
            throw new Exception('Request Error:' . $error);
        }

        return $data;
    }

    abstract public function getAuthorizeURL($state = null, $scope = null);
    abstract public function getAccessToken($code, $state = null);
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using Guzzle library, with error handling and testing capabilities.

Class Description: The `SupportedApps` class is an abstract base class that provides HTTP client functionality using Guzzle. It handles HTTP requests with configurable timeouts and methods, includes error handling for connection and server exceptions, and provides a testing method to verify API connectivity.

Attributes:
- jar: [bool] - Flag indicating whether to use cookies (not implemented in current code)
- method: [string] - Default HTTP method to use for requests (default: 'GET')
- error: [string|null] - Stores the last error message encountered during request execution

Methods:
- execute($url, array $attrs = [], $overridevars = null, $overridemethod = null) -> [ResponseInterface|null] - Executes an HTTP request to the specified URL with optional attributes, overriding variables and method. Returns the response or null on failure.
- appTest($url, array $attrs = []) -> [object] - Tests the connection to a specified URL, returning an object with status code, status message, and response body. Handles various HTTP status codes with appropriate messages.
right_result:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\ConnectException;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;
use Psr\Http\Message\ResponseInterface;

abstract class SupportedApps
{
    protected $jar = false;
    protected $method = 'GET';
    protected $error = null;

    protected function execute($url, array $attrs = [], $overridevars = null, $overridemethod = null)
    {
        $client = new Client(['timeout' => 15, 'connect_timeout' => 15]);
        $method = $overridemethod ?? $this->method;
        $vars = $overridevars ?? $attrs;

        try {
            $response = $client->request($method, $url, $vars);
            $this->error = null;
            return $response;
        } catch (ConnectException $e) {
            $this->error = 'Connection failed: ' . $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            $this->error = 'Request failed: ' . $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        } catch (\Exception $e) {
            $this->error = 'Error: ' . $e->getMessage();
            return null;
        }
    }

    public function appTest($url, array $attrs = [])
    {
        $response = $this->execute($url, $attrs);
        $result = (object)[
            'status_code' => null,
            'status_message' => null,
            'response' => null
        ];

        if ($response instanceof ResponseInterface) {
            $result->status_code = $response->getStatusCode();
            $result->response = (string)$response->getBody();

            switch ($result->status_code) {
                case 200:
                    $result->status_message = 'OK: Success';
                    break;
                case 401:
                    $result->status_message = 'Unauthorized: Authentication failed';
                    break;
                case 403:
                    $result->status_message = 'Forbidden: Access denied';
                    break;
                case 404:
                    $result->status_message = 'Not Found: The requested resource was not found';
                    break;
                case 500:
                    $result->status_message = 'Internal Server Error: The server encountered an error';
                    break;
                default:
                    $result->status_message = 'HTTP Status Code: ' . $result->status_code;
            }
        } else {
            $result->status_message = $this->error ?? 'Unknown error occurred';
        }

        return $result;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class for interacting with Alipay's API to send red packets (digital cash gifts) with proper authentication and request handling.

Class Description: The AlipayService class encapsulates functionality for sending red packets through Alipay's payment platform. It handles request configuration, signature generation, and API communication while maintaining security through proper certificate and key management.

Attributes:
- appId: [string] - Alipay application ID
- alipayRootCertSn: [string] - Alipay root certificate serial number  
- appCertSn: [string] - Application certificate serial number
- notifyUrl: [string] - Callback URL for payment notifications
- charset: [string] - Character encoding (default: utf-8)
- rsaPrivateKey: [string] - RSA private key for signing requests
- totalFee: [float] - Payment amount
- outTradeNo: [string] - Merchant transaction number
- orderName: [string] - Order description
- userid: [string] - Recipient's Alipay user ID

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the class with default charset
- setAppid(string $appid) -> [void] - Sets the Alipay application ID
- setAlipayRootCertSn(string $alipayRootCertSn) -> [void] - Sets root certificate serial number
- setAppCertSn(string $appCertSn) -> [void] - Sets application certificate serial number  
- setNotifyUrl(string $notifyUrl) -> [void] - Sets notification callback URL
- setRsaPrivateKey(string $saPrivateKey) -> [void] - Sets RSA private key
- setTotalFee(float $payAmount) -> [void] - Sets payment amount
- setOutTradeNo(string $outTradeNo) -> [void] - Sets merchant transaction number
- setOrderName(string $orderName) -> [void] - Sets order description
- setUserId(string $userid) -> [void] - Sets recipient's Alipay user ID
- sendRedPacket() -> [array] - Sends red packet request and returns response
- generateSign(array $params, string $signType) -> [string] - Generates request signature
- sign(string $data, string $signType) -> [string] - Creates cryptographic signature
- checkEmpty(mixed $value) -> [bool] - Checks if value is empty
- getSignContent(array $params) -> [string] - Prepares string for signing
- characet(string $data, string $targetCharset) -> [string] - Handles character encoding
- curlPost(string $url, mixed $postData, array $options) -> [string] - Executes cURL request to API
right_result:
<?php
class AlipayService {
    protected $appId;
    protected $alipayRootCertSn;
    protected $appCertSn;
    protected $notifyUrl;
    protected $charset = 'utf-8';
    protected $rsaPrivateKey;
    protected $totalFee;
    protected $outTradeNo;
    protected $orderName;
    protected $userid;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->charset = 'utf-8';
    }

    public function setAppid($appid) {
        $this->appId = $appid;
    }

    public function setAlipayRootCertSn($alipayRootCertSn) {
        $this->alipayRootCertSn = $alipayRootCertSn;
    }

    public function setAppCertSn($appCertSn) {
        $this->appCertSn = $appCertSn;
    }

    public function setNotifyUrl($notifyUrl) {
        $this->notifyUrl = $notifyUrl;
    }

    public function setRsaPrivateKey($rsaPrivateKey) {
        $this->rsaPrivateKey = $rsaPrivateKey;
    }

    public function setTotalFee($payAmount) {
        $this->totalFee = $payAmount;
    }

    public function setOutTradeNo($outTradeNo) {
        $this->outTradeNo = $outTradeNo;
    }

    public function setOrderName($orderName) {
        $this->orderName = $orderName;
    }

    public function setUserId($userid) {
        $this->userid = $userid;
    }

    public function sendRedPacket() {
        $bizContent = [
            'out_biz_no' => $this->outTradeNo,
            'pay_amount' => $this->totalFee,
            'user_id' => $this->userid,
            'subject' => $this->orderName
        ];

        $params = [
            'app_id' => $this->appId,
            'method' => 'alipay.fund.trans.app.pay',
            'charset' => $this->charset,
            'sign_type' => 'RSA2',
            'timestamp' => date('Y-m-d H:i:s'),
            'version' => '1.0',
            'notify_url' => $this->notifyUrl,
            'biz_content' => json_encode($bizContent, JSON_UNESCAPED_UNICODE),
            'app_cert_sn' => $this->appCertSn,
            'alipay_root_cert_sn' => $this->alipayRootCertSn
        ];

        $params['sign'] = $this->generateSign($params, 'RSA2');

        $url = 'https://openapi.alipay.com/gateway.do';
        $result = $this->curlPost($url, $params, []);
        return json_decode($result, true);
    }

    protected function generateSign($params, $signType = 'RSA2') {
        return $this->sign($this->getSignContent($params), $signType);
    }

    protected function sign($data, $signType = 'RSA2') {
        $res = openssl_get_privatekey($this->rsaPrivateKey);
        if ($res === false) {
            throw new Exception('Invalid private key');
        }

        if ($signType == 'RSA2') {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res, OPENSSL_ALGO_SHA256);
        } else {
            openssl_sign($data, $sign, $res);
        }

        openssl_free_key($res);
        return base64_encode($sign);
    }

    protected function checkEmpty($value) {
        if (!isset($value)) {
            return true;
        }
        if ($value === null) {
            return true;
        }
        if (trim($value) === '') {
            return true;
        }
        return false;
    }

    protected function getSignContent($params) {
        ksort($params);
        $stringToBeSigned = '';
        $i = 0;
        foreach ($params as $k => $v) {
            if ($this->checkEmpty($v) === false) {
                if ($i == 0) {
                    $stringToBeSigned .= "$k" . "=" . "$v";
                } else {
                    $stringToBeSigned .= "&" . "$k" . "=" . "$v";
                }
                $i++;
            }
        }
        return $stringToBeSigned;
    }

    protected function characet($data, $targetCharset) {
        if (!empty($data)) {
            $fileType = $this->charset;
            if (strcasecmp($fileType, $targetCharset) != 0) {
                $data = mb_convert_encoding($data, $targetCharset, $fileType);
            }
        }
        return $data;
    }

    protected function curlPost($url, $postData, $options) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FAILONERROR, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($postData));

        if (!empty($options)) {
            foreach ($options as $key => $val) {
                curl_setopt($ch, $key, $val);
            }
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            throw new Exception(curl_error($ch), 0);
        } else {
            $httpStatusCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
            if (200 !== $httpStatusCode) {
                throw new Exception($response, $httpStatusCode);
            }
        }
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements HTTP scraping functionality using cURL to make requests to a specified URL with query parameters and handle the response.

Class Description: The HttpScraper class extends a BaseScraper and provides functionality to make HTTP GET requests using cURL. It includes timeout configuration and basic error handling for HTTP status codes.

Attributes:
timeout: [int] - The maximum time in seconds the cURL request is allowed to take.

Methods:
request: [Name]([string $url, array $query]) -> [string|null] - Makes an HTTP GET request to the specified URL with the given query parameters. Returns the response body as a string if the request is successful (HTTP 200), or null otherwise.
right_result:
<?php

class HttpScraper extends BaseScraper {
    protected $timeout = 30;

    public function request($url, $query = []) {
        if (!empty($query)) {
            $url .= '?' . http_build_query($query);
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $this->timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

        curl_close($ch);

        if ($httpCode === 200) {
            return $response;
        }

        return null;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a class that handles file downloads using cURL in PHP, with support for temporary file management and cleanup.

Class Description: The CurlDownloader class provides functionality to download files from a given URL using cURL, storing them in a temporary directory, and managing the downloaded files including cleanup operations.

Attributes:

Output:

- For getFilename(): A string representing the path to the downloaded file.
