    public function set_write_stream($resource)
    {
        $this->write_stream = $resource;
        return $this;
    }

    public function set_write_file($location)
    {
        $this->write_file = $location;
        $this->write_stream = fopen($location, 'wb');
        return $this;
    }

    public function set_proxy($proxy)
    {
        $proxy = parse_url($proxy);
        $proxy['user'] = isset($proxy['user']) ? $proxy['user'] : null;
        $proxy['pass'] = isset($proxy['pass']) ? $proxy['pass'] : null;
        $proxy['port'] = isset($proxy['port']) ? $proxy['port'] : null;
        $this->proxy = $proxy;
        return $this;
    }

    public function set_seek_position($position)
    {
        $this->seek_position = $position;
        return $this;
    }

    public function register_streaming_read_callback($callback)
    {
        $this->registered_streaming_read_callback = $callback;
        return $this;
    }

    public function register_streaming_write_callback($callback)
    {
        $this->registered_streaming_write_callback = $callback;
        return $this;
    }

    public function streaming_read_callback($curl_handle, $file_handle, $length)
    {
        if ($this->read_stream_read >= $this->read_stream_size) {
            return '';
        }
        if ($this->seek_position !== null && $this->read_stream_read == 0) {
            fseek($this->read_stream, $this->seek_position);
        }
        $read = fread($this->read_stream, min($this->read_stream_size - $this->read_stream_read, $length));
        $this->read_stream_read += strlen($read);
        return $read;
    }

    public function streaming_write_callback($curl_handle, $data)
    {
        $length = strlen($data);
        $written_total = 0;
        $written_last = 0;
        while ($written_total < $length) {
            $written_last = fwrite($this->write_stream, substr($data, $written_total));
            if ($written_last === false) {
                return $written_total;
            }
            $written_total += $written_last;
        }
        return $written_total;
    }

    public function prep_request()
    {
        $curl_handle = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_URL, $this->request_url);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_FILETIME, true);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_FRESH_CONNECT, false);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_CLOSEPOLICY, CURLCLOSEPOLICY_LEAST_RECENTLY_USED);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 5);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $this->timeout);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, $this->connect_timeout);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_NOSIGNAL, true);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_REFERER, $this->request_url);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, $this->useragent);
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_READFUNCTION, array($this, 'streaming_read_callback'));
        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, array($this, 'streaming_write_callback'));

        if ($this->ssl_verification) {
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);
            if ($this->cacert_location === true) {
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_CAINFO, dirname(__FILE__) . '/cacert.pem');
            } elseif (is_string($this->cacert_location)) {
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_CAINFO, $this->cacert_location);
            }
        } else {
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);
        }

        if ($this->debug_mode) {
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_VERBOSE, true);
        }

        if ($this->proxy) {
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_HTTPPROXYTUNNEL, true);
            $proxy_host = $this->proxy['host'];
            $proxy_host .= ($this->proxy['port']) ? ':' . $this->proxy['port'] : '';
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_PROXY, $proxy_host);
            if ($this->proxy['user'] && $this->proxy['pass']) {
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_PROXYUSERPWD, $this->proxy['user'] . ':' . $this->proxy['pass']);
            }
        }

        if ($this->username && $this->password) {
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_HTTPAUTH, CURLAUTH_ANY);
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_USERPWD, $this->username . ':' . $this->password);
        }

        if (extension_loaded('zlib')) {
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_ENCODING, '');
        }

        switch ($this->method) {
            case 'PUT':
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'PUT');
                if ($this->read_stream) {
                    curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_PUT, true);
                    curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_INFILE, $this->read_stream);
                    if ($this->read_stream_size) {
                        curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_INFILESIZE, $this->read_stream_size);
                    }
                } else {
                    curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $this->request_body);
                }
                break;
            case 'POST':
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_POST, true);
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $this->request_body);
                break;
            case 'HEAD':
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'HEAD');
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_NOBODY, true);
                break;
            case 'DELETE':
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'DELETE');
                break;
            default:
                break;
        }

        if (is_array($this->request_headers) && count($this->request_headers)) {
            $temp_headers = array();
            foreach ($this->request_headers as $k => $v) {
                $temp_headers[] = $k . ': ' . $v;
            }
            curl_setopt($curl_handle, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $temp_headers);
        }

        if ($this->curlopts) {
            foreach ($this->curlopts as $k => $v) {
                curl_setopt($curl_handle, $k, $v);
            }
        }

        return $curl_handle;
    }

    public function process_response($curl_handle = null, $response = null)
    {
        if ($curl_handle && $response === null) {
            $response = curl_multi_getcontent($curl_handle);
        }

        $header_size = curl_getinfo($curl_handle, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
        $this->response_headers = substr($response, 0, $header_size);
        $this->response_body = substr($response, $header_size);
        $this->response_code = curl_getinfo($curl_handle, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->response_info = curl_getinfo($curl_handle);
        $this->response = $response;

        $headers = array();
        $header_text = substr($response, 0, strpos($response, "\r\n\r\n"));
        foreach (explode("\r\n", $header_text) as $i => $line) {
            if ($i === 0) {
                $headers['http_code'] = $line;
            } else {
                list ($key, $value) = explode(': ', $line);
                $headers[$key] = $value;
            }
        }
        $this->response_headers = $headers;

        return $this->response;
    }

    public function send_request($parse = false)
    {
        set_time_limit(0);
        $curl_handle = $this->prep_request();
        $this->response = curl_exec($curl_handle);
        $this->process_response($curl_handle, $this->response);
        curl_close($curl_handle);
        if ($parse) {
            return new $this->response_class($this->response_body, $this->response_code, $this->response_headers);
        }
        return $this->response;
    }

    public function send_multi_request($handles, $opt = null)
    {
        set_time_limit(0);
        $multi_handle = curl_multi_init();
        $handles_post = array();
        $added = count($handles);
        $requests = array();
        $responses = array();

        foreach ($handles as $key => $handle) {
            $requests[$key] = $handle;
            curl_multi_add_handle($multi_handle, $handle);
        }

        do {
            $active = false;
            do {
                $mrc = curl_multi_exec($multi_handle, $active);
            } while ($mrc == CURLM_CALL_MULTI_PERFORM);

            if ($mrc != CURLM_OK) {
                break;
            }

            while ($done = curl_multi_info_read($multi_handle)) {
                $responses[(int) $done['handle']] = $done;
                curl_multi_remove_handle($multi_handle, $done['handle']);
                curl_close($done['handle']);
            }

            if ($active && $mrc == CURLM_OK) {
                if (curl_multi_select($multi_handle, 0.5) == -1) {
                    usleep(100);
                }
            }
        } while ($active);

        curl_multi_close($multi_handle);

        foreach ($responses as $key => $response) {
            $responses[$key] = new $this->response_class(
                substr($response['result'], curl_getinfo($response['handle'], CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE)),
                curl_getinfo($response['handle'], CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE),
                curl_getinfo($response['handle'])
            );
        }

        return $responses;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client using cURL to make HTTP requests, handle responses, and manage redirects while maintaining request details like headers, status codes, and response body.

Class Description: The `File` class represents an HTTP client that uses cURL to make HTTP requests. It handles request execution, response parsing, redirect following, and error management. It implements the `SimplePie\HTTP\Response` interface, providing methods to access response details.

Attributes:

- url: string - The final requested URL after any redirects
- useragent: string - The user agent string used for the request
- success: bool - Indicates whether the request was successful
- headers: array - The response headers from the request
- body: string - The response body content
- status_code: int - The HTTP status code of the response
- redirects: int - The number of redirects followed
- error: string - Any error message encountered during the request
- method: int - The method used for the request (bitmask)
- permanent_url: string - The original URL before any redirects
- permanentUrlMutable: bool - Flag indicating if permanent URL can be changed

Methods:

- __construct(string $url, int $timeout = 10, int $redirects = 5, ?array $headers = null, ?string $useragent = null, bool $force_fsockopen = false, array $curl_options = []) -> void - Initializes the HTTP client, makes the request, and processes the response. Handles redirects recursively.
- get_body_content(): string - Returns the response body content
- get_headers(): array - Returns the response headers
- get_status_code(): int - Returns the HTTP status code
- get_final_requested_uri(): string - Returns the final URL after any redirects
- get_permanent_uri(): string - Returns the original URL before any redirects
right_result:
<?php

class File implements SimplePie\HTTP\Response
{
    protected $url;
    protected $useragent;
    protected $success;
    protected $headers;
    protected $body;
    protected $status_code;
    protected $redirects;
    protected $error;
    protected $method;
    protected $permanent_url;
    protected $permanentUrlMutable = true;

    public function __construct($url, $timeout = 10, $redirects = 5, $headers = null, $useragent = null, $force_fsockopen = false, $curl_options = [])
    {
        $this->permanent_url = $url;
        $this->url = $url;
        $this->useragent = $useragent;
        $this->redirects = 0;

        if (!$force_fsockopen && function_exists('curl_exec')) {
            $this->curl_request($timeout, $redirects, $headers, $curl_options);
        } else {
            $this->fsockopen_request($timeout, $redirects, $headers);
        }
    }

    protected function curl_request($timeout, $max_redirects, $headers, $curl_options)
    {
        $curl = curl_init($this->url);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_HEADER, true);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $timeout);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, $timeout);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, $max_redirects);
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_ENCODING, '');
        curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, $this->useragent);

        if (!empty($headers)) {
            curl_setopt($curl, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }

        foreach ($curl_options as $option => $value) {
            curl_setopt($curl, $option, $value);
        }

        $response = curl_exec($curl);
        $this->status_code = curl_getinfo($curl, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $this->url = curl_getinfo($curl, CURLINFO_EFFECTIVE_URL);
        $this->redirects = curl_getinfo($curl, CURLINFO_REDIRECT_COUNT);
        $this->success = ($this->status_code >= 200 && $this->status_code < 300);

        if ($response === false) {
            $this->error = curl_error($curl);
        } else {
            $header_size = curl_getinfo($curl, CURLINFO_HEADER_SIZE);
            $this->headers = $this->parse_headers(substr($response, 0, $header_size));
            $this->body = substr($response, $header_size);
        }

        curl_close($curl);
    }

    protected function fsockopen_request($timeout, $max_redirects, $headers)
    {
        $this->error = 'fsockopen not implemented';
        $this->success = false;
    }

    protected function parse_headers($header_text)
    {
        $headers = [];
        $lines = explode("\r\n", $header_text);
        foreach ($lines as $line) {
            if (strpos($line, ':') !== false) {
                list($key, $value) = explode(':', $line, 2);
                $headers[trim($key)] = trim($value);
            }
        }
        return $headers;
    }

    public function get_body_content()
    {
        return $this->body;
    }

    public function get_headers()
    {
        return $this->headers;
    }

    public function get_status_code()
    {
        return $this->status_code;
    }

    public function get_final_requested_uri()
    {
        return $this->url;
    }

    public function get_permanent_uri()
    {
        return $this->permanent_url;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class that interacts with the Online-Convert API to handle file conversion jobs, including creating new conversion jobs and checking job statuses.

Class Description: The elFinderEditorOnlineConvert class extends elFinderEditor and provides functionality to interact with the Online-Convert API. It handles initialization, API key validation, and processing conversion requests through HTTP calls using cURL.

Attributes:
- allowed: array - Defines the allowed actions for this editor (init and api)

Methods:
- enabled() -> bool - Checks if the editor is enabled by verifying the API key constant and that Online-Convert isn't disabled
- init() -> array - Initializes the editor and checks for API key and cURL availability
- api() -> array - Main method to handle API interactions with Online-Convert service. Processes both job creation and status checking

Method Details:
1. enabled() -> bool
   - Input: None
   - Output: Returns true if the editor is enabled (API key defined and Online-Convert not disabled)

2. init() -> array
   - Input: None
   - Output: Returns array with API availability status (checks for API key and cURL function)

3. api() -> array
   - Input: (Handled through class properties)
     - category: string - Conversion category
     - convert: string - Target conversion format
     - options: string/array - Conversion options
     - source: string - Source file URL
     - filename: string - Name of the file
     - mime: string - MIME type of the file
     - jobid: string - Job ID for status checking
   - Output: Returns array containing either:
     - API response data
     - Error information
     - Empty array for non-API conversions
right_result:
<?php
class elFinderEditorOnlineConvert extends elFinderEditor {
    protected $allowed = array('init', 'api');

    public function enabled() {
        return defined('ELFINDER_ONLINE_CONVERT_APIKEY') && ELFINDER_ONLINE_CONVERT_APIKEY && !$this->elfinder->getDisabled('onlineconvert');
    }

    public function init() {
        if (!defined('ELFINDER_ONLINE_CONVERT_APIKEY') || !ELFINDER_ONLINE_CONVERT_APIKEY) {
            return array('error' => array('errConf', '`ELFINDER_ONLINE_CONVERT_APIKEY`'));
        }
        if (!function_exists('curl_init')) {
            return array('error' => array('errCurlNo'));
        }
        return array('api' => '1.0');
    }

    public function api($args) {
        $opts = array(
            'category' => '',
            'convert' => '',
            'options' => '',
            'source' => '',
            'filename' => '',
            'mime' => '',
            'jobid' => ''
        );
        $opts = array_merge($opts, $args);

        if ($opts['jobid']) {
            $url = 'https://api2.online-convert.com/jobs/' . $opts['jobid'];
            $method = 'GET';
            $post = '';
        } else {
            $url = 'https://api2.online-convert.com/jobs';
            $method = 'POST';
            $post = array(
                'input' => array(array(
                    'type' => 'remote',
                    'source' => $opts['source']
                )),
                'conversion' => array(array(
                    'target' => $opts['convert'],
                    'options' => $opts['options']
                ))
            );
            if ($opts['category']) {
                $post['category'] = $opts['category'];
            }
            $post = json_encode($post);
        }

        $ch = curl_init($url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, array(
            'X-Oc-Api-Key: ' . ELFINDER_ONLINE_CONVERT_APIKEY,
            'Content-Type: application/json',
            'Accept: application/json'
        ));
        if ($method === 'POST') {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $post);
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        $info = curl_getinfo($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($error) {
            return array('error' => $error);
        }

        if ($info['http_code'] !== 200) {
            $err = json_decode($response, true);
            if ($err && isset($err['message'])) {
                return array('error' => $err['message']);
            } else {
                return array('error' => 'HTTP Error ' . $info['http_code']);
            }
        }

        $data = json_decode($response, true);
        if (!$data) {
            return array('error' => 'Invalid response data');
        }

        return $data;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement a PHP class for interacting with Google Drive API using OAuth 2.0 authentication and cURL for HTTP requests.

Class Description: The Googledrive class provides functionality to authenticate with Google Drive API and make authorized API requests. It handles OAuth 2.0 token management and provides a method for making API calls.

Attributes:

access_token: string - The OAuth 2.0 access token for API authentication
disktag: string - Identifier for the disk configuration
client_id: string - Google API client ID
client_secret: string - Google API client secret
redirect_uri: string - OAuth redirect URI
oauth_url: string - Google OAuth endpoint URL
api_url: string - Google Drive API endpoint URL
scope: string - API access scope
driveId: string - Google Drive ID
error: array - Stores error information if any occurs

Methods:

__construct: [Name](tag: string) -> void - Constructor that initializes the class with configuration values
GDAPI: [Name](method: string, url: string, data: string = '') -> array - Makes an authenticated API request to Google Drive
get_access_token: [Name](refresh_token: string) -> bool - Retrieves and manages access tokens using refresh tokens
right_result:
<?php
class Googledrive {
    public $access_token;
    public $disktag;
    public $client_id;
    public $client_secret;
    public $redirect_uri;
    public $oauth_url;
    public $api_url;
    public $scope;
    public $driveId;
    public $error;

    public function __construct($tag) {
        $this->disktag = $tag;
        $this->client_id = getConfig($tag, 'client_id');
        $this->client_secret = getConfig($tag, 'client_secret');
        $this->redirect_uri = getConfig($tag, 'redirect_uri');
        $this->oauth_url = 'https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/token';
        $this->api_url = 'https://www.googleapis.com/drive/v3';
        $this->scope = 'https://www.googleapis.com/auth/drive';
        $this->driveId = getConfig($tag, 'driveId');
        $this->error = array();
    }

    public function GDAPI($method, $url, $data = '') {
        $headers = array('Authorization: Bearer ' . $this->access_token);
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $this->api_url . $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $method);
        if ($data != '') {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $data);
            $headers[] = 'Content-Type: application/json';
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $this->error = array('code' => curl_errno($ch), 'message' => curl_error($ch));
            return false;
        }
        $http_code = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);
        if ($http_code >= 400) {
            $this->error = array('code' => $http_code, 'message' => $response);
            return false;
        }
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }

    public function get_access_token($refresh_token) {
        $data = array(
            'client_id' => $this->client_id,
            'client_secret' => $this->client_secret,
            'refresh_token' => $refresh_token,
            'grant_type' => 'refresh_token'
        );
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $this->oauth_url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, http_build_query($data));
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if (curl_errno($ch)) {
            $this->error = array('code' => curl_errno($ch), 'message' => curl_error($ch));
            return false;
        }
        $http_code = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);
        if ($http_code >= 400) {
            $this->error = array('code' => $http_code, 'message' => $response);
            return false;
        }
        $response = json_decode($response, true);
        if (isset($response['access_token'])) {
            $this->access_token = $response['access_token'];
            return true;
        }
        $this->error = array('code' => 0, 'message' => 'No access token in response');
        return false;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides a fluent interface for making HTTP requests using cURL, supporting various HTTP methods, request configurations, and response handling.

Class Description: The Httpie class is a fluent HTTP client wrapper for cURL in PHP that simplifies making HTTP requests with method chaining. It supports GET, POST, PUT, PATCH, and DELETE methods, allows setting headers, query parameters, and different body types (raw, JSON, form), and provides options for error handling and response processing.

Attributes:
- method: string - The HTTP method to use for the request (GET, POST, etc.)
- url: string - The target URL for the request
- headers: array - Associative array of HTTP headers
- body: string - The request body content
- curlopts: array - Additional cURL options to set
- nothrow: bool - Whether to suppress exceptions on errors

Methods:
- __construct() -> void - Constructor that checks for cURL extension availability
- get(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for GET requests
- post(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for POST requests
- patch(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for PATCH requests
- put(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for PUT requests
- delete(string $url) -> Httpie - Static constructor for DELETE requests
- query(array $params) -> self - Adds query parameters to the URL
- header(string $header, string $value) -> self - Adds a single header
- body(string $body) -> self - Sets raw request body
- jsonBody(array $data) -> self - Sets JSON request body
- formBody(array $data) -> self - Sets form-urlencoded request body
- setopt(int $key, mixed $value) -> self - Sets custom cURL option
- nothrow(bool $on = true) -> self - Configures error throwing behavior
- send(?array &$info = null) -> string - Executes the request and returns response
- getJson() -> mixed - Executes request and returns parsed JSON response
right_result:
<?php
class Httpie {
    private $method = 'GET';
    private $url;
    private $headers = [];
    private $body;
    private $curlopts = [];
    private $nothrow = false;

    public function __construct() {
        if (!extension_loaded('curl')) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('cURL extension is not available');
        }
    }

    public static function get(string $url): self {
        $instance = new self();
        $instance->method = 'GET';
        $instance->url = $url;
        return $instance;
    }

    public static function post(string $url): self {
        $instance = new self();
        $instance->method = 'POST';
        $instance->url = $url;
        return $instance;
    }

    public static function patch(string $url): self {
        $instance = new self();
        $instance->method = 'PATCH';
        $instance->url = $url;
        return $instance;
    }

    public static function put(string $url): self {
        $instance = new self();
        $instance->method = 'PUT';
        $instance->url = $url;
        return $instance;
    }

    public static function delete(string $url): self {
        $instance = new self();
        $instance->method = 'DELETE';
        $instance->url = $url;
        return $instance;
    }

    public function query(array $params): self {
        $this->url .= (strpos($this->url, '?') === false ? '?' : '&') . http_build_query($params);
        return $this;
    }

    public function header(string $header, string $value): self {
        $this->headers[$header] = $value;
        return $this;
    }

    public function body(string $body): self {
        $this->body = $body;
        return $this;
    }

    public function jsonBody(array $data): self {
        $this->body = json_encode($data);
        $this->header('Content-Type', 'application/json');
        return $this;
    }

    public function formBody(array $data): self {
        $this->body = http_build_query($data);
        $this->header('Content-Type', 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded');
        return $this;
    }

    public function setopt(int $key, $value): self {
        $this->curlopts[$key] = $value;
        return $this;
    }

    public function nothrow(bool $on = true): self {
        $this->nothrow = $on;
        return $this;
    }

    public function send(?array &$info = null): string {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $this->url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $this->method);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);

        if (!empty($this->headers)) {
            $headers = [];
            foreach ($this->headers as $key => $value) {
                $headers[] = "$key: $value";
            }
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }

        if ($this->body !== null) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $this->body);
        }

        foreach ($this->curlopts as $key => $value) {
            curl_setopt($ch, $key, $value);
        }

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $info = curl_getinfo($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        $errno = curl_errno($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($errno && !$this->nothrow) {
            throw new \RuntimeException($error, $errno);
        }

        return $response;
    }

    public function getJson() {
        $response = $this->send();
        return json_decode($response, true);
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client using cURL to send requests to a specified URL and handle the responses, including error checking and resource cleanup.

Class Description: The SpotlightClient class provides functionality to send HTTP requests using PHP's cURL extension. It handles request initialization, option configuration, execution, error handling, and resource cleanup. The class is designed to work with custom Request and Response objects.

Methods:

Method1: sendRequest(Request $request, string $url) -> Response - Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL using cURL. Initializes a cURL session, sets various options including URL, headers, timeout values, and request method, executes the request, and processes the response or errors. Returns a Response object containing the status code and any error messages.

Input Parameters:
- $request: Request - An object containing the request data to be sent
- $url: string - The target URL for the HTTP request

Return Type: Response - An object containing the HTTP status code and any error messages

The method performs the following steps:
1. Checks if cURL extension is loaded
2. Validates request data
3. Initializes cURL session
4. Sets cURL options (URL, headers, timeouts, method, etc.)
5. Executes the request
6. Handles errors if they occur
7. Closes cURL session
8. Returns response with status code
right_result:
<?php

class SpotlightClient {
    public function sendRequest($request, $url) {
        if (!extension_loaded('curl')) {
            throw new \RuntimeException('cURL extension is not loaded');
        }

        if (!$request || !$url) {
            throw new \InvalidArgumentException('Invalid request or URL');
        }

        $ch = curl_init();

        $options = [
            CURLOPT_URL => $url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_HEADER => false,
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
            CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
            CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT => 30,
            CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => 60,
            CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => $request->getMethod(),
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => $request->getBody(),
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => $request->getHeaders()
        ];

        curl_setopt_array($ch, $options);

        $responseBody = curl_exec($ch);
        $statusCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        $error = curl_error($ch);

        $response = new Response();
        $response->setStatusCode($statusCode);
        $response->setBody($responseBody);

        if ($error) {
            $response->setError($error);
        }

        curl_close($ch);

        return $response;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes HTTP requests using cURL with support for various configurations including authentication, custom requests, and proxy settings.

Function Description: The function performs HTTP requests to a specified URL with configurable options. It supports basic authentication, Bearer token authentication, custom HTTP methods, POST requests with JSON payloads, and proxy configuration. The function handles response retrieval and error checking, returning the decoded JSON response.

Input:
- $url (string): The target URL for the HTTP request
- $auth (bool, optional): Whether to use authentication (default: true)
- $customRequest (string, optional): Custom HTTP method (e.g., 'PUT', 'DELETE')
- $postFields (array, optional): Data to send in the request body (will be JSON encoded)

Output:
- Returns the decoded JSON response from the server as a PHP object/array
- Returns null if the response cannot be decoded as JSON
right_result:
<?php
function makeHttpRequest($url, $auth = true, $customRequest = null, $postFields = null) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);

    if ($auth) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPAUTH, CURLAUTH_BASIC);
    }

    if ($customRequest) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $customRequest);
    }

    if ($postFields) {
        $jsonPayload = json_encode($postFields);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $jsonPayload);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, [
            'Content-Type: application/json',
            'Content-Length: ' . strlen($jsonPayload)
        ]);
    }

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);

    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        curl_close($ch);
        return null;
    }

    curl_close($ch);

    $decodedResponse = json_decode($response, true);
    return $decodedResponse !== null ? $decodedResponse : null;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Implement an HTTP client class in PHP using cURL to handle HTTP requests and responses, including error handling and response parsing.

Class Description: Qiniu_HttpClient is a PHP class that provides functionality to execute HTTP requests using cURL. It handles request configuration, execution, error checking, and response parsing. The class is designed to work with Qiniu's API services.

Attributes: 
(None - This class doesn't have any persistent attributes)

Methods:

RoundTrip: RoundTrip($req) -> array - Executes an HTTP request and returns the response and error information. 
Input: 
- $req: An object containing request details (URL, headers, body, etc.)
Output: 
- Returns an array with two elements: 
  1. A Qiniu_Response object containing the HTTP response (status code, body, headers) 
  2. A Qiniu_Error object if an error occurred, otherwise null

getReqInfo: getReqInfo($headerContent) -> array - Helper function to extract request information from response headers.
Input:
- $headerContent: String containing raw HTTP response headers
Output:
- Returns an array with two elements:
  1. reqid: The X-Reqid header value
  2. xLog: The X-Log header value
right_result:
<?php
class Qiniu_HttpClient {
    public function RoundTrip($req) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $req->url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, 1);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, $req->method);
        if (!empty($req->headers)) {
            $headers = array();
            foreach ($req->headers as $key => $value) {
                $headers[] = "$key: $value";
            }
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        }
        if (!empty($req->body)) {
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $req->body);
        }
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $error = curl_error($ch);
        $errno = curl_errno($ch);
        $info = curl_getinfo($ch);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($errno) {
            return array(null, new Qiniu_Error($errno, $error));
        }

        $headerSize = $info['header_size'];
        $headers = substr($response, 0, $headerSize);
        $body = substr($response, $headerSize);
        $reqInfo = $this->getReqInfo($headers);

        $resp = new Qiniu_Response();
        $resp->statusCode = $info['http_code'];
        $resp->headers = $this->parseHeaders($headers);
        $resp->body = $body;
        $resp->reqid = $reqInfo['reqid'];
        $resp->xLog = $reqInfo['xLog'];

        return array($resp, null);
    }

    private function getReqInfo($headerContent) {
        $headers = explode("\r\n", $headerContent);
        $reqid = '';
        $xLog = '';
        foreach ($headers as $header) {
            if (strpos($header, 'X-Reqid:') === 0) {
                $reqid = trim(substr($header, 8));
            } elseif (strpos($header, 'X-Log:') === 0) {
                $xLog = trim(substr($header, 6));
            }
        }
        return array('reqid' => $reqid, 'xLog' => $xLog);
    }

    private function parseHeaders($headers) {
        $headerArray = array();
        $headers = explode("\r\n", $headers);
        foreach ($headers as $header) {
            $pos = strpos($header, ':');
            if ($pos !== false) {
                $key = substr($header, 0, $pos);
                $value = trim(substr($header, $pos + 1));
                $headerArray[$key] = $value;
            }
        }
        return $headerArray;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that extracts article information (title and cover image URL) from a WeChat public article URL using cURL and regular expressions.

Function Description: The function takes a WeChat article URL as input, fetches the HTML content using cURL, then extracts the article title and cover image URL using regular expressions. The cover image URL is processed through a third-party image service (weserv.nl) to get a standardized version. The function returns an associative array containing the extracted information and a success flag.

Input: 
- $url (string): The URL of a WeChat public article (must contain 'mp.weixin.qq.com')

Output: 
- Returns an associative array with these keys:
  - 'title' (string): Extracted article title (empty string if not found)
  - 'cover' (string): Processed cover image URL (empty string if not found)
  - 'success' (bool): True if both title and cover were successfully extracted
right_result:
<?php
function extractWeChatArticleInfo($url) {
    $result = [
        'title' => '',
        'cover' => '',
        'success' => false
    ];

    if (strpos($url, 'mp.weixin.qq.com') === false) {
        return $result;
    }

    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/91.0.4472.124 Safari/537.36');
    $html = curl_exec($ch);
    curl_close($ch);

    if ($html === false) {
        return $result;
    }

    $titlePattern = '/<title.*?>(.*?)<\/title>/i';
    if (preg_match($titlePattern, $html, $titleMatches)) {
        $result['title'] = trim($titleMatches[1]);
    }

    $coverPattern = '/var\s+msg_cdn_url\s*=\s*["\'](.*?)["\']/i';
    if (preg_match($coverPattern, $html, $coverMatches)) {
        $coverUrl = trim($coverMatches[1]);
        if (!empty($coverUrl)) {
            $result['cover'] = 'https://images.weserv.nl/?url=' . urlencode($coverUrl);
        }
    }

    if (!empty($result['title']) && !empty($result['cover'])) {
        $result['success'] = true;
    }

    return $result;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles HTTP requests to the OpenAI API using cURL, with support for different content types, streaming, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: The OpenAi class is designed to interact with OpenAI's API by sending HTTP requests. It manages API keys, request headers, content types, and provides configuration options for timeouts, proxies, and custom URLs. The class supports both JSON and multipart/form-data content types and can handle streaming responses.

Attributes:

engine: [string] - Default engine for API requests (default: "davinci")
model: [string] - Default model for text completions (default: "text-davinci-002")
chatModel: [string] - Default model for chat completions (default: "gpt-3.5-turbo")
headers: [array] - Array of HTTP headers to be sent with requests
contentTypes: [array] - Mapping of content types to their header strings
timeout: [int] - Timeout for cURL requests in seconds (default: 0)
stream_method: [object] - Callback method for handling streamed responses
customUrl: [string] - Custom base URL to override the default API endpoint
proxy: [string] - Proxy server address for requests
curlInfo: [array] - Information about the last cURL request

Methods:

__construct: [function]($OPENAI_API_KEY) -> [void] - Initializes the class with an API key and sets default headers
sendRequest: [function](string $url, string $method, array $opts = []) -> [bool|string] - Sends an HTTP request to the specified URL with given method and options
baseUrl: [function](string &$url) -> [void] - Modifies the URL to use a custom base URL if configured
right_result:
<?php
class OpenAi {
    public $engine = "davinci";
    public $model = "text-davinci-002";
    public $chatModel = "gpt-3.5-turbo";
    public $headers = [];
    public $contentTypes = [
        'application/json' => 'Content-Type: application/json',
        'multipart/form-data' => 'Content-Type: multipart/form-data',
    ];
    public $timeout = 0;
    public $stream_method = null;
    public $customUrl = '';
    public $proxy = '';
    public $curlInfo = [];

    public function __construct($OPENAI_API_KEY) {
        $this->headers = [
            "Content-Type: application/json",
            "Authorization: Bearer $OPENAI_API_KEY"
        ];
    }

    public function sendRequest($url, $method, $opts = []) {
        $this->baseUrl($url);
        $curl_info = [
            'method' => $method,
            'url' => $url,
        ];
        $curl = curl_init();
        $curl_options = [
            CURLOPT_URL => $url,
            CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER => true,
            CURLOPT_ENCODING => '',
            CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS => 10,
            CURLOPT_TIMEOUT => $this->timeout,
            CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION => true,
            CURLOPT_HTTP_VERSION => CURL_HTTP_VERSION_1_1,
            CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST => $method,
            CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS => array_key_exists('postFields', $opts) ? $opts['postFields'] : '',
            CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER => array_key_exists('headers', $opts) ? $opts['headers'] : $this->headers,
        ];
        if (array_key_exists('stream', $opts) && $opts['stream']) {
            $curl_options[CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION] = $this->stream_method;
        }
        if (!empty($this->proxy)) {
            $curl_options[CURLOPT_PROXY] = $this->proxy;
        }
        curl_setopt_array($curl, $curl_options);
        $response = curl_exec($curl);
        $this->curlInfo = curl_getinfo($curl);
        $curl_info['http_code'] = $this->curlInfo['http_code'];
        curl_close($curl);
        return $response;
    }

    public function baseUrl(&$url) {
        if (!empty($this->customUrl)) {
            $url = str_replace('https://api.openai.com', $this->customUrl, $url);
        }
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that implements an HTTP client using cURL for fetching remote resources with proper error handling and resource management.

Class Description: The timthumb class provides functionality to download remote files using cURL with features like progress tracking, size limitations, and fallback to file_get_contents when cURL is unavailable. It handles various HTTP status codes and maintains error state.

Attributes:
- $curlFH: [resource|false] - File handle for writing downloaded data
- $curlDataWritten: [int] - Tracks the amount of data written during download
- $lastURLError: [mixed] - Stores the last error encountered during URL fetching

Methods:
- curlWrite($h, $d) -> [int] - Static callback function for cURL write operations that writes data to file and tracks bytes written. Returns bytes processed or 0 if size limit exceeded.
  - $h: [resource] - cURL handle
  - $d: [string] - Data chunk being written

- getURL($url, $tempfile) -> [bool] - Main method to fetch a URL and save it to a temporary file. Returns true on success, false on failure.
  - $url: [string] - URL to fetch
  - $tempfile: [string] - Path to temporary file for storing downloaded content
right_result:
<?php
class timthumb {
    protected $curlFH = false;
    protected $curlDataWritten = 0;
    protected $lastURLError = false;

    public static function curlWrite($h, $d) {
        $thisObj = timthumb::getInstance();
        $len = strlen($d);
        if($thisObj->curlDataWritten + $len > MAX_FILE_SIZE){
            return 0;
        }
        $thisObj->curlDataWritten += $len;
        return fwrite($thisObj->curlFH, $d);
    }

    public function getURL($url, $tempfile) {
        $this->lastURLError = false;
        if(function_exists('curl_init')){
            $this->curlFH = fopen($tempfile, 'wb');
            if(!$this->curlFH){
                $this->lastURLError = 'Could not open temp file: ' . $tempfile;
                return false;
            }
            $this->curlDataWritten = 0;
            $ch = curl_init();
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $this->curlFH);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 10);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION, array($this, 'curlWrite'));
            curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
            $success = curl_exec($ch);
            if(!$success){
                $this->lastURLError = curl_error($ch);
                fclose($this->curlFH);
                curl_close($ch);
                return false;
            }
            $status = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
            if($status != 200){
                $this->lastURLError = 'HTTP Error: ' . $status;
                fclose($this->curlFH);
                curl_close($ch);
                return false;
            }
            fclose($this->curlFH);
            curl_close($ch);
            return true;
        } else {
            $img = @file_get_contents($url);
            if($img === false){
                $this->lastURLError = 'file_get_contents failed';
                return false;
            }
            if(!file_put_contents($tempfile, $img)){
                $this->lastURLError = 'Could not write to file: ' . $tempfile;
                return false;
            }
            return true;
        }
    }

    private static $instance = null;
    public static function getInstance() {
        if(self::$instance === null){
            self::$instance = new timthumb();
        }
        return self::$instance;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles webhook triggering using Guzzle HTTP client, including formatting headers and payload data, and processing responses or errors.

Class Description: The WebhookService class provides functionality to trigger webhooks by sending HTTP requests to specified endpoints. It handles request configuration, response processing, and error handling.

Attributes:
- client: [Client] - Guzzle HTTP client instance used for making requests

Methods:
- __construct() -> [void] - Initializes the Guzzle HTTP client instance
- triggerWebhook(mixed $data) -> [array] - Sends an HTTP request to the specified endpoint with formatted headers and payload
  Parameters:
    - $data: [mixed] - Contains request details including method, endpoint, headers, and payload
  Returns:
    - [array] - Response status ('success' or 'error') and content or error message
- formatHeaders(array $headers) -> [array] - Formats headers array into key-value pairs
  Parameters:
    - $headers: [array] - Raw headers array to be formatted
  Returns:
    - [array] - Formatted headers as key-value pairs
- formatPayload($payload) -> [array|string] - Formats payload data into key-value pairs
  Parameters:
    - $payload: [mixed] - Raw payload data to be formatted
  Returns:
    - [array|string] - Formatted payload as key-value pairs or original string if not array
right_result:
<?php

use GuzzleHttp\Client;
use GuzzleHttp\Exception\RequestException;

class WebhookService {
    private $client;

    public function __construct() {
        $this->client = new Client();
    }

    public function triggerWebhook($data) {
        try {
            $method = $data['method'] ?? 'POST';
            $endpoint = $data['endpoint'] ?? '';
            $headers = $this->formatHeaders($data['headers'] ?? []);
            $payload = $this->formatPayload($data['payload'] ?? []);

            $response = $this->client->request($method, $endpoint, [
                'headers' => $headers,
                'json' => $payload
            ]);

            return [
                'status' => 'success',
                'content' => json_decode($response->getBody(), true)
            ];
        } catch (RequestException $e) {
            return [
                'status' => 'error',
                'message' => $e->getMessage(),
                'response' => $e->hasResponse() ? json_decode($e->getResponse()->getBody(), true) : null
            ];
        }
    }

    private function formatHeaders($headers) {
        $formatted = [];
        foreach ($headers as $key => $value) {
            $formatted[$key] = $value;
        }
        return $formatted;
    }

    private function formatPayload($payload) {
        if (is_array($payload)) {
            $formatted = [];
            foreach ($payload as $key => $value) {
                $formatted[$key] = $value;
            }
            return $formatted;
        }
        return $payload;
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that retrieves a website's favicon.ico file from a given URL, caches it locally with a specified expiration time, and falls back to a default icon if retrieval fails or the file is not an image.

Function Description: The function attempts to fetch a favicon.ico file from a website URL, saves it to a local cache directory, and serves it with proper caching headers. If the remote favicon cannot be retrieved (invalid response, non-image content, or timeout), it falls back to a default icon. The function handles all HTTP operations via cURL and includes proper error checking and resource cleanup.

Input:
- $url: (string) The base URL of the website from which to fetch the favicon
- $cache_time: (int) Duration in seconds for which the cached favicon should be considered valid
- $default_ico: (string) Path to the default favicon file to use when retrieval fails
- $basename: (string, optional) Name of the favicon file to look for (default: "favicon.ico")

Output:
- The function outputs the favicon contents directly to the browser with appropriate headers
- No explicit return value (void function)
- Side effects: Creates/updates cache files in the designated cache directory
right_result:
<?php
function serveFavicon($url, $cache_time, $default_ico, $basename = 'favicon.ico') {
    $cache_dir = sys_get_temp_dir() . '/favicon_cache';
    if (!file_exists($cache_dir)) {
        mkdir($cache_dir, 0755, true);
    }

    $parsed_url = parse_url($url);
    $domain = isset($parsed_url['host']) ? $parsed_url['host'] : md5($url);
    $cache_file = $cache_dir . '/' . $domain . '_' . $basename;

    if (file_exists($cache_file) && (time() - filemtime($cache_file) < $cache_time)) {
        header('Content-Type: image/x-icon');
        header('Cache-Control: public, max-age=' . $cache_time);
        readfile($cache_file);
        return;
    }

    $favicon_url = rtrim($url, '/') . '/' . ltrim($basename, '/');
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $favicon_url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 5);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CONNECTTIMEOUT, 5);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 10);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_USERAGENT, 'Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; FaviconFetcher)');
    $data = curl_exec($ch);
    $http_code = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
    $content_type = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_CONTENT_TYPE);
    curl_close($ch);

    if ($http_code == 200 && $data && strpos($content_type, 'image/') !== false) {
        file_put_contents($cache_file, $data);
        header('Content-Type: image/x-icon');
        header('Cache-Control: public, max-age=' . $cache_time);
        echo $data;
    } else {
        header('Content-Type: image/x-icon');
        header('Cache-Control: public, max-age=' . $cache_time);
        readfile($default_ico);
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that provides HTTP client functionality using cURL for making GET requests and downloading files from URLs.

Class Description: The HttpClient class encapsulates cURL functionality to perform HTTP GET requests and file downloads. It provides static methods for simple URL fetching and file downloading with proper error handling and resource management.

Attributes: (This class doesn't have any attributes as it only contains static methods)

Methods:

Method1: urlGet(string $url, bool $follow_location = true, int $timeout = 10) -> string|bool - Performs a GET request to the specified URL. Follows redirects by default and allows setting a timeout. Returns the response content or throws an exception on error.

Method2: fileGet(string $url, string $target) -> string|bool - Downloads a file from the specified URL and saves it to the target location. Returns the output or throws an exception on error. Uses a longer default timeout for file downloads.
right_result:
<?php
class HttpClient {
    public static function urlGet(string $url, bool $follow_location = true, int $timeout = 10) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, $follow_location);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, $timeout);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if ($response === false) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new Exception("cURL error: " . $error);
        }

        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        if ($httpCode >= 400) {
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new Exception("HTTP error: " . $httpCode);
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    public static function fileGet(string $url, string $target) {
        $fp = fopen($target, 'w+');
        if ($fp === false) {
            throw new Exception("Unable to open target file for writing");
        }

        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FILE, $fp);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 300);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, false);

        $result = curl_exec($ch);
        if ($result === false) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            fclose($fp);
            unlink($target);
            throw new Exception("cURL error: " . $error);
        }

        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        if ($httpCode >= 400) {
            curl_close($ch);
            fclose($fp);
            unlink($target);
            throw new Exception("HTTP error: " . $httpCode);
        }

        curl_close($ch);
        fclose($fp);
        return $target;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class that handles communication with a backend service through HTTP requests using cURL, supporting operations for task management.

Class Description: The BackendService class provides methods to interact with a backend API for task management operations. It handles HTTP communication using cURL with proper error handling and response processing.

Attributes:
- None (Uses environment variables for configuration)

Methods:
- addTask(string $id) -> array - Sends a request to add a task with the given ID to the backend service. Returns an array with status and message.
- restartTask(string $id) -> array - Sends a request to restart a task with the given ID on the backend service. Returns an array with status and message.
- removeTask(string $id) -> array - Sends a request to remove a task with the given ID from the backend service. Returns an array with status and message.
- setCurl(string $backendUrl, string $backendToken, string $operation, string $id) -> array - Internal method that handles the cURL request setup, execution, and response processing. Returns an array with status and message.
right_result:
<?php

class BackendService {
    private function setCurl($backendUrl, $backendToken, $operation, $id) {
        $ch = curl_init();
        $url = $backendUrl . '/' . $operation . '/' . $id;
        $headers = [
            'Authorization: Bearer ' . $backendToken,
            'Content-Type: application/json'
        ];

        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, $headers);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_CUSTOMREQUEST, 'POST');

        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        $httpCode = curl_getinfo($ch, CURLINFO_HTTP_CODE);
        curl_close($ch);

        if ($httpCode !== 200) {
            return ['status' => 'error', 'message' => 'Backend service error'];
        }

        $decodedResponse = json_decode($response, true);
        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            return ['status' => 'error', 'message' => 'Invalid response from backend'];
        }

        return $decodedResponse;
    }

    public function addTask($id) {
        $backendUrl = getenv('BACKEND_URL');
        $backendToken = getenv('BACKEND_TOKEN');
        return $this->setCurl($backendUrl, $backendToken, 'add', $id);
    }

    public function restartTask($id) {
        $backendUrl = getenv('BACKEND_URL');
        $backendToken = getenv('BACKEND_TOKEN');
        return $this->setCurl($backendUrl, $backendToken, 'restart', $id);
    }

    public function removeTask($id) {
        $backendUrl = getenv('BACKEND_URL');
        $backendToken = getenv('BACKEND_TOKEN');
        return $this->setCurl($backendUrl, $backendToken, 'remove', $id);
    }
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP function that makes HTTP requests using cURL with support for both HTTP and HTTPS protocols, including basic SSL verification handling and custom headers.

Function Description: The function should initialize a cURL session, configure it with the provided URL, set appropriate options for request handling (including SSL verification when needed), execute the request, handle potential errors, and return the response. The function should automatically detect HTTPS URLs and adjust SSL verification accordingly.

Input: 
- $url (string): The target URL for the HTTP request (can be HTTP or HTTPS)

Output:
- Returns the response body as a string if the request is successful
- Returns false if the request fails (though error handling could be enhanced in a production environment)
right_result:
<?php
function makeHttpRequest($url) {
    $ch = curl_init();
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_FOLLOWLOCATION, true);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_MAXREDIRS, 10);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_TIMEOUT, 30);
    curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_HEADER, false);

    if (strpos($url, 'https://') === 0) {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 2);
    } else {
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYHOST, 0);
    }

    $response = curl_exec($ch);
    if (curl_errno($ch)) {
        curl_close($ch);
        return false;
    }
    curl_close($ch);
    return $response;
}

Instruction:
Task Description: Create a PHP class that interacts with Google Translate's unofficial API to translate text between languages.

Class Description: The GoogleTranslate class provides functionality to translate text from a source language to a target language using Google's translation service. It handles the HTTP request/response cycle and processes the JSON response to extract the translated text.

Attributes: None (This is a static utility class with no instance attributes)

Methods:

Method1: translate(string $source, string $target, string $text) -> string - Translates the given text from the source language to the target language. Throws an exception if the input text exceeds 9000 characters.

Method2: requestTranslation(string $source, string $target, string $text) -> string - Makes an HTTP POST request to Google Translate's API with the specified parameters and returns the raw JSON response. Handles cURL initialization, option setting, execution, and cleanup.

Method3: getSentencesFromJSON(string $json) -> string - Parses the JSON response from Google Translate and extracts the translated sentences, concatenating them into a single string.
right_result:
<?php
class GoogleTranslate {
    public static function translate(string $source, string $target, string $text): string {
        if (strlen($text) > 9000) {
            throw new Exception('Input text exceeds maximum length of 9000 characters');
        }
        $json = self::requestTranslation($source, $target, $text);
        return self::getSentencesFromJSON($json);
    }

    private static function requestTranslation(string $source, string $target, string $text): string {
        $url = 'https://translate.googleapis.com/translate_a/single';
        $fields = [
            'client' => 'gtx',
            'sl' => $source,
            'tl' => $target,
            'dt' => 't',
            'q' => $text
        ];
        $query = http_build_query($fields);
        $ch = curl_init();
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_URL, $url);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POST, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, $query);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_RETURNTRANSFER, true);
        curl_setopt($ch, CURLOPT_SSL_VERIFYPEER, false);
        $response = curl_exec($ch);
        if ($response === false) {
            $error = curl_error($ch);
            curl_close($ch);
            throw new Exception("cURL error: $error");
        }
        curl_close($ch);
        return $response;
    }

    private static function getSentencesFromJSON(string $json): string {
        $data = json_decode($json, true);
        if (json_last_error() !== JSON_ERROR_NONE) {
            throw new Exception('Failed to decode JSON response');
        }
        if (!isset($data[0])) {
            throw new Exception('Invalid JSON response format');
        }
        $translatedText = '';
        foreach ($data[0] as $sentence) {
            if (isset($sentence[0])) {
                $translatedText .= $sentence[0];
            }
        }
        return $translatedText;
    }
}

Task Description: Create a PHP class for handling HTTP requests using cURL with support for various HTTP methods, streaming, authentication, and proxy configuration.

Class Description: BCS_RequestCore is a comprehensive HTTP client class that provides a flexible interface for making HTTP requests using PHP's cURL extension. It supports all major HTTP methods (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, HEAD), handles authentication, proxy configuration, streaming uploads/downloads, and provides detailed response information.

Attributes:

request_url: [string] - The URL to send the request to

username: [string|null] - Username for authentication

Methods:

__construct([string|null] $url, [array|null] $proxy, [array|null] $helpers) -> [self] - Initializes the request object with optional URL, proxy, and helper classes
__destruct() -> [self] - Cleans up any open file handles
set_credentials([string] $user, [string] $pass) -> [self] - Sets authentication credentials
add_header([string] $key, [string] $value) -> [self] - Adds a request header
remove_header([string] $key) -> [self] - Removes a request header

set_read_stream([resource] $resource, [int|null] $size) -> [self] - Sets the read stream resource

register_streaming_write_callback([callable] $callback) -> [self] - Registers a streaming write callback
streaming_read_callback([resource] $curl_handle, [resource] $file_handle, [int] $length) -> [string] - Callback for reading from stream

prep_request() -> [resource] - Prepares and returns a cURL handle
process_response([resource|null] $curl_handle, [string|null] $response) -> [mixed] - Processes the cURL response
